Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Simon958
Reviews.Content: We stayed for six nights in February/March. A top class hotel in a great location. Paris is not renown for cheap hotels but we felt it was very good value for the standard of accomodation provided. The hotel is just opposite the Luxembourg Gardens a must see attraction to watch Parisians at play (even in early spring). Paris is a lot more compact than is apparent from the tourist maps and many of the great attractions are an easy walk away. We found the staff invariably friendly and helpful. Their restaurant recommendations seemed spot on - excellent food at reasonable prices seemed to be the guiding principle. As a slight caveat while the breakfast room is charming (and the food and coffee fine), there are many cheaper options outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Clean, Convenient & Comfy”
Reviews.Author: Maggie K
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at Hotel Luxembourg Parc in February and thoroughly enjoyed our stay! I would describe the hotel as charming, clean, convenient and comfortable. It was my first trip to Paris, and the location of the hotel made it extremely convenient to walk to several of the must-see sites. It's located on a quiet street, and there is a nearby metro station. The staff was so polite and helpful. My husband had a bad cold, and they recommended the type of medicine to get and showed us to a nearby pharmacy. Cecilia even made him a special tea when we'd come back from sightseeing. We ate breakfast there almost every day because it was convenient with plenty of good offerings from yogurt, cereal, fruit and delicious pastries from Gérard Mulot, Patisserie to yummy fromage omelets! The bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom was beautiful and clean with marble and updated fixtures. We spent more time in the room than we normally would have due to my husband being under the weather, and it wasn’t much of a sacrifice due to the lovely accommodations. We would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in first class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leslie-dunbars
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, friendly, helpful staff and great location. Myself and my partner stayed here for a couple of nights. Everything was perfect, the room was spotless with a large terrace, a real treat in a city location. Would definitely stay again and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel--Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: alexcharles2010
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay somewhere that the service is first class, then this is the place! My husband and I had never been to Paris and we booked by way of TripAdvisor's recommendations. The room was so clean, the shower was something I looked forward to every day and then there was the hotel staff. Everytime we turned around, they were printing maps and telling us where to eat (the best in Paris). They handled everything we needed. Being first timers, this was the place to stay. The only suggestion that I would have is not to order a cab from the hotel (not hotel's fault) but they charge from the moment that the call is made. When we got in the cab, we owed 15 euros before we even got started on our destination! The breakfast in the hotel is continential-style, and 15 euros per person, but the area where the breakfast is, is enchanting and made it worth the money! I loved the french cleaning ladies too--they did an excellent job. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Short stay well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: bimbobaggins
Reviews.Content: Frist impressions are small, but very friendly hotel. Staff very friendly and very helpful. Facilities excellent. Rooms are first class and my wife was most impressed. Would recommend this hotel to all family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting on the Left Bank”
Reviews.Author: awall73
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful place to stay. Everyone was fantastic! We arrived in the rain and were quickly helped with our luggage by the most lovely young woman who actually lugged it all up with a smile. The hotel was perfect! Very classy and well appointed. The breakfast staff was jolly on the spot and knew we Americans drank a big cup of coffee as opposed to an expresso for breakfast. The location is an easy walk to everywhere on the left bank and Laurent, our bartender was there every late afternoon to make our drink and reservations at the most delicious restaurants. The hotel feels like you are spending time with friends. I couldn't recommend it more highly....

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Beto1703
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel! The location, the room, the service... You can't ask more. Thanks to the entire staff for their patience and their kindness. The hotel is close to many lovely french restaurants that the reception staff seems to know pretty well. You just need to let them know what do you want and they will take care of everything. Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carlos S
Reviews.Content: I stood in this lovely hotel for a few days last december. The service over there is outstanding, every guest is treated like a king. The reception staff is always wiling to help even if you come with specilas reauest many times. The rooms are lovely and clean. There is no way i will stay somewhere else in my next Paris trip

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: William b
Reviews.Content: Just left and our stay was fantastic. Staff very helpful and welcoming. Hotel well situated and extremely clean. The bathroom was very large: two sinks and railnhead shower. Extremely cold weather during our stay and the room temperature and hot water were great. Special thanks to Jules who mans the desk overnight. Great guy and great conversation over a cocktail at the bar. The breakfast room was very scenic and nice to have coffee, fruit, pastries etc. Can also be served in your room. Eggs were a minimal additional cost. We wouldn't hesitate to return. Car service by "Amadeus" was exceptional. Set up thru hotel. Great reviews on Trip Advisor were right on!

Reviews.Title: “charming and centrally situated”
Reviews.Author: Eliane_60
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff, beautiful rooms, perfectly appointed and spotless, a nice breakfast with cheeses, freshly squeezed juices and fruits, wonderful location in Saint Germain. A jewel in Paris. Will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Classy!”
Reviews.Author: Guru57
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Hotel Luxembourg Parc on our recent trip to Paris this January. This is our 2nd stay at this wonderful hotel, a stones throw from Jardin Luxembourg and 10 minutes from lively Saint Germain. We had booked a classic room but were graciously upgraded to a deluxe; a far roomier and comfortable option. The reception staff is helpful and makes you feel very welcome. I would definitely stay again and recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “A Parisien Jewel”
Reviews.Author: helena g
Reviews.Content: Thank you Cecile and colleagues for your efficient, warm and professional hospitality. This gorgeous hotel is a jewel.Brilliant location, spankingly clean, great coffee and personal. We had a great dinner in a family run restaurant across the cobbled street, La cuisine de Philippe, and around the corner , La Renoir_ served us a wonderful lunch. It doe not get much better

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Weekend Venue”
Reviews.Author: Sarah R
Reviews.Content: Just spent a superb weekend exploring Paris from the Hotel Luxembourg Parc. Beautifully clean hotel with friendly, discreet staff. Ideally located near a number of metro stations and in walking distance of some excellent restaurants and cafes. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Tippmom
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a great Paris location. Very easy access from Charles De Gaulle airport, the hotel really is only about a 5 minute walk from the Luxembourg station (saves a fortune on taxi fares). We booked a superior room overlooking the park - worth the extra for a lovely view. The only negative was that we had 2 singles pushed together rather than a double. At â‚¬15 each breakfast is well worth it if, like me you enjoy more than one coffee in the morning, a coffee & sandwich in a local cafe will cost â‚¬8 - â‚¬9. Highly recommend this hotel for a Paris break.

Reviews.Title: “Good friendly B&B type hotel”
Reviews.Author: Phil068
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. We stayed here for two days in January and felt very comfortable. Probably the best thing about it is the location. Next to the fabulous Luxembourg Park, on the south side of the river. On the luxembourg side is a nice quiet district dominated by the Park ; other the other side of the hotel towards the river is my favourite part of Paris - full of narrow bustling streets, restaurants and high-end shops. The hotel is comfortable. Beds were very comfortable. Decor is ok - slightly grannified but nice. Don't expect original PArisian furntiture but it looked pretty good. Rooms are average size. We booked an Exec room which is the highest price room and it was "nice" but not outstanding. It grew on me. The service is excellent from everyone. Nice people, very helpful. Breakkfast again is nice but not brilliant. Be nice if they cooked omelettes or something similar like other hotels in Paris not to add a little something. Its help youself buffet. The tv is our room was on the blink but being very picky here. This is a nice little hotel run by nice people.

Reviews.Title: “Little haven”
Reviews.Author: TravellerfromOz08
Reviews.Content: We commenced our stay in Paris at a ridiculously expensive hotel that charged for wifi on top of their high rate. We felt depressed every time we paid $18AU for a cup of coffee. We decided after 2 days to place our faith in TripAdvisor and just move to something rated well. And how lucky we were to find Hotel Luxembourg Parc. It is a small boutique hotel, reasonably priced (for Paris) located near great sights and great shopping. The staff are incredibly friendly and approachable (not always a common thing in Paris) and the rooms are very well thought out. There is nothing lacking in the rooms with the bathroom being surprisingly roomy. They can't do enough for you and even looked after some extra luggage while we travelled to Switzerland for a few days which was much appreciated. They service the rooms twice a day - the only fault was that when we put a Do Not Disturb sign on the room and came back to find it cleaned anyway. They said they feel that guests might "forget" when they leave the sign on when they go out. That wasn't the case, we had laid out some maps etc and didn't want anything touched. Please respect the Do Not Disturb sign for all guests. If they forget, then it's their issue. Extra special thank you to Xavier who is the fastest, most efficient person you could meet and for his young age knows everything you'll need to know and more! Thank you for letting us ask you millions of questions and answering everything helpfully!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Margarita G
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at this lovely small hotel since we read about it in a magazine article in 2003. The hotel's location, across from the Luxembourg gardens, is ideal, and the helpful staff is the best. We love the quiet rooms, the breakfast and the very practical bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: tifloyd
Reviews.Content: After reviewing Trip Advisor for hotel recommendations, we chose the Hotel Luxembourg Parc for our week long stay in Paris. We were not disappointed! We LOVED this hotel and the pictures posted do not do it justice. This hotel was beautiful, clean, cozy, comfortable, and has great service. It was the perfect little boutique hotel that I was looking to stay in to celebrate my birthday and New Year's Eve in Paris. The staff were incredibly kind, helpful, and even helped me with my french when I asked for advice. The nearest metro was a five to ten minute walk away and the neighborhood was peaceful and quiet. Our room was situated on the third floor, with views of the gardens across the street and another window facing the hotel courtyard. Since our stay was in December, the Luxembourg Gardens (across from the hotel) were not in bloom, but were still lovely to see from our hotel room window. Our room was beautifully decorated, with plush curtains & comfortable antique style chairs. It was very clean. The bathroom (beautiful marble finish), was small, but also very clean and the shower/tub was wonderful to experience at the end of a long day. We were supplied with plenty of towels on a daily basis. We were unable to obtain the wireless internet service in our room, but we could access it in the hotel lobby and the computer in the hotel library met our needs as well. All around, an adorable little hotel with great service and great location. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a beautiful and comfortable stay while in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “good location, clean, not expensive”
Reviews.Author: mphilippou
Reviews.Content: This hotel had very pleasant staff always willing to help. The room was clean and in the perfect location near everthing. If you don't want to spend too much on a room this is perfect. The bathroom could use a facelift but I won't complain. The view from the window was terrific and transportation, shopping and restaurants were very accessible. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good but should go one last mile”
Reviews.Author: Trever388
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the hotel for nearly a week around Christmas. It was a pleasure â€“ thanks to the helpful good willing personnel, and most of all â€“ Christian. Yet, we could advise the hotel: 1) to improve breakfast (at present it doesn't justify its cost). 2) To improve the acoustics in the breakfast room (we kept hearing loud conversation of the hotel staff in the back room). 3) To turn on the light of the lovely sculpture in the cour â€“ in the evenings. 4) To leave the guests a small Christmas gift / card / flowers / chocolate / wine on Christmas eve â€“ to give the feeling of home away from home. 5) To update the weather forecast in the elevator once a day and not once a weekâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful New Year's Stay”
Reviews.Author: Fitz1983London
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 2 nights in this hotel, the second night being new years eve. Our room was on the top floor (5th) and over looked both the courtyard and the gardens. It's nicely tucked away from the other rooms and very nicely decorated in antque style furniture. Bathroom small but nice with marble finishes. The tub provided a very much needed soak at the end of each afternoon following hours of walking round the sites. Staff very friendly and helpful. Check was not until 12 noon,which was ideal for new years day! The location was great. We travelled on the Eurostar and so took the Metro to the St Germain stop and had a 5 minute walk from there. This was my first time in Paris and found the location worked really well for doing the main sites.....all within very easy walking distance of the hotel. Metro stations very nearby so you can esily go further afield. We did Montmartre on our last day before getting the train home. We contacted the hotel prior to travelling help with suggestions for NYE. They made us a reservation at a nearby restaurant and then we did some bar hopping round St Germain which has some nice bars and is really relaxed (no drunken idiots like in the UK on new years!)

Reviews.Title: “Sanctuary”
Reviews.Author: Adverbatlarge
Reviews.Content: We had a delightful stay in a courtyard view executive room. The bed linen is luxurious and the beds so comfortable - most welcome after a day of wandering around this beautiful city. This is a charming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChloderosLaclos
Reviews.Content: The service and location can't be beat near the Jardin de Luxembourg and all the shops and restaurants in the area. Room on first floor (11) was very spacious. Bathroom was a nice size for Paris. Some peeling paint in the bath and towels a bit scratchy but otherwise quite comfortable with robes and slippers. Room decor was quaint with warm woods and period paintings. Built-in armor. Wifi Internet connection in room was spotty though. There was a some noise our first night (knocking either from elevator or something). Breakfast was plentiful and given that it is buffet and includes freshly made eggs on order, I would think the 15 euros was actually not a bad deal, plus the variety was better than the standard carbs on offer for breakfast in Paris cafes. Library was peaceful; there was a computer there for use. We were traveling with friends so we got to see three different rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 4* hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: LeeinVAUSA
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel in Sept 2011. It is wonderfully located near the Luxembourg Parc and an easy walk from many sites and restaurants in Paris. Our rooms were beautifully decorated, air conditioned, very clean and had comfortable beds. We upgraded from the standard room, but I suspect that all rooms would be very nice. The hotel served a lovely breakfast each morning with English language newspapers. I find Paris to be very crowded, but if I do go back, I would definitely stay at this hotel. It is a short walk from the RER (if you don't mind dragging your luggage) and convenient to touring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and perfect”
Reviews.Author: Carrs31
Reviews.Content: My partner(now fiance) and I stayed here for a surprise 40th present for me on the 18th November. From walking through the door it was perfect. Exactly what the doctor ordered. As I tend to book mainstream hotels it was a complete breath of fresh air to have a more personal approach to hosptality. The reeption staff are very helpful and helped us book a river dinner cruise on the last night. We did not eat at the hotel but this was only because the area surrounding it has a fantastic choice of restaurants and creperies-perfect for breakfast. The Pantheon is very close and a good thing to do in an hour or so if you arrive in the afternoon. It is two minutes walk from a theatre and across the road from a small art gallery. We ate in two of the loveliest restaurants ever-both very tiny and both needing booking weeks in advance. We got engaged on this trip so this hotel will always be extra special to me now.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but not as amazing as we expected it to be”
Reviews.Author: Jacquie L
Reviews.Content: I was a little dissapointed in my recent stay, not because anything was badly wrong, in fact the hotel was spotlessly clean, in a safe, nice area and well appointed. The staff were also good especially the reception. We had a knock at the door each evening to see if we wanted extra towels and really enjoyed our stay. I just expected something extra special with such great reviews and compared to recent trips to other 4 star places in Venice, Hotel Stern for instance. The location could have been nearer to a metro and it was at the top end of St Germain so an uphill walk after a busy day walking in Paris. The breakfast could be improved by offering eggs and having more attentive staff rather than a buffet and an occasional staff member who looked like they needed extra help when busy. The first day I was offered coffee the second I was asked what type of coffee by a different person and had French which was much nicer. Would have been good to have been offered the choice too on the first day. The hotel photos shows a atmospheric library with fire but in reality it is very small, a little brightly lit and no fire lit despite it being End of November. it also looks bigger than it actually is, the guest public areas are tiny. The bath was very narrow, ok for us a we are quite small but for a larger man I think it could be a problem. There was no menu for room service although not a problem as we did not require this , but I always like to have a look anyway. All in all it just lacked atmosphere and some extra special touches for the cost but it is Paris and I think I would find it hard to find anything much better but still going to keep on trying.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room”
Reviews.Author: GammelMont
Reviews.Content: I booked a standard room and thought it was way too small. The hotel is OK and located in one of the nicest areas of Paris, in the 6th arrondissement, right accross from the Luxembourg garden and the service is very good but really for that price I expected a bit much in terms of space. I had requested one king size bed but unfortunately got a room with 2 small beds connected, maybe that is all they have there. It is a 4 star hotel but the towels were quite old, 2 days out of 3, I had some of the oldest towels I've ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Have loved this hotel for years”
Reviews.Author: Expatgirl07
Reviews.Content: I have been going here for years. The people are wonderful, the location is great, and the rooms are very nice. Here is the caveat: so many Americans have been enamored by this hotel, that it has turned into a haven for Americans. I barely even heard another language spoken when I was here last. So, it that is okay with you, this is the place. If you want a bit more eclectic in a foreign county, but may want to consider somewhere else. I'll go back because I love it, but as a lot of Americans use and love Trip Advisor, it has caused a bit of an influx here...

Reviews.Title: “Luxembourg Parc”
Reviews.Author: whaleboy1
Reviews.Content: Lovely (small) room, excellent service, wonderful location (top of Quartier Latin)...a bit pricey for what you get, but in Europe these days, probably a good value. Quibbles...why the two skinny comforters instead of one that covers the whole bed? Weird. No hair conditioner? Seriously? Good stuff...terrific workout area, fantastic coffee service, great people.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Paris , so far”
Reviews.Author: Geewiz1948
Reviews.Content: We have been to Paris several times and stayed in range of hotels from 3 to 5 star and overall think this small and friendly place the best. Classic and comfortable rooms and an excellent location near the fashionable shopping area around Le Bon Marche and opposite the lovely Luxembourg gardens. Not cheap but you can get a very big discount if you book if you book and pay well in advance, The lift was a bit problematic whilst we were there but it is doubtless fixed by now.

Reviews.Title: “best value in Paris”
Reviews.Author: jscdjjk
Reviews.Content: We have tried many hotels in Paris but Hotel Luxembourg Parc stood out in its own class. We stayed for 7 nights in room 51, the largest suite in the hotel. Since we were staying for a week with our 4 year old daughter, I was concerned if we would feel really crammed. The suite was so well designed that we really felt very comfortable. The two bathrooms are at the one end of the suite, adjacent to the dressing area with two large closets, and the sleeping area was separated from the sitting area by heavy curtains. The furnishing was elegant and pleasant. The location of the hotel is superb, being across the street from Luxembourg and walking distance to a few nice restaurants (3 great casual Italian restaurants within 5 min of walk, the best place for macaroons in the city), St Sulprice and St Germain.

Reviews.Title: “Our Parisian Home”
Reviews.Author: Hope51
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Luxembourg Parc on two occasions during our recent trip to Europe. Firstly for 5 nights in August and then for two nights in September. Our first room was on the 2nd floor at the rear with windows overlooking the internal courtyard. It was beautifully furnished and quite spacious with a pretty and practical bathroom. Being off the street it was also very quiet which we appreciated. Our second room was on the first floor at the front overlooking the street and the Luxembourg Gardens, although the view is more of the street and the park fence rather than the gardens themselves. This room was a little smaller than the first but still quite adequate and with a slightly bigger bathroom. We love this area of Paris as it is an easy stroll to either St Germain-des-Pres, the Latin Quartier or Montparnesse. With the added benefit of the beautiful gardens just over the road, where we would sit for hours in the surprisingly comfortable metal chairs watching the passing parade. The staff were exceedingly helpful and friendly. It was no trouble for them to store one of our bags for a month while we continued our travels and they were very happy to recommend and book tables at excellent restaurants in the vicinity. We look forward to returning to the Luxembourg Parc on our next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: SSeattle_WA
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights on a 2nd visit to Paris, in early October. Relatively convenient location with good access to nearby metro stop. RER B (Luxembourg) is also easy walking distance). Small, boutique hotel with elegantly furnished rooms. The "however" is that unless you can secure a park-view room in the front of the hotel (and I believe there are only 6 such rooms), it is relatively expensive for what you get and there might be better options in Paris. We ended up with a superior room, but on the side, looking out across a small alley to another apartment building next door. Of course, this is Paris, but for the price, you might find rooms with nicer views, if that is important to you. Good breakfast and excellent service by front desk and other hotel staff, but one would expect that in a 4-star hotel. Spacious library and small bar on the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Paris”
Reviews.Author: fashion61
Reviews.Content: Having the privilege of staying at the LPH is the essence of a small Parisian hotel. This is a Paris Hotel where everyone knows your name and takes your needs seriously. Even hairdresser appointments were made for me at a professional salon. Fabienne and all the staff are wonderful. I do not want to tell everyone about this charming and professional hotel because then there will be no room for me! Thank you to everyone at the LPH for a perfect business and pleasure trip!

Reviews.Title: “Luxembourg Luxury”
Reviews.Author: ManagementSydney
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. It is well situated being close to the park, restaurants, shopping and tourist attractions. The rooms are tastefull decorated and a good size by Paris standards. They are spotlessly clean and the bed was great. The staff are excellent and incredibly helpful. On our last full day, a waiter at a nearby cafe spilt a cup of coffee over my wife's clothes. On return to the hotel, the reception arranged for the clothes to be washed and dred in the hotel washing machine straight away, without charge. This attitude seemed prevalent. In short a really lovley place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Terrific Facility, and Wonderful People”
Reviews.Author: GlennR
Reviews.Content: Located in the St. Germain area and within walking distance of the Siene, many tourist destinations, elegant shopping, and great restaurants and cafes, this boutique hotel has it all. The rooms are spacious, beautifully decorated, and include large well appointed marble baths that are very clean. Our room, number 35, faced the lovely Luxembourg Park and included three large windows that opened to let in the cool Paris breeze as well as the atmosphere of the city. Our room, on the street side, was a bit noisy at night but did not affect our sleep. The folks at the front desk, especially Fabienne and Christian, were friendly and very helpful with directions, recommendations, and reservations for dinning. We looked forward to their cheerful "bon jour" each time we saw them. They really made us feel welcome and went out of their way to make our five night stay delightful. One evening they made reservations for us at the terrific Procope restaurant. When we arrived we were ushered to a table for two in front of beautiful set of French doors overlooking the balcony. The hotel breakfast room, library and bar area were also beautifully decorated and staffed with caring considerate personnel. I can't say enough about Hotel Luxembourg and its wonderful staff. This hotel costs a little more but is a real value. We would definitely stay here again. "Merci" to Fabienne and the rest of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “First in the Sixth”
Reviews.Author: Raoul_King_of_Spain
Reviews.Content: For those of whom the St. Germain/Latin Quarter needs no introduction, the Hotel Luxembourg Parc is a perfect choice to savior the familiar. It's premiere location directly across from the garden park on a main street with walking access to the best of the left bank, sets it up to be a winner. What closes the deal however is the staff, who realize the boutique choice is one which relies on more than size and name brand soaps. The helpful and outgoing staff lead by Fabienne are in the business of insuring the 23 room hotel lives up to it's hype here. They all succeed very well. Situated almost hidden in the midst of taller buildings and the Senate along rue de Vaugirard, the hotel stands out suddenly with its colorful green facade and flower adorned windows at the corner of a small side street. The inviting multiple entranced lobby, sitting area and small bar live up to the 4 star boutique description, along with a bright, windowed breakfast room attentively staffed and offering standard continental morning choices probably better sourced on the nearby streets if so inclined and not needing the pleasant service and surroundings. Any entry in the lobby area is immediately met with a friendly bonjour and offer for a drink or any other need. One definitely feels at home here and welcome after a long day of hoofing it around the city. An inviting wood adorned library and open air courtyard add to the look of the public areas. A fitness room was left unused by the already well exercised pedestrians in our two couples. The rooms are excellent - with good size and in some cases lovely large windows which swing open to the streets below. In the case of the front side, this is both a curse and a blessing as the street can get busy with the sounds of late night revelers in the next door bar and always requisite motorcycles speeding to the next best thing somewhere, everywhere in Paris. Wifi was free and always accessible and the large bathroom looked carved out of marble, with high end fixtures and dimmer equipped lighting showing the artwork and furnishings. A very nice place to spend downtime between sightseeing and sampling the nearly endless restaurant choices close by. This area of Paris oozes character and this location can serve as an excellent luxury base camp from which to explore the 6th and beyond. I would assume there are many other hotel choices nearby which offer some of the same maybe for less, but the driven staff and multiple designer touches make this hotel stand out and deserving of its consistent high ranking here. We will be back as it appears most others do as well. * The hotel was also able to work with us when a previous room reservation earlier in the year was unable to be kept after the cancellation deadline passed. A rare gesture which is uncommon and demonstrative of their attention to guest satisfaction and long term thinking.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel to begin a French Holiday”
Reviews.Author: lanny56
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely hotel in August (two couples) for a week. As with the other reviews we were more than happy with this boutique abode. The rooms were spacious and the bathrooms elegant. Everything is well presented. Fabienne runs a professional hotel but it still has a homely and friendly atmosphere. Fabienne is as elegant as the hotel! The staff from the breakfast room to the management were obliging with any request that we had. (My friend had to cut her ring off from a very swollen finger and Xavier was more than helpful - a thoroughly delightful young man) We ate breakfast there more than we expected as the choice was just what we wanted before we hit the pavements to explore Paris My husband and i loved being able to wander and sit in The Luxembourg Gardens and 'people watch'. St Sulplice is an amazing church as is Saint-Germain-des-PrÃ©s. The MusÃ©e National du Moyen Age is close by and I enjoyed seeing the tapestries there as I was reading Tracy Chevalier's 'The Lady and the Unicorn (2003)' when I was travelling. We walked everywhere and we ate at all the scrumptious restaurants in the area. The shopping in that part of Paris is varied from reasonable to expensive but it is all very chic. Our only complaint was that we wished that we'd booked more time there. Arriving on a Friday and then spending time in Paris until Thursday was not enough! We should have had two weekends. But this hotel did set the tone for the rest of our French/Italian holiday - just perfect. Thank Fabienne and all the staff at Luxembourg Parc.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location & Wonderful Staff in the 6th”
Reviews.Author: SCaron42
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th trip to St. Germain and we are in love with the neighborhood. HLP is located in the BEST location on a quiet beautiful street in the heart of the 6eme. Walking distance to all the sites and shopping/restaurants and the Odeon is down the block. This is a small intimate hotel with mostly American guests, 23 rooms and a small fitness center. The staff can't do enough to help you. They are gracious, warm and the best hotel staff we have ever encountered. Nothing is too much to ask. The manager Fabienne is warm and kind and she made our arrangements with a smile and makes you feel right at home. Lidia and Christian also most wonderful. We had the suite and the bathroom was better than at the George V. BIG shower for 2, a tub, 2 sinks, marble and the room decorated in period Louis XIV. Very comfortable and clean. I would highly recommend this hotel for your first or 5th trip to Paris, for the service alone. Skip the breakfast, the cheeses and hams were not from a fromagerie or boucherie, but from the supermarket. You could do better with your 30 euros (for 2) w/ a proper omelet at one of the local brasseries. Merci!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel to call home base--would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: walls2009
Reviews.Content: Proximity to the St. Germain/Latin Quarter makes visiting Paris a breeze. Depending on traffic, taxis to the Marais are only 10-12 euros. We got a superior double room, which was definitely enough space with its high ceilings, ample closet space and surprisingly large bathroom. The bathrooms, by the way, are quite luxurious with marble all around, big sink and counter space, huge mirrors and comfortably-sized tub. Big windows opened up to a quiet, cobblestone side-street as opposed to the grand Luxembourg Park across the street, but that wasn't a big deal. The concierge/staff is incredibly accommodating--made reservations as asked, gave suggestions as needed and made as feel as comfortable as we could. We didn't spend much time here as we were being American tourists in Paris over a weekend, of course, but were happy to return to it each night, bellies full of amazing food and minds hazy with even more amazing wine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Peter J
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had originally planned to stay for 3 nights as we passed through Paris on our way home from summer holidays. We found we needed to bring 2 of our adult daughters to Paris to renew visas and we eventually reqired 2 rooms for 8 nights. The hotel had to juggle things but did manage to graciously accommodate us. More importantly, it was a great place to stay for that period of time. The rooms can be a little crowded but that is typical in Paris and they are very tastefully presented. Amenities are all good; WiFi, Gym, Bar, Library. Location is excellent, particularly if you enjoy the Left Bank vibe, but But Marais, Louvre, Opera are also walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and more”
Reviews.Author: Mary-53-2004
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights early September and can only reiterate what other have said. The location is wonderful with the park across the road, chic shopping nearby and generally a terrific area for a true Parisian experience. The front staff are very efficient,have excellent English and go out of their way to assist you at any time. Our room was spacious and attractive with a beautiful spotless bathroom. Would we stay again..yes in a heartbeat! ..and the barman is charmer!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location with great service and great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Fender69
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in this friendly clean efficiently managed hotel. Well located and no traffic noise. We will be back. The only request we would make would be a room with a larger bathroom next time.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location”
Reviews.Author: timbo1960
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at end of August. Small family run hotel in a quiet part of 6th arrondissement. Pros: Location, next to Luxembourg Parc which is very pleasant, comfortable walk to Louvre. Lots of restaurants/bars on the other side of the Parc (towards the Pantheon). Metro/RER(direct to CDG airport) also easy walking distance. Staff very friendly and could not be more helpful. Internet free to use in library. Room pleasant but a little tight. Cons: None really, very pleasant base for exploring the left bank.

Reviews.Title: “We are in Love with this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Roger G
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked into the bright clean lobby and met the manager, we knew this hotel was going to be a great home away from home for 8 nights in Paris. We had a classic room (22) that faced rue Servandoni - very nice - plenty of room, great bed and beautiful, spacious marble bathroom. I lost my sunglasses the first day and mentioned it to the clerk the next morning, and he gave me a pair of his sunglasses that he was not using to wear! Great little bar - enjoyed drinks in the charming, book-filled library and in the really pleasant interior courtyard. They provide a computer in the library as well as free wi-fi. They provided helpful information, maps and local knowledge, helped with reservations and just made our stay a joy. Fabulous location on rue de Vaugirard - close to metros (ride the RER B to Luxembourg station only a few blocks from hotel - easy walk - Saint Sulpice, the Park, great dining and bars a few blocks away. This truly is a Four Star hotel - very well deserved. We hope to get back to Paris and will certainly choose the Lux Parc again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, helpful and attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: AliJLondon
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed here, the first being our honeymoon two years ago. Both visits were excellent- the rooms are lovely but most importantly the staff are extremely helpful and make you feel especially welcome. We feel totally relaxed there and would not choose to stay anywhere else. The hotel is by no means cheap but then nothing in Paris is. It is in a lovely area and very easy to get to via the Metro from the Eurostar at Gare du Nord plus within reasonable walking distance of the main sites.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in Excellent Area”
Reviews.Author: Elahnee
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights in mid-August and the Hotel Luxembourg Parc exceeded our expectations. I asked for an early check in since we arrived early on a Saturday morning from the U.S. and our room was ready by 11:30! First, the room: it was a very nice size with beautiful furniture and artwork. The bed was very comfortable (down comforter and plenty of down pillows). The bathroom was spacious -- all marble with a nice-sized shower. We slept very well seeing that we heard no noise -- either from outside or from other hotel guests. Now the best part: the neighborhood. It is beautiful and charming; quiet yet very close to some more active night life. It is one block to Saint-Sulpice, which faces a beautiful square with some very nice cafes. Metro access to several lines is readily available -- but it's also pretty easy to walk to many of the favorite tourist sites. We walked to the Musee D'Orsay, the Louvre and back from both the Montparnasse area and the Ile de la Cite (site of Notre Dame). There are excellent brasseries in the Saint-Germain area, which is only a 5-10 minute walk, and the hotel staff was always ready with a recommendation! If you're coming from CDG, the hotel is also a pretty short walk from the Luxembourg RER station which is on the same line as the airport (saves a lot of $$ vs. taking a taxi). We did not try the breakfast at the hotel (it seemed very nice but it's easy to grab food elsewhere for less than 15 euros pp -- there was a delicious Creperie right across the side street!). We did ask for coffee in the room, which they accommodated easily. Overall, it is a very relaxing and enjoyable stay for the money (we paid about 220 euros/night for a Superior room)! I would absolutely stay here again and recommend it to anyone bound for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: judithgurewich
Reviews.Content: When an hotel is run by a very intelligent, precise and keen manager and when the rooms are pretty and the service incredibly personal you can only have a wonderful experience. I have been going to this place for over 10 years and now it has reached its peek. Call it a perfect hotel. It is just like coming home and I don't have to do anything. Even my favorite shirt is washed by hand and my night tisane is specially prepared for me...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, great location.. I wonÂ´t stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Gonzalo R
Reviews.Content: This Hotel, the staff and the location made my stay in Paris unforgettable. The place is beautiful, the staff makes you fell like you are unique and the overall service on it are such an amazing experince. Highly recomended if you want to relax with your partner and live the real Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint French Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wits-End1
Reviews.Content: This was a solid 4 star hotel. Quaint, romantic, clean, French boutique atmosphere. We found the staff very friendly and very helpful. Their 'non-tourist' restaurant recommendations by the hotel staff were superb. Location is not central, more on the fringe, just slightly, but by the end of our stay we realized it was perfect - the ST. Germaine street/ area was a great cafe/ pub/ shopping area. Very nice area and fun. 'non- touristy' in many ways, but very parisianne.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel and will never stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: LJL305
Reviews.Content: For many years I have been going to Paris for both business and pleasure. Once I discovered the Hotel Luxembourg Parc, I knew this would be my Paris home. The manager, Fabienne Hary sets a tone of charming and warm hospitality - an attitude that extends to the entire staff. Everyone is helpful and friendly and tactful. The rooms are beautiful and clean; the public rooms comfortable and inviting. I have stayed at many fine hotels in big cities; but the Luxembourg Parc stands out in its special combination of comfort and luxury and hominess.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I every stay”
Reviews.Author: Roberto A
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot all over the world practically, business and vacations, during my last trip I stayed 3 days in Paris and I recommend this hotel beacuse service is excellent, reception always helpfull to recommend the best places, restaurants to visit in this fascinating city and the room with it particular details make my stay more than comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Amazing... Highly recommended, will stay again”
Reviews.Author: Thomas D
Reviews.Content: Wow. What an amazing hotel - Thank you, Trip Advisor! The accommodations were beautiful and well-appointed. Service was EXCELLENT. There was not a detail that the staff didn't take care of for us. Felt like we were treated like royalty. Location is excellent and within walking distance of most everything the typical tourist cares to see. Many good restaurants in the neighborhood, as well. Luxembourg Parc is across the street and is breathtaking.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: nhughes45
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at HLP for many years. Everything about this hotel defines the quintessential Parisian experience. The staff are so amazing. They know no boundaries in fulfilling each and every request pleasantly and efficiently, The rooms are good size beautifully decorated and well maintained. Hotel Luxembourg Parc is our Parisian home. Gene and Nancy Hughes San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “In terms of Paris, a fantastic hotel with great location and superb staff”
Reviews.Author: FleurtheGirl
Reviews.Content: Staying in Paris in a decent hotel requires some serious bunch of euros. With 150 euros you might get old, smelly, tiny shoebox room with rusty shower and horrible service. So my tip is to do some pre-research before booking. Or go to Hotel Luxembourg Parc and you won't go wrong... I have been in those smelly old closet rooms, so LP definitely makes a diffence to your Paris experience, even though you will spend our days admiring the cities pearls. LP has nice, unique style room, which one may consider a bit old-fashioned as there's nothing modern here, but everything is clean and nice. We had two windows facing the park and even though there's rather busy road running between the hotel and the park, the walls are thick. Bathroom is nice and cosy and. Two more windows were facing the hotel's inner yard, which is pretty and nice. What makes these hotel a stand out besided location and nice rooms, is the service. The people at front desk were amazing, so helpful and have so fluent English that hard to believe you are in Paris. They booked our restaurants every night as we first told where we would like to eat and they made the arrangement to that speicific hotel by phone. So everyday we dined well and needed not to worry about the bookings with our not-so-great French. The Metropolitan has three stops nearby and the neighbourhood is cute. It is even easy to walk to some of the main attractions. I guess they serve breakfast here, but we did not test it.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed by booking bungle.”
Reviews.Author: Forsterfan
Reviews.Content: We are very very disappointed in this hotel. We have just received an email from them saying that "Due to a computer error, we are unable to process your booking from May 5." We cannot believe they have left this for months and months and did not contact us earlier to advise. My husband and I are one day away from leaving for our trip and now we have to find emergency accommodation. This is completely unaccpetable and has made this a very stressful time as many hotels are fully booked. Further, it would have been much better customer service to have called and apologised. The risk than they had was that we may not have checked our emails and could have arrived still expecting our reservation to have been accepted. Customer service is the primary measure of success for every hotel - Hotel Luxembourg Parc have failed this already.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - - great balcony”
Reviews.Author: Geogguy1960
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of Aug. and were thoroughly pleased with our choice of hotel based on the Trip Advisor reviews we read. We had a superior room - which wasn't very big, but was very nice. The washroom had a great shower with good pressure. The balcony was huge (bigger than the room). It was nice to sit out after a long day of sightseeing and relax before going out for dinner or to have a glass of wine before going to bed.. The hotel is right across from the Luxxembourg Park and we only went into on our last day in Paris - it is huge and beautiful - full of people doing all sorts of activities. Set aside some time to enjoy it. The hotel is in a fairly quiet area - you can never escape the whining of the scooters - but is pretty close to all sorts of restaurants and cafes. We also found the front desk staff more than helpful in answering all of our questions and Xavier was very patient in helping me sort out my WiFi problems. All in all it definitely deserved the high ranking that Trip Advisor assigned it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, and hope to go back”
Reviews.Author: Roger R
Reviews.Content: My wife and I where there from July 25th to August 4 th 2011. EVERYTHING was great, the room, the service, the breakfast etc. The personal was charming and friendly. We would strongly recommend this hotel. Manon B. and Roger R. Laval,Quebec

Reviews.Title: “second visit to the best”
Reviews.Author: paulwTowcester
Reviews.Content: this was our second visit to this wonderful boutique hotel, this time spent loads more time exploring the local area, all great. This hotel is made so special by the staff who are simply the best, the location, the great rooms and of course Paris itself. We cannot recommend this hotel enough and we are already planning our visit next year.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel / Great Location”
Reviews.Author: heatherschultz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Luxembourg Parc from July 31 to Aug 5. Had a wonderful time, here are some thoughts and tips: HOTEL I will start with the hotel itself; it is small but lovely. We have always stayed in larger hotels, so this was quite a change for us. We loved it. Our room was #15 on the 1st floor (which is actually on the 2nd story), which looks over Rue de Vaugirad into the Luxembourg gardens. The room was quite large by European standards and the bathroom was wonderful. We have never stayed in a room with so many windows (that open to a French balcony)- including the bathroom! Wonderful hardwood floors and exposed beams in the ceiling. We had plenty of room and comfort for our 5 day stay. Room had a out of sight mini bar/refrigerator which was great to store our extra water bottles and desserts we picked up. Hotel had cozy courtyard, library and small/cute breakfast room and also a small bar/lobby area. Had breakfast two of the mornings which was a lovely continental style for 15 euros each (Bob ordered bacon/eggs for a little extra!). Breakfast staff was fast, courteous and efficient. STAFF We were greeted / checked in / and settled in by Xavier. He was beyond helpful. Christian was also extremely helpful during our stay with advice on the Metro, Museum passes and he had also assisted with the arrangements for a driver upon our arrival from London via email before our departure from the USA. The staff is French, but speaks very good English, so getting directions and helpful hints was easy. LOCATION For us, this hotel was in the perfect location. On the Left Bank it seems removed from the busy streets of Paris, but it is only a short distance away. It has pretty convenient Metro stops. But the true beauty of the location is the Luxembourg Gardens. It also has a variety of cafes to choose from just a short walk away. Easy walk to our favorite - Cafe de Flore. WEATHER The weather varied from 70 - 78 degrees during the day while we were there in early August. Perfect. Coming from the southern portion of the USA, this was quite a treat in August. FYI The only caveat regarding the room; there is no alarm clock. So you must ask for a wake up call from the Front desk. We started using my iphone for an alarm. Not a big deal, just worth noting - you don't want to sleep the day away in Paris or miss a cab or tour. TIPS On the first day, we took a morning bike tour of Paris with Bike-About Tour, great way to see the area on the first day (separate review) Don't be intimidated by the Metro, plunge right into it (start with stop to stop runs, and move into transfers- quite easy once you get used to it- and saves loads of time and walking!). Christian was able to sell us a 2-day museum pass right at the front desk, and this saved us much in terms of time (don't have to wait in lines)- get it! We arrived in Paris from London via the EuroStar train (see our review on that!) We took a side trip to Normandy; see our review under Executive D-Day tours. Almost too much to talk about in this hotel review, we will try and sprinkle other reviews and tips for the various places we went and used. We loved Paris, loved Hotel Luxembourg Parc - enjoy yourself!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Amy D
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Luxembourg Parc. The staff was very helpful and took care of every request we made from dinner reservation to ice for our room with utmost professionalism and charm. Definitely recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good breakfast, ok service”
Reviews.Author: pital16
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the suite with the balcony. The balcony might have been bigger than the room. It was nice to be able to sit outside, problem is, there is no view. They have lattice work and tall plants blocking any tye of view, you can't even look out onto the street. So, I would advise against paying for the balcony room, after all, you are just across the street from the Luxembourg Gardens, so having outdoor space sn't that necessary (and it is Paris, you won't be in your room often anyway). I chose this hotel because it had a workout room, but upon arrival, I was told it was closed, despite my specifically calling them when I booked to verify they had a workout room. We requested twin beds, they had a full size bed. I asked for someone to change this, and it took all day. In the grand scheme of things, the room was clean, it is located just far enough away from the noise, but a nice short walk to the fun, and the breakfast was really good, despite the fruit that was rotting. Believe it or not, I would stay there again, now that my expectations are set...It is Paris after all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rachel_Whales
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in one of Parisâ€™ many lovely older buildings and has a traditional French style. The double room was quite large as was the marble bathroom, with a shower and bath plus a view out to the Luxembourg Gardens. The bed was not ideal for a honeymoon as there was a very defined gap in the middle and two single duvets instead of one large one. The room was perfectly clean and quiet but since itâ€™s an older building the floors were quite creaky. Free wifi was provided and there was a gym and breakfast available although we didnâ€™t try these. The location is pretty good with a very easy walk across the road to the gardens and about 10 mins to Notre Dame. Itâ€™s about a 5 min walk to the metro or RER. The staff were lovely and very helpful. Itâ€™s worth noting that the fridges donâ€™t actually work, apparently they are just to cool drinks but ours wasnâ€™t cool at all. This probably isnâ€™t an issue for most people though and the staff kindly let me put our milk in their fridge. One final thing is that twice during our stay the cleaning staff came in and rearranged the room despite the do not disturb sign being up. This is probably a personal thing but I like to get settled in and donâ€™t particularly like cleaning staff coming in every day and moving my stuff around, hence the reason I left the sign up. All in all a nice little hotel if youâ€™re looking for something near Luxembourg, however I'm not sure itâ€™s worth the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in amazing location”
Reviews.Author: LMM1109
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel. It is located in a beautiful area of St. Germain des Pres just across the street from the Luxembourg Gardens. One of the windows in our room when opened had a marvelous view of the gardens with the French Flag flying below. It is a magical place withfantastic amenities and one we will be sure to visit on our next visit to Paris. This hotel is not to be missed!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Facility and Service”
Reviews.Author: briane1
Reviews.Content: I have had two wonderful and all too short stays at HLP. I have occupied a normal room overlooking Rue Servandoni and a suite with courtyard view. Both rooms were appointed with very high quality furniture and bedding. The rooms have been spotless and quiet. Amenities such as WiFi were available without difficulty. The overall quality of the property was excellent without exception. The atmosphere is elegant and intimate. The staff at the hotel is utterly charming. After checking me in, Fabienne discussed my plans for my visit and made some very helpful suggestions that very much enhanced my experience of her lovely city. During my stays I noticed her being very helpful to other guests, including going far out of her way to rectify a problem incurred by a guest during a day of shopping. I have occupied in other hotels in Paris, including marquis properties in the 1st and I cannot imagine returning to any other Parisian hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Je t'aime Hotel Luxembourg Parc!”
Reviews.Author: Lady_of_Lilador
Reviews.Content: Located in St Germain on the Left Bank and opposite the stunning Luxembourg Park, this beautiful boutique hotel has all you could hope for, for a romantic Paris stay. We were on our honeymoon and were delighted with this gem of a hotel. The rooms are beautifully appointed, with gorgeous Louis XIIII furniture and lush marble bathrooms. We actually stayed in two different rooms - we stayed for a week before heading to London for a few days and then returned to finish our Paris trip there. The hotel is in a great location - about 15 minutes walk to Pont Neuf and 5 minutes to the wonderful centre of St Germain, which is full of restaurants, markets, shops and cafes. Just across the road is the beautiful park, which is a great spot to relax or take a picnic. Lidia and the staff at the Luxembourg Parc were delightful - friendly, very helpful and a great source of information on the best places to eat or visit. Nothing was too much trouble for them and the stay was hassle free. The hotel has a lovely library and courtyard to relax in, and the breakfast option was great value, considering the quality of the meal - they will serve breakfast in your room if you request it, otherwise it is served in the gorgeous light filled breakfast room. The only negative was that our double bed was two singles put together (I know virtually all hotels do this) but they kept pulling apart which was a bit annoying. They need to secure them better. This was the only negative though - and compared with the excellent standard of everything else, it was not the end of the world. This hotel is great value for money considering the high quality of service that it delivers and the beautiful appointment of the hotel. I would stay there again without hesitation. Je t'aime Hotel Luxembourg Parc!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, some problems with front desk staff and elevator”
Reviews.Author: PacoCA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location close to the Luxembourg Gardens, metros, restaurants, bakeries and within walking distance to the Louve, Notre Dame, Latin Quarter etc. The rooms are small (average sized for Europe) but very clean with a small refrigerator and safe. There was no iron! The bathrooms are very nice with a soaking tub/shower combination. Most of the front desk staff were knowledgeable and very helpful. They allowed us an early check-in and brought our luggage up to the room. Unfortunately, the elevator was out of order several times during our 6 day stay, including the last day when we had to lug 3 large pieces of luggage down 3 flights of stairs in a very narrow stair case. The front desk staff (young man) had to be pulled from a back room to check us out. Despite the few hick-ups, our stay was very memorable, and the hotel was a major plus for us!

Reviews.Title: “We spent our first night as married there! But...”
Reviews.Author: loluna
Reviews.Content: Well, we choosed the hotel after reading the reviews at Tripadvisor. The hotel is amazing, but there are few things to be aware of if you are thinking about staing there. *When booking we asked about the room with windows to the garden - we didnÂ´t got any. *A few months before our wedding we left my veil there because we wanted it to be ready at the Day (we didnÂ´t want to bring it home and then back to Paris again). Well, it was GONE when we asked about it!!! They managed to find it after two days, but still...disappointing! *ItÂ´s not that near to metro as we thought it would be... *There is no iron at the room! *You have to ask for every glas of juice when having breakfast. The service was very good, but I am not sure it is worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful and Friendly Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Cecilesmom
Reviews.Content: My mother, daughter and I spent a week in Paris at the Hotel Luxembourg Parc and we couldn't have chosen a friendlier, more elegant and more comfortable place to stay. The staff are extremely friendly and were especially sweet to my daughter. The hotel itself is lovely--very tastefully decorated, but not stuffy. Our rooms were not large, but the beds were the most comfortable we have found anywhere and the extra deep tubs were much appreciated after a day of walking around Paris! The hotel is across the street from Luxembourg Gardens--a terrific place for a jog or just some down time. We loved that the neighborhood itself is quiet, but very close to cafes, bistros and within a 10 minute walk to the Seine. If we are lucky enough to return to Paris, we will definitely stay her again!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brandtly
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 6-night stay at Hotel Luxembourg Parc -- it is the perfect Parisian hotel -- amazing staff that is friendly and extremely helpful, great location, nice rooms and a very local feel. I will definitely be back -- I've finally found my hotel in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Incredible..”
Reviews.Author: higginsthewonderdog
Reviews.Content: Sorry That it took me so long to write this review. My wife and I visited in April. Quite Honestly, Hotel Luxembourg Parc was one of the reasons we had such an incredible time. The Hotel is in a great location, our room was large comfortable and the staff was superb. There are just not enough superlatives to describe how much we enjoyed our stay. By the way, it seems as if all of Paris is within walking distance and that the Hotel Staff knows everyone in the City.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: Alexander041
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Luxembourg Parc, he room was large and comfortable and the marble bathroom was luxurious. The hotel was very quiet and the staff most helpful, friendly and discreet. Location is terrific, one and half blocks from Boulevard Ste. Germaine, two from Rue de Rennes and three from Boulevard St. Michel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with pleasant staff and lovely room.”
Reviews.Author: JoDD45
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our 10th wedding anniversary. We informed the hotel of this in advance and they upgraded our room. The room we were given was spacious and beautifully furnished with excellent facilities (two televisions, stereo, ample space for clothing, marble bathroom with large corner bath, double sinks and enormous shower). The location of the hotel was convenient for the Louvre and close to the Tour Eiffel (5 minute taxi ride costing 10 euro). Staff were helpful, booking us taxis and providing assistance with directions, recommending restaurants. We will definitely stay there again. Only negative point was the hairdrier which wasn't great quality.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the Hype, charming hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: MissMinivan22
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in early June. We were warmly greeted on a hot Parisian day and shown to our charming room which unfortunately was having some minor repairs done at the time. We were ushered quickly to the bar and offered a complimentary drink (and many apologies) whilst we waited for the work to be completed (less than 15 minutes) It is this kind of service that sets this establishment apart from the rest. The staff were enthusiastic, knowledgable and eager to please. The Hotel has incredible warmth and is located in a beautiful part of this divine city. We would highly recommend this hotel and if ever in Paris again will most certainly be booking again

Reviews.Title: “Remarcable hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: mnaag04
Reviews.Content: At the beginning of May, we spent 6 memorable nights in this perfectly located hotel. We booked it based on its raving reviews, and as many other visitors we were pleasantly surprised that this hotel deserves the high praises. It is not only within walking distance from 2 metro stations, but also to the Louvre and Notre Dame, the famous rue Bonaparte and just across the street from the wonderful Luxembourg Gardens. This spotless and impeccably decorated hotel aims to combine the highlights of baroques style with modern life conveniences and of course the famous French chic (white marble bathroom; hardwood floors with Nain design Persian rugs; period furniture and the crystal chandelier in our suite). We enjoyed the pastries served for breakfast (straight from the Gerard Mulotâ€™s pastry store located at less than 5 min walk from the hotel-a recommended visit if you are a dessert lover). Our gratitude to M-dames Fabienne and Lydia, who proved an impeccable professionalism in dealing with all the issues we had. We cannot wait to return there.

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: cathykatz3
Reviews.Content: We had four rooms and loved this hotel: it is charming, fantastic location, delicious breakfast, and helpful and friendly staff. I definitely recommend this hotel if you are going to Paris. Great for couples, families and friends.

Reviews.Title: “A touch of luxury in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: WickB
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter and I stayed 2 nights at this elegant hotel and wished we could have stayed longer. While the room wasn't large, it was beautifully appointed, comfortable, and gave us a corner view from 2 windows. As I was recovering from a cold and the usual fatigue of travel, it was great to pull the blinds, keep the day out, sleep in, and catch up on my rest. We ate a lovely breakfast (late of course) in a room that let us look out on the street scene near the Luxembourg Gardens. The common rooms are beautiful, and the hotel is set on the typically ancient curving streets of the Left Bank. Set one foot out and you're in nowhere but Paris! Shops, dining, and sights are all easily accessible. Our hosts made great dinner recommendations (La Maison du Jardin for dinner--terrific, twice), offered advice for patisseries, pharmacies, sights, and were enormously helpful and kind. I'd stay at this hotel again in a minute. Wish I was still there!

Reviews.Title: “Intimate, classy, and great staff”
Reviews.Author: Draz97
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 10 day stay in Paris at the Hotel Luxembourg Parc to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. Wow! First, the staff was incredibly helpful, from the moment we came in until the moment we left. Restaurant recommendations, taxis - insight, etc. Secondly the room was spacious, comfortable, clean and very stylish. The amenities in the hotel were excellent. Every morning I was greeted in the breakfast room with good cheer and a beautiful room in which to start the day. Breakfast was excellent, with the best bread in the world from the famous bakery - Gerald Mulot. Also, the inside courtyard is a very comfortable place in which to find a quiet place to rest and relax. The bar served as a very nice place to meet new people and have a drink, and Laurent was always friendly and willing to share his recommendations for restaurants - including arranging a marvelous dinner at Le Petit Cour - a wonderful recommendation we probably wouldn't have come up with our own. What else can I say? - a great location - right across the street from the Luxembourg Gardens, walking distance to just about everything, in the very fashionable 6th arrondissement, VERY helpful and cheerful staff who all spoke excellent English. From our perspective, this will be our base next time to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: Classics
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in this beautiful boutique hotel in May and it exceeded all our expectations. This is a lovely, small hotel with big hotel services and staff that could not have been more friendly and eager to please. We had a large room ( #34), by Paris standards, with separate sitting area, wardrobe/dressing area and beautiful marble mathroom with all the amenities. The bed was very comfortable with beautiful linens and the room decor was elegant. The reception area and small bar provided nightly libations before and after dinner, and great conversation with the very charming bartender, Laurent. He and the desk staff, Xavier, Fabienne & Lydia, provided excellent restaurant recommendations each evening and we weren't disappointed anywhere we went. The hotel is located in the heart of St. Germain des Pres, directly across the street from the Luxembourg Gardens, the Senate and just blocks from the Pantheon. It has a comfortable neighborhood vibe and we felt right at home from the first day. We have travelled to Paris many times over the years and this is, by far, the best hotel we have found. We can't say enough good things about it and hope to return again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Unusually Comfortable and Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Terence1234
Reviews.Content: All the best features of a Grand Hotel in a unique setting.

Reviews.Title: “Big clean rooms, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: nomomilk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon for a few days after reading the excellent reviews here. We had a similar experience as most others. The rooms are well sized, the staff is very friendly and helpful, and the free wifi works :) It's in a nice quiet spot across the street from the gardens which makes having a picnic really easy. For more action walk 5 minutes to st Germaine and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel. Really nice staff and comfortable rooms. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: rhoward182
Reviews.Content: Pretty decor, courtyard, quiet, well located, nice, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Faboulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JohnXLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long week-end at the beginning of May. Great hotel; friendly staff; great location (for the main museums).

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jim_MP
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ©e has been to Paris many times, and on this 30th birthday weekend trip, she said it was the best she has been to in Paris. By all accounts, the size of the rooms is biggest difference. We were in a superior double, overlooking the cobbled side street. Great location by the park. Close to St Germain de pres and metro stations. Mabillon is 7 minutes walking distance. Probably about the same for St Sulspice. Not sure what the 'garden/park view' rooms would be like, but I imagine you might only see the trees in the way, and the main road in between maybe a bit noisy. Although, the windows seemed to be well sound proofed. The staff were always friendly, efficient and helpful. The little bar and library are nice, as is the little courtyard area. The room was delightful. Clean, pretty and comfortable. Lots of lighting and storage options. Decent sized TV. Massive marble bathroom with great shower. Plenty of artwork adorned the walls, some with their own lighting! Had a perfectly nice continental breakfast at the hotel once. Reasonably priced, I think. Had 2 coffees and 2 croissants at a cafe near St Sulpice which cost 10 euro. So 15 euro each at the hotel for the usual pastries and meats and hot food on request seems OK. For a special occasion treat, it was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “A super place to celebrate our anniversary”
Reviews.Author: girlie30
Reviews.Content: We liked the feel of this hotel - it has a solid 'French feel' which conveys the history and elegance of Paris. Our superior room had adequate space with a lovely marble bathroom complete with bathrobes and slippers. Not lovers of air conditioning, we preferred to sleep with the window open as the hotel is situated in a quiet area just opposite the Luxembourg Gardens. The staff were helpful with directions and suggested two very good restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. Our special thanks go to Fabienne on reception and Andrew in the breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: __Drag0sB__
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for us. My wife and I stayed here for our 10th year wedding anniversary and we absolutely loved it. It is right next to the Luxembourg Gardens and close to the St. Sulpice subway station (M 4). We walked to St. Michel square and the Notre Dame and took the subway everywhere else. The hotel staff was wonderful. Very helpful and great with recommendations for places to eat and shop. Fabienne (the hotel manager) was super nice, always smiling and very helpful in accomodating any needs we had. I can't imagine missing anything. The hotel is right in the middle of St-Germain (6th arr). Lots of cafes and restaurants and boutiques close by. I would go back at the same place without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, a hotel with France Charm”
Reviews.Author: Flutterby99
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is well located, staff are very friendly and helpful in providing information and helping us booking restaurants. The suite we had was spacious by Paris standards, with sitting area and large bathroom and separate toilet. We also have Espresso machine in the suite. The problems (or areas for improvement): the room is very hot and no air-conditioning, we were given a fan and had to open the windows to sleep. There are very limited English TV channels available and most of them were not working (the large sized the TV is very old, not clear and off color, should have a plasma or LCD!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: jesjas
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfect for our first time in Paris. The staff was pleasant and very helpful. They provided us with information on getting around as well as some restaurant options in the area. As a side note, the food was not particularly good at these places and very expensive so do your own research. They have a great little bar and lounge area where we got some cool conversation and very delicious pre and post dinner cocktails. The other great feature was that they allow their guests computer access which was so helpful since our international phone didn't work. The location is perfect because it's not overpopulated with tourists, minutes from dozens of cafes and boutiques, and walking distance to the Louvre as long as you have good legs and stamina and if you are unwilling to shell out an unreasonable price for a taxi. There were two issues for us at the hotel: first it happened to be very warm outside and there was no air conditioning - we opted out of their supplemental air conditioning device that was way to big and bulky to be placed in our already small room; second they were performing repairs throughout the hotel so it was noisy at times right outside of our room and bit of a disruption throughout the hotel. The one last point I would mention is that it was our honeymoon and they didn't do anything special for us. We didn't really expect anything but it would have been a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Great service but had problems”
Reviews.Author: Helenewe
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with an excellent staff. However, it is noit very cloose to a metro stop so be prepared to walk. When we arrived in Paris, it was unseasonably warm and the air conditioning in the hotel was not functioning. We were offered a fan but in order to keep the room cool we needed to keep the windows open. It was very noisy at night and we had a difficult time sleeping. I would think that a 4 star property would get its air conditioning repaired earlier in the year. Too bad because the rooms are nice and the bathrooms excptional.

Reviews.Title: “This was a wonderful hotel in all ways - location, service, rooms, everything.”
Reviews.Author: DHS20
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful and the location was superb. We couldn't have had a better time. It was right next to the Luxembourg Park, which was lovely and it was very close to the Saint Sulpice church and subway station, which was a great addition. Our room had very nice and the only minor complaints were the quality of the bathroom products and the lack of a fan in the bathroom. But overall, our stay in Paris was phenomenal, both at the hotel and our time in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Issaquah
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located near St. Sulpice in the 6th Arr. You are near a Metro, within walking distance of the fabulous and always busy St. Germain area, yet you are tucked away on a quiet street overlooking the beautiful Luxembourg Garden. After walking in the Montmarte and Marais after dark, it was so refreshing to come home to this peaceful and completely safe neighborhood. The hotel is charming and the rooms are wonderful. Best of all is the amazingly helpful and charming staff. We would love to come back and stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: DKershaw
Reviews.Content: The warmth and professionalism of the staff at this elegant little jewel of a hotel made our stay in Paris absolutely unforgettable. I cannot overstate how welcome we were made to feel - the attention to detail, the comfortable bed, the superb location, the above average shower were added bonuses.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, hotel staff and location!”
Reviews.Author: Sheebster
Reviews.Content: The previous reviews of this hotel were spot-on. The staff was great - all English speaking and helpful. The rooms were spacious for a Paris hotel, and the beds WERE EXTREMELY comfortable! We slept as well as at home. Every aspect of this hotel could not be improved upon. The location was near many good cafes, restaurants and shopping. The ONLY down side was that we could have really used a closer Metro stop. After all the walking and sight-seeing, the extra walk to a Metro stop was tiring. None were what I would consider conveniently close - walkable but not convenient. That being said, I would not consider it to be a "show-stopper". Everything else was simply wonderful and I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel in great location with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: WH3R3_2_N3XT
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights. Excellent hotel. Quiet at night and yet close enough to walk to most of the major sights (10 minute walk to Notre-Dame and Louvre). Very good restaurants and night life nearby. Great big park next door. Staff was great! Spoke English fluently which was good since our French was a bit rusty.
