They recommended dinner places and made reservations for us. Also recommended a very good place to listen to some live Jazz music after dinner. We'll definitely stay here next time.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, Lovely, Clean, Cozy and Welcoming ...everything you could want.”
Reviews.Author: travelgirls2
Reviews.Content: My husband I went to visit our daughter who is studying abroad. We couldn't have picked a more perfect place to stay. It was close to the dorm for international students so the location was perfect for our situation. Beyond that though this hotel was everything I had read about on tripadvisor. It was clean, had a very French feeling, all you would envision of a boutique hotel and the service was wonderful. We felt very welcome from the moment we checked in and as we would come and go each member of the staff was friendly and helpful. I mentioned to the woman at the desk as I checked out that my daughter was having trouble with her french bank card and she said they would gladly help her work it out - certainly beyond the call of duty as we were leaving. Our room was spacious, the beds, bedding, towels, robes, etc were very cozy and luxurious. Our room was cleaned or tidied up several times a day. The bar area had a very intimate feeling and the breakfast staff was all you ask for. The neighborhood feels very safe and at night we never heard a sound as we slept. All in all, our stay was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: FourSkiers
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after looking at many online and becoming very confused. The choice was perfect. Good location - easy to walk to everything but away from the noise. The hotel was nicely decorated and had a lovely feel to it. The staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice for Paris Stay”
Reviews.Author: mhsqrd
Reviews.Content: SERVICE: The hotel staff treated us like we were the only guests at their hotel. They were amazingly helpful, each and every one, giving recommendations on food, directions to Metro, printing us maps, providing coffee, letting us borrow an adaptor. I cannot overstate how incredible the service was. ROOM: The room was very nice. We were upgraded to a corner room upon our arrival (it did help that it was mid-week). There was plenty of space for two adults and our luggage and still space to move around. The FREE INTERNET was a huge bonus as we would Skype our young children back home each evening. LOCATION: a quick 5-10 minute walk to the nearest Metro station, Line 4. Hotel would call taxi if needed. Nice neighborhood area, quiet, though with lots of shops nearby and walking distance to two major intersections for restaurants. SUMMARY: highly recommend Hotel Luxembourg Parc for your Paris stay. It was our first time to Paris and if/when we go back, we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, fantastic location for something special this is the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: twinkle89
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped inside I was blown away, all the staff spoke perfect English and treated you in such a way that you felt like that you where v.i.pâ€™s, the room was elegant and well laid out with a large bathroom, the location is perfect and we could walk to all the attractions from the hotel, when we returned in the evening and went in to the bar, the staff judged the situation perfect that we where on a special romantic break and offered us to have a seat in a little side room, this was a perfect little room gently lit with a log fire in where we enjoyed our drinks. The breakfast was extremely tasty especially the pastries if the selection was a little small. For a special visit to Paris would recommend this hotel to all

Reviews.Title: “A well above average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Duke065
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the most comfortable night here earlier in the week. The hotel staff made us feel thoroughly welcome. We had decided to visit Paris for my birthday and found the hotel through tripadvisor.I would really recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “A True Gem”
Reviews.Author: etschneider
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with this hotel from the moment we arrived. A good friend recommended the hotel, among a number of others, and we narrowed down our choices by the Trip Advisor reviews we read. We are so grateful to other reviewers whose feedback was accurate and spot on. The hotel's rooms are cozy but decent size. There was a sitting area and a bed area in our room, enough space to get back with some room to spare. The bed was extremely comfortable - not too hard, very soft linens, great pillows (and this is something that we have rarely experienced throughout our extensive travels). The bathroom was also quite nice. There was a lovely library where we meet our friends each night for drinks (both pre and post dinner). The front desk attendant made a fire for us each night and we were able to sit, drink and talk, play chess and listen to music. Of all the hotel's attributes, without a doubt, the most impressive was the staff. From the wonderful woman who brought us our morning cafe au laits and croissants to the fantastic front desk staff (Royce and all the others are great!), the service was better than any five star hotel you would find. They were responsive, informative, incredibly helpful, and friendly as well. We are already looking forward to our next visit in Paris and to returning to this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid trip, an amazing staff!”
Reviews.Author: Arnaud155032
Reviews.Content: We went my wife and I to Paris, and thanks to TripAdvisor, we went in this hotel. Firstly, the hotel is in the most amazing area so closed to the Parc. Then we loved our bedroom, the service... This hotel is really cosy, elegant, typically "Parisien". We were really well welcomed. With a really nice staff, you just feel like "at home", especially with Fabienne who cared about us. She was able to help us, by giving us really good adresses (restaurants, shopping...). Our new adress in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service and friendly helpfulness with charm and style!”
Reviews.Author: EdwardTotnes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Luxembourg Parc to celebrate my birthday after doing extensive research to hunt out that special hotel for the occasion! Hotel Luxembourg Parc exceeded our expectations and we were soon at home in our 'new home in Paris'. The management style of the hotel is very caring and warm with a calm efficiency to detail. Our room a Superior Double was just that having the most comfortable bed with linen and pillows of the finest quality. We would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again in fact we are looking at dates for a further booking...........don't miss this gem.....it has 4 stars we would give it 5!! A real gem in Paris....a rare find!!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: pakofive
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful - it was a warm and cosy place to return to each afternoon after exploring Paris with our three little children in the cold Dec weather. The staff was extremely helpful, starting several weeks before our arrival: answering many emails immediately, making reservations for us, booking tickets, etc. Our two connecting rooms worked out perfectly - one with three twins for the kids and one with a double for us. The rooms were comfortable and not small by Paris standards. The bathrooms were very clean and sparkly. We did have rooms across from the elevator and did not have a problem with extra noise, unlike the previous reviewer. Also, the windows are very soundproof. We walked out for breakfast (went to Bar Du Marche on rue de Buci twice. Simple, good for kids and a great location). The rates seemed about right as I have no complaints - maybe a tad high but when booking from overseas with nothing to go on but online reviews, the hotel beat all my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Amanda2327
Reviews.Content: I arrived from a wonderful but exhausting stay in Marrakech. The hotel is extremely well located and the rooms are lovely. But most important, the staff could not be more helpful or congenial. I especially enjoyed speaking with Xavier, who has lived all over the world. He and all the staff made me feel very welcome, and patiently gave their recommendations for many local places to eat and shop--all in perfect English (very refreshing after my pathetic attempts at remembering my high school French).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Luxembourg Parc exceeded my expectations - and I have high expectations!”
Reviews.Author: R0din
Reviews.Content: My two-night, three-day trip to Paris was loaded with expectations: being 6.5 months pregnant and leaving my toddler at home for the first time, this was to be the last time I could really relax, sleep well, treat myself and be on my own. I was keen to stay in a hotel (and an area) that was quiet and charismatic. And I was in the mood for a bit of luxury too. HLP has all this and more. The staff here are extraordinarly impressive, and strike the difficult balance of warmth and readiness to help with a respect for privacy. The hotel is just lovely - exactly as it looks on the website, clean, cosy and stylish. The charming rooms are spacious enough with very comfortable beds, and have fantastic marble bathrooms. I didn't try the breakfast as I thought it was more fun to wander up to Cafe Flore for coffee and a croissant. I will definitely stay here again, and I'm completely in love with 6th. By far my favourite part of Paris now. One tip - avoid staying in a room opposite the lift. I found it a bit noisy. Needless to say I was moved instantly, and with no fuss.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, comfort and service. Will use exclusively!”
Reviews.Author: jkbrothers
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beyond all expectations. It is near the Senate so is very secure, around the corner from St. Sulpice and the metro, so easy to get around. Service was fantastic - everyone spoke perfect English. Bistros in the vicinity were great, concierge will make arrangements for you. Rooms were gorgeous and nice size - luxurious bathroom. Got a great rate on the net. I LOVED this hotel and will return again and again! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Exclusive hotel in an exclusive location”
Reviews.Author: yungkara
Reviews.Content: HLP is just opposite the Luxembourg Gardens and a 5 minute walk to the tourist hot spot of St Germain. St Sulpice is just a few minutes walk down the side road and there are plenty of restaurants within walking distance. 3 or 4 metro stations Mabillon, Odeon, St Sulpice, St Germain are nearby so getting around Paris from here is easy. The hotel is modern French antique in style and our executive room was delightful and nicely furnished. For a hotel this expensive we were surprised there was no turn down service and missed the chocolates on the pillow when we returned from dinner. Exclusive, quiet, private and perfect - ideal for that romantic Paris weekend.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: harv001
Reviews.Content: I usually stay on the left bank when I visit Paris and when my previous choice was not available a friend recommended the Hotel Luxembourg Parc. I couldnâ€™t be more pleased. The room I have (room 35) is spacious, quiet, and tastefully decorated. The bathroom is large, the shower has copious quantities of water and itâ€™s nicely hot. Good amenities, too. The members of the staff with which I have had contact have all been very friendly and helpful. The breakfast, while not spectacular, is certainly good. Location-wise, the hotel is immediately adjacent to Luxembourg Gardens (Jardin du Luxembourg) which puts it a bit of a ways from (but still close to) most of the sights in St Germain. I would recommend the hotel for both business travelers and couples (itâ€™d be a great place for a romantic getaway).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel for the independent traveller”
Reviews.Author: LondonChantalB
Reviews.Content: I stayed here based on the mostly positive reviews on this website. In terms of decor, luxury and attention to detail the hotel certainly did not disappoint. I had a lovely, good sized double room all to myself and it was cosy and warm in the evening when it got a little colder. I arrived on a Monday (a holiday) and staff were a bit thin on the ground, the lady on duty seemed a little stressed and kept saying she was on her own. There was also no room service available although there was a room service snack menu in the room (they should remove this if they don't actually offer their customers room service). Things picked up somewhat on Tuesday evening and Wednesday morning when more staff were on duty, the guys who were on duty at those times were completely genuine in their willingness to be helpful. Full marks to them for their customer service. I also had a wonderful breakfast before checking out, so all in all the trip ended on a positive note. The location was perfect, very close to the Boulevard St Michel with all its amenities, Montparnasse tower and the beautiful Luxembourg Gardens (a must see). I would definitely return to this hotel in the future as the good outweighed the bad - they just need to watch it with some of their staff who need to be made aware that it is important to make sure customers are happy throughout their stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible charm and amazing staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Skylane_Dave
Reviews.Content: If we go back to Paris, we are staying here again. The place is so charming and overlooks the beautiful Luxembourg gardens. The staff were sooo hospitiable. Always asking what they could do to help us. They arranged two tours for us, recommended places to eat and then made the reservations for us, arranged transportation from and to the airport, etc. Royce and Xavier, I can't thank you enough! Also, so many places are in walking distance, like Notre Dame and the Louvre. You can't help but fall in love with this place!

Reviews.Title: “Special Hotel with Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: ZBmom50
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my first trip to Paris, and was fortunate to stay at this lovely hotel right on Luxembourg Garden. Thank you to all the reviewers on Trip Advisor, who helped me make a great choice. This hotel attracted me, not only for the consistently great reviews, but also the great location and the existence of a fitness room (to work off croissants and macarons!). My superior room was on the top floor. I had a window that overlooked the gardens and Rue Servandoni. I heard no noise of any kind, neither from the street nor within the hotel. It was a little oasis after a day of sightseeing. I slept like I've never slept before!The mattress was extremely comfortable with a spotlessly clean and cozy duvet. I took advantage of the deep tub daily. The breakfast room was cheery and bright. The offerings were fresh juice, three choices of cereal including muesli, yogurt, cheese and ham, a huge bowl of fresh fruit (not that gross packaged "fruit salad"), delicious fresh bread (also in loaf shape for toasting) amazing butter and many choices of jam, and a few choices of very high quality croissants/viennoisseries. It was completely worth the 15 euros. Coffee was served with hot milk if desired. We felt pampered. Madame in the breakfast room was lovely. There were also eggs with bacon/sausage for a little extra if desired. You could also have breakfast served in your room. The staff is what makes this place so special, with great suggestions and making calls for reservations, taxies, etc. The team of Laurent, Fabienne, Royce, Xavier, Jules and Michel were always courteous, friendly and professional. There are many wonderful bistros and cafes within a short walk. We actually never took the metro, because we walked everywhere (15 minutes to Notre Dame and the Louvre). We even walked to le Marais one day! I would highly recommend this charming hotel, and would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: LKN-NC
Reviews.Content: The reviews are right -- this is a gem in Paris. Staff is wonderful and the location is perfect for easy access to museums, restaurants, bus and metro.

Reviews.Title: “Top Shelf Hotel with professional, lovely staff!”
Reviews.Author: mlv0619
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel twice while visiting Paris. The staff was fabulous, helpful, and full of great advice. The rooms are perfectly comfortable in size for two, with great beds, lovely amenities and ample space for moving without bruises! It is directly across from the Luxembourg Gardens which is perfect for peering into Paris life and people watching. The hotel is centrally located for sightseeing, shopping, and dining. The staff referred us to some lovely local French restaurants. We especially liked Chez Julien's and Tourndeau (splg) right down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, charming rooms”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel702
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because I asked my Parisian friend if she could live anywhere in Paris, where would it be- she replied near the luxembourg gardens & this hotel had amazing reviews. I stayed here with my sister for 3 nights to visit friends and we each had our own room. The rooms are charming and roomy enough; we had plenty of space for our luggage & closet space (it might be cramped with 2 people to a room). We found everyone at the front desk kind and helpful. The best part of this hotel is the location- right across from the Senat and the Luxembourg gardens. So we always felt very safe- even walking around late at night (there are always police around the Senat building). We loved the neighborhood- restaurants, bars, cafes, marches, shopping- everything you need! (At the end of our trip we stayed at the George V and really missed this neighborhood & the atmosphere). We walked to all the tourist sites very easily. At night it was easy to meet up with my Parisian friend and everywhere she wanted to take us was close by. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “The Staff, The Staff, The Staff - magnificent stay at a magnificent hotel”
Reviews.Author: YooperLJ
Reviews.Content: My trip ended yesterday, but a friend joined me for a week at the awesome HLP. From beginning to end, the staff responded with immediate and no request was too much and I asked a lot. My friend enjoyed early morning walks and said there were many places nearby for eating, shopping, etc. When I asked if I could mail back most of my belongings, and I had a box, within one hour it was out the door and arrived the day I got back! The hotel is so charming and the rooms are sweet and comfortable beds!! I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. I have been to Paris several times before and if you are looking for an oasis in the middle of the bustling city, this is your place. My room was #35, which faced the gardens and even with the street noise, it was quiet and roomy enough for two, altho I chose to stay in it alone. What a lovely view to sit and work at my laptop or step out of the immaculate shower that had a window in the bathroom to see the turning leaves. Special mention to the unbelievably hard-working and dedicated Fabienne, Xavier, and Royce. And the fabulous housing staff. If I have forgotten anyone, I send many apologies.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: pshaw59
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 5 great nights in this wonderful boutique hotel. This was our firsrt trip to Paris and could not have asked for a better location and accomodations. Xavier, the concierge, was very helpul to us with planning day trips outside of Paris and local restaurants. We even spent one lovely evening having a cocktail with the hotel manager's wife who told us various places to visit. Since I have been home I have recommended this place to anyone considering a trip to Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “Made our trip to Paris even more special!”
Reviews.Author: Tennisnutmom
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter to Paris to celebrate her 21st birthday and selected Hotel Luxembourg Parc based on Trip Advisor reviews. While I have personally travelled to Paris on business, I wanted to stay away from the big, lavish hotels to experience more of a boutique-type hotel. I can't say enough about the elegant service we received, and the beautiful accomodations. The room was lovely, the library and sitting area relaxing, and the breakfast room inviting. We felt welcome from the moment we arrived, and it truly made our 5-day trip even more special!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful... Look no further!”
Reviews.Author: MelanieMichael
Reviews.Content: Ah Hotel Luxembourg Parc... This was the beginning of a two week trip to Paris, Provence and Lago Maggiore in Switzerland. Eight years in the planning. Hotel Luxembourg Parc did not fail to live up to it's expectations. Divine. Location perfect. Close enough to everything you want to see but far enough away from the tourist traps. And there are a fair few of those... Fabienne on Reception was a joy to interact with each day. When we first arrived she gave us the choice of two rooms. We went for the bigger one on the top floor and it was wonderful. Sunlight and fresh air from windows on both sides of the bed. We absolutely loved Jardin du Luxembourg. Not normally much of a garden lover it came by surprise. The garden is a wonderful oasis in a city full of concrete and it was such fun exploring it at different times of the day. Especially Friday evening around 6pm. Paris is a lovely city and we spent the perfect amount of time there. The only reason however that i would return to Paris in the future would be to revist Jardin du Luxembourg and Hotel Luxembourg Parc. It was the perfect start to a perfect trip. Thank you Hotel Luxembourg Parc!

Reviews.Title: “Went for location, loved it because of the staff”
Reviews.Author: DempseysATL
Reviews.Content: We loved this boutique hotel for its location and finishing touches, but the staff is the real gem. Xavier, Laurant and Michel are great! They are attentive, offer assistance at every term and can give you local flavor to check out to really see Paris. As for the rooms the AC works totally fine, but the rooms are on the small side (but who cares, your in Paris, get out!). If you get the chance, request room #26. It has a private balcony which is great for breakfast, wine and cheese, etc. We plan to return to Paris and the Hotel Luxembourg Parc can count in us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Europe2010_10
Reviews.Content: I recently travelled to Paris with my 16 year old daughter. I chose to stay at the Luxembourg Parc based on trip advisor reviews and was exceedingly happy with my choice. We arrived from Amsterdam at Gare du Nord and used the RER line B to Luxembourg and followed the Luxembourg Garden fence the walk was only 5 - 10 mins pulling bags. We found the location wonderful, just far enough away from the action to enjoy a sense of relaxation and a really peaceful nights sleep. Our room for the five nights 326 was delightful with 2 windows and twin beds. One window look to the street Rue Vaugirard and the other to the internal courtyard. The beds and pillows were really comfortable - no complaints at all. The weather was very warm and the airconditioning worked a treat. The bathroom was great just the right size and always attention to detail from the room maid Gretchen who prepared our room for turn down most nights. We used the library and computer facilities and had breakfast at the hotel on one occassion for convenience and felt it was adequate but not great value. We had wonderful service in the evenings on our return from huge days sightseeing from Michele and Jules, thank you both for your kind and helpful approach, sightseeing and resturant tips. Can I recommend a creperie on Rue Cannette the 'clown creperie' not to be confused with one a couple of shops away. We tried both and the 'clown creperie' was the best. Eric Kayser on Rue Ancienne du Comedie near Odeon metro had the best croissants for a breakfast treat. We walked all over Paris until 11 or 12 midnight and felt entirely safe at all times especially in the area of the hotel. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel for a fantastic stay in Paris. Every aspect of our stay was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, in quieter neighborhood, near beautiful park.”
Reviews.Author: poogiesue
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Luxembourg Parc. The staff were friendly and very helpful. The rooms are nice size and very clean. The nearby Luxembourg Gardens are absolutely gorgeous! A beautiful place to walk, picnic, or just sit and enjoy the view. There is a good deal of shopping and cafes nearby also. It may be a little further away from some of the big things you want to see in Paris, but the week before we stayed near the Champs Elysee and that was like being on Times Square in NYC. For us a quieter neighborhood was much preferred.

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem of a Hotel in Paris !!”
Reviews.Author: SleepDoc
Reviews.Content: Hotel Luxembourg Parc (4*) www.luxpar.com email: Shhh!!! Please donâ€™t tell anyone about this gem of a hotel. If you are looking for a bargain priced, well-located boutique hotel that has comfortable and relatively large rooms and large well-equipped bathrooms including shower curtains that actually work, then look no further. Not to mention that there is a modestly equipped workout room as well in the basement, just in case you didnâ€™t do enough walking in Paris. The beds are very comfortable albeit a bit soft for my liking, and have very cozy duvets My wife and I stayed there from July 16-10 2010, along with my 2 daughters, 8 and 10. We had 2 adjoining rooms (#12& #14) that were perfect for our family. It is very well located in the 6th, right across from the Parc Luxembourg and a 10-minute walk from the Luxembourg RER station (Line B). There are several close Metro stations as well which are within a 5-minute walk as well. The hustle and bustle of Ave St. Germain is literally a 10-minute walk. There are many excellent designer stores very close to the hotel on Ave Rennes, which again, is very close. The location opposite the parc means that it is VERY quiet at night and you can get a good nightâ€™s sleep-once you gotten over the jet lag that is. The sister hotel La Perle (3 *) is about 500 metres north, closer to St. Germain, and has numerous bistros, and restaurants literally outside its doors. We had most of our meals just along this strip of appetizing, typically Parisian establishments. We particularly enjoyed Ristorante Da Pietro, 12 Rue Mabillon, 75006 Paris, and Tel:[---]. They made excellent wood oven pizza as well as the usual Italian standards. Andreas Spove, the managing director and his multilingual staff (Sara, Fabienne, Royce, Xavier, Michel and Jules) are terrific and will bend over backwards to make your stay very enjoyable. An excellent hearty breakfast (15Euros/pp and half that for the kids) is served in a brightly lit room on the main floor. This includes eggs any style, fresh fruit salad, cold meats, cheese, cereal, yoghurt, pain au chocolates, croissants, coffees and teas. The room rate included a very reliable and speedy wifi access for all of our devices and of course the air-conditioning was standard. Over the years I have stayed in numerous hotels on the left bank but what makes this place special is the location, size of rooms and wonderful staff. This hotel has become my new favorite place to stay in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, beautiful room.”
Reviews.Author: Sector9Boy
Reviews.Content: Hotel Luxembourg Parc hovers around the top of Trip Advisor's list of Paris hotels, dancing with the number one spot off and on. That's not easy given the size of Paris and that there currently 1841 hotels reviewed here. This placement is well earned. The hotel is lovely, very clean, nicely decorated with lush interiors and a warm feel. We stayed in an Executive Room and the added space that gave us was welcome given we were in Paris for 7 nights. Our room's windows opened out to the courtyard and thus was very quite. The room had a nice tv, desk, mini-bar fridge, and was air conditioned. I wouldn't say the AC was icy cold but it certainly helped with the temperatures being into the 30C's almost every day we were there. The hotel is perfectly located, next to one of my favourite parks in the world Jardin Luxembourg, and only a few minutes walk from places you want to be, like Saint-Germaine, the RER, great shopping, restaurants and clubs. My only slight criticism would be the optional breakfast. If i recall it's about 15 Euro per person, the selection of items available is small and frankly you're much better off just walking to a near by cafe or brasserie and having an omelette or pastry and cafe cream for about half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay, excellent service...will return!”
Reviews.Author: limonaia
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Luxembourg Parc after completing a one week canal boating trip on the Canal Du Midi. We found the staff to be exceptionally helpful and the rooms very, very comfortable. We will most definitely stay at the Luxembourg Parc when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice athmosphere, charming rooms but not deserves five stars”
Reviews.Author: bosphorus_view
Reviews.Content: We preferred this hotel for our anniversary trip to Paris based on high ratings given on trip advisor. Surely, rooms were clean, delicately designed and cosy for Paris standards. We stayed in a superior room looking at Lux. gardens at the first floor where there was a continuous noise of -I believe- old-fashioned air conditioner. Also, hotel personnel at reception were not so much friendly as noted in trip advisor feedbacks. They were excessively formal and not smiling-face on the contrary to my expectations after reading the feedbacks. However, the hotel is at a good location, delicately designed, offering a cosy athmosphere and the road in front of the hotel is not noisy (if you are used to almost frequent hooter noise of official vehicles!) Good value for your money but not deserves five stars.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel....look no further!”
Reviews.Author: NJMomMom
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Hotel Luxembourg Parc. Having carefully and thoroughly researched many Paris hotels, I hoped we had made the right choice. So many reviewers wrote of tiny rooms, cramped quarters, crawling across beds to get out of their room, terrible bathrooms with leaky showers, no shower curtains, noise inside and outside the hotel, and ineffective air conditioning. But this fortunately was not the case at HLP. We booked early on the internet and reserved an executive twin-bedded room for 254E per night. We were in Room 11. What a wonderful surprise to enter a beautiful large (approx 13 x 18 ft) room, decorated in Louis XV style. High ceilings, beautiful chandelier, bed side lamps, desk lamp, and recessed ceiling lighting along with 2 sets of windows, overlooking the inner courtyard, made this room bright and cheerful! Black out curtains provided late sleeping on 2 mornings! Our room had 3 closets, one of which held several drawers and the easy to operate safe, which was large enough to hold my netbook computer as well as other valuables. We also had a lovely desk, 2 comfy sitting chairs, a refrigerator, and a flat screen tv with several usual English channels (cnn, bbc). The beds were a bit soft but very comfortable, with standard European duvet/comforter, but no top sheet. The air conditioning was terrific! Individual thermostat and it kept the room quite cool (especially nice since it was very hot the 3 days we were there). The in-room free internet was excellent! The front desk gave us a code, and voila we were connected for the length of our stay. The electrical outlets were plentiful, although one set of our adapters did not work in the hotels outlets. Our second adapter did. The hotel also provides adaptors if you donâ€™t have your own. The bathroom was outstanding! Very large, beautiful marble, big tub/shower, and a shower curtain! The rain shower head was high up the wall (good for tall people) & in addition there was a hand held sprayer, and the tub option. Water pressure was excellent, water hot! Wonderful! The hotelâ€™s hair dryer was heavy, and you had to hold the button on the whole time youâ€™re using it. But it had a nozzle-nose shape and good heat, so I was thrilled! There was plenty of space around the sink and above the toilet to spread out your toiletries too. Housekeeping did a great job replenishing towels each day, turn down service, and keeping things spotlessly clean and they were very pleasant and friendly! The hotel was super quiet! Our room was on the courtyard so we did not hear any street noise from traffic or people. We also had our windows closed and the air conditioning on. But we also did not hear any room to room noise which was a real plus! We found the staff to be extremely helpful and pleasant. Royce was the front desk person we spoke with most often. He was very patient in answering all our questions and printing our boarding passes for our flights home as well as arranging for our shuttle taxi to the airport (19euros per person) Royce speaks perfect English as he is part American, but all the staff speak English. We also met the charming and very cute Xavier! He too was helpful and fun to talk with! We had not planned on eating breakfast at the hotel, given the 15 euros per person cost. But when we realized that we would have a 5-10 min walk to cafes, we changed our minds. The breakfast room was lovely, on the first floor, bright and cheerful. We found the woman who served us to be quite nice, very attentive, prompt in bringing our food, and all buffet items were kept filled. We also had a young man one day, who also was attentive and delightful. So I would have to disagree with the negative remarks about the breakfast. I think for the substantial breakfast we ate each day, it would have cost just as much outside the hotel as in. I guess if you were only having coffee and a croissant, then a cafÃ© would be cheaper. The lobby/lounge area was also charming. A small bar appeared well stocked & a popular cocktail spot. Off the lobby is the library with fireplace and computer for guests use. There is a fitness room in the basement as well. We found the hotel was about a 10 min walk though to subway stops (Saint Sulpice, Saint Germain, Rennes) and to more populated streets of shops & cafes. Immediately around the hotel are the post office, the Senat building, and the narrow side street with residences and a couple of restaurants. The Luxembourg gardens are across the street, with an entrance a few feet down the street. I have indicated I will be happy to answer any email questions anyone has about this hotel. We thoroughly enjoyed staying here and highly recommend it! If we are ever in Paris again, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: PoetfromBirmingham
Reviews.Content: My partner and myself stayed at this charming boutique hotel in April 2010. From the moment we walked into the entrance we were impressed by the standard of service and hospitality of the hotel and staff. Nothing was too much trouble and the advice and requests were dealt with efficiently and quickly. The hotel is a lovely size, compact and professional in every way. There is a lovely bar and library for a quiet drink in the evening before dinner. The room was well equipped and of a good size with a lovely marble bathroom and excellent shower. All you would need in Paris as you spend so little time in the room! The area of the hotel is perfect right by the gardens and central to all the main sights. There are some good restaurants nearby especially La Marlotte approximately 10 minutes away. We are very pleased we followed the advice on tripadvisor and will hope to stay again whenever we are in Paris. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Glowing with quality, supported by excellent service, this hotel is a sanctuary of comfort and elegance”
Reviews.Author: RodJohnButler
Reviews.Content: From the glistening green exterior to the elegant and sophisticated interior, this hotel makes your jaw drop with its beauty and style. The interior is reminiscent of an exclusive club, and every detail, such as the furnishings and furniture simply glow with quality. However, all of this pales in comparison to the quality of the service offered by the staff. You expect staff in a quality hotel to be profefessional and polite, but how many will lean on a personal connection to keep a restaurant open late just for you (Jules) - or who will track down a taxi that you were in to find and retrieve a lost camera (Royce). Paris was hot and very busy during our trip, but the HLP was an oasis that I looked forward to retreating to at the end of each day. Another strength of the hotel is its location - which is ten minutes walk from the Seine, but still away from the crowds, and offering a taste of a 'real' Paris. The stay was not without its incidents - for example I had asked for a room with a view of the Luxembourg garden, but was given a courtyard room, which was very disappointing as it was one of the main reasons I chose the HLP. Also, one of the shower handles broke off and couldn't be fixed for a few days because it was a weekend. However, these issues were overshadowed by the delights we found around every corner. The quality of the bedding, the beauty of the courtyard, the comfortable size of the room, etc. If you are thinking of staying in Paris then you should believe all of the reviews - this hotel is a rare find.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, cozy & luxurious hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: IanHammond
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 days at this hotel in June, on a short break from a longer holiday in London. We arrived early but were greeted warmly by the receptionist and our room was ready. Friendly attentive service, with no hassle re speaking English, though I did try my French!! The Classic room was very adequate with a view out to the Luxembourg Garden, or at least the wall beyond which the gardens were present. Most rooms in Paris are a bit on the small side but this was larger than some and certainly well appointed, clean and with a touch of luxury. The bed and pillows were comfortable and everything ( bar one light bulb, quickly replaced) was in good functioning order. The hotel is small with 22 rooms but there is an elevator to get you up the stairs if your legs are exhausted after a long day of sightseeing. Situated opposite the Luxembourg Park now housing the Senate and in the St Germain de Pres area, this hotel is close to everything and walking will get you to all the main sites on the Seine ( Notre Dame, Ile de Paris, Louvre etc) within 10-15 minutes through fascinating streets laden with interesting shops and places to sit and enjoy food or coffee. The best thing about the hotel apart from the standard of the amenities is the friendliness of the staff...nothing seemed too difficult and they were always ready to please and be helpful. The breakfast room is small but bright and cheerful and a lovely way to start the day....good value we thought. If you fancy a stay somewhere special for a few days on the left bank you will not be disappointed by this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “it was ok”
Reviews.Author: roralism
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay but on occasions felt uncomfortable and out of place, had to cart our own bags to and from rooms and were not welcomed at all, but a beautiful spot and the longer we stayed the more we liked paris.

Reviews.Title: “The Luxembourg Parc is a truly extraordinary place. We love it.”
Reviews.Author: CampToHoNe
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at HLP and as much as we loved it the first time, we loved it even more this trip. The lobby is beautiful and cozy. The lobby bar is as pleasant a place to enjoy cocktail hour as I've found anywhere. The room we had was impeccable - beautiful, comfortable and a fantastice bathroom. And the location is superb - we have loved getting to know 'our' neighborhood from the Gerard Mulot bakery (try the pain au raisin) to the flower shop on Touron to the fresh food market in the tiny "mall." And now you can get Berthillion right up the street (although it's more fun to go to Ile de la Cite)! And having the Luxembourg Gardens as your front yard is just indescribably wonderful. But even more than the spaces are the people - I have never felt more welcome, and more pampered. The bartender Laurent is great. The young man at the concierge's desk is unbelievably wonderful. Even the cleaning staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KarenE
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our wonderful stay at the Luxembourg Parc Hotel. I stayed there with my husband and parents. We had 2 superior rooms on the third floor, one corner room with a view of the Luxembourg gardens and one room with a view of the Rue Servandoni, which is a small side steeet. Both rooms were relatively noisy because of the very busy Rue Vaugirard, even the room on the side street. We all used earplugs, so it did not bother us. The rooms were wonderfully apointed. Very tastful decoration, very French. We absolutely loved our rooms. Inside the hotel was very quiet. It really felt like home to us. The staff bend over backwards to make your stay memorable. Really outstanding hospitality. One exeption was the rude woman at breakfast. We waited over half an hour for our first coffee and then complained at the front desk because she had disappeared and no other staff member was to be found in the breakfast area. After she returned and was made aware of our complaint she became very rude and we also did not get our eggs any more. The lady at the front desk was very apologetic and took the breakfast off our bill. We then decided to go out for breakfast on the remaining days. It is a pity that one woman sets a damper on an otherwise perfect hotel (there are many complaints here at tripadvisor about the breakfast service). BTW on our first morning there was a friendly young man serving the breakfast and this was really enjoyable. The location of the hotel is just perfect. The gardens are so beautiful and fun to walk in and people watch at every time of the day. The restaurants in the area are great, all in short walking distance of the hotel. Thanks to the lovely hotel staff for the perfect suggestions of places to eat and for making each and every reservation for us. We are already planning our next trip to Paris and could not imagin to stay anywhere else. We look forward to our next stay at the Luxembourg Parc.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeslieE
Reviews.Content: Located on the edge of the Luxembourg gardens, this hotle is perfectly situated for relaxation after a busy day in Paris. Not only is the staff incredibly helpful and full of great dinner suggestions but the hotel is spotless,comfortable, well priced ( you can get a discount if you book early on their online site) but they also get a great clientele ,the rooms are spacious and quiet. Behind San Sulpice and close to the metro but you can easily walk everywhere as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oregon2Travelers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at the Hotel Luxembourg Parc. What a wonderful hotel! The location is fantastic, close to many bistros and great shopping. Jardin du Luxembourg is just across the street and makes for a wonderful place to stroll. The neighborhood felt extremely safe and was relatively quiet for being in the city. All of this, plus an excellent staff and beautiful rooms. What more could you possibly need? We're planning another visit soon!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel in a quaint and lovely neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: cjwdoglover
Reviews.Content: Trip Advisor was right on target with the high ranking given to the Hotel Luxenbourg Parc. The location is the best...quiet, lovely and very close to major tourists attractions. My husband and I loved to walk in the gardens across the street in the morning before we started our busy day of sightseeing. We would sit in the sunshine on the green chairs and just enjoyed people watching. The recepton staff is very in tune with the patrons and were always happy to suggest a wonderful nearby restaurant or call for a taxi.. The rooms are beautifully appointed and the white marble bathhrooms are amazing. The housekeeping staff were meticulous and the rooms were very clean with plenty of fresh towels and gigantic showers with plenty of hot water. The breakfast was very delicious and a great way to start the day. We spent seven nights here with a party of eight. Each couple loved the hotel and were happy we had made this our home while in Paris. I highly recommend the hotel and please do not hesitate and take the advise of the concierge when asking for a restaurant recommendation. They know the best neighborhood restaurants in the area! This hotel is a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldwatcher
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights in this delightful small hotel. It is within walking distance of numerous good restaurants, museums, galleries, shopping, parks etc. The staff are English speaking, and instantly make one feel totally at home. They were really charming and most helpful in arranging dinner reservations etc. The rooms are delightfully furnished and have really nice modern bathrooms. However breakfast was not too great.. I think that they must have been short staffed the one day we had breakfast there, as what staff there were were really harried and it took for ever to even get their attention.... not very good at all, with, for example, an almost empty fruit salad bowl sitting there without so much as a glance from the staff. After that we always had our breakfast at a nearby cafe instead. However do not let this put you off staying at the hotel. It is truly lovely with excellent desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “TrÃ¨s Magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: HotelOps
Reviews.Content: First time visit to Paris, which happened to be the final stop on a four-country trip. With so many lodging options available we did quite a bit of research before selecting Hotel Luxembourg Parc...it turned out to be a great decision. Each component of our hospitality experience (the reception desk, morning breakfast, evening cocktail service and nightly turndown) was well conceived and consummated throughout our stay. The soul of this hotel was itâ€™s service â€“ from the GM who assisted us in our efforts to get Eric Clapton tickets prior to arrival and every individual on property during our stay, simply could not have been more delightful and accommodating. We have indeed found a home in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to all high expectations. Service fantastic, a home in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: ctwino
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a word, fantastic. We walked into the Four Season George V and while of course a different hotel, we would have rather stayed at the Lux Parc. As any other hotel I can not see the staff within 5 minutes of our arrival in the evening building a fire for my wife with a delivery of Cafe Au Laut as she likes it. The service was just great, we bombarded Royce with questions and issues and he answered each one well, and with strong dinner recommendations. He got us a window table at Ciel de Paris and Jules Verne. We thought our 2nd floor front street room a bit noisy and he moved us the next day to a perfect courtyard room. I can't say enough about the friendliness of the staff. Only thing Royce - we knew the warm weather would arrive as soon as we left! Rooms were large for a city (we did have executive), clean, well serviced. Location perfect, we wanted to stay on the left bank and our favorite area was walking around St. Sulpice and St Germain. The Parc itself beautiful with the flowers. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and not hesitate to stay there every time I return.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: PeeweeontheRoad
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel in all of Paris. Perfect location. Only 25 rooms, so it's intimate and feels like home. Staff is exceptionally friendly - knows your name and really makes the stay "perfect". We'll stay at no other hotel. It's the best.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Luxembourg Parc!”
Reviews.Author: RKOEsq
Reviews.Content: My wife and I concluded a 17 day trip to France with our second stay at the Hotel Luxembourg Parc. In past years we have stayed at other good hotels in the 6th but felt as if we found a home when we stayed at the Luxembourg Parc in 2009. Our return visit was as good as our original with a beautifully appointed room and helpful staff, especially Xavier. We do not hesitate in highly recommending the Hotel Luxembourg Parc.

Reviews.Title: “I couldn't imagine staying at another place!”
Reviews.Author: alocuzzam
Reviews.Content: My mother and I took the trip to France that we have talked about for 5 years. We chose this hotel for our Paris stop partly due to Tripadvisor. We stayed here for 4 nights. We upgraded to a double executive room. Our room was charming, the location of the hotel is not only convenient to major attractions, but situated in a very quaint neighborhood surrounded by a magnificent park, boutique shopping and good restaurants. The best of all was the service by the staff in the hotel who were so kind and willing to help with any of our requests. They were fun, always smiling. Sara, Royce, Javier, Jules, & Michael - thanks so much for making our trip even more special!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: maire5
Reviews.Content: We were extremely pleased to have discovered this little gem of a hotel. Room was lovely - service friendly, polite, and accommodating, breakfast delightful, and location just perfect for us. Definitely a place to return to!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: leisa
Reviews.Content: We had such a nice time staying at this hotel. The location is perfect in Paris. It is quaint and the staff is excellent and knowledgeable. We definitely will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Another EXCELLENT stay at Luxembourg Parc”
Reviews.Author: TaylorMae
Reviews.Content: We are repeat guests at this terrific hotel. We have stayed here several time throughout the years and have just returned from yet another terrific stay. One of my most important considerations is safety. It is important for me to feel safe when staying at any hotel. Certainly being a clean room is extremely important but safety is also a high priority. I have always felt safe at the Luxembourg Parc and I have never had any issues with the rooms provided and being clean. The hotel is in an excellent location across the street from the incredibly beautiful Luxembourg Parc. The location is near enough that it make it possible to walk to most of the "Paris must see" destinations. It is only a short walk to Notre Dame and the Seine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sundeep-travelbug
Reviews.Content: The best thing we liked were the Croissants for breakfast - among the best in Paris. It is a small hotel, clean and comfortable. The location may not be the most convenient as it is a 10 minute walk to the nearest metro station and you normally have to change once to reach most places. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. They made arrangements to give us a full breakfast early in the morning as we had to catch a flight.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable hotel in a very nice location”
Reviews.Author: Sharrie7
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a long weekend at the Luxembourg Parc which we booked on the recommendation of previous Tripadvisor reviewers. We were not disappointed - the location of the hotel is very convenient and within walking distance of many of the main attractions. Our Executive room was very comfortable and well appointed although no tea or coffee making facilities were provided (but maybe that is just me being English!). All staff were very professional and friendly. The nearest Metro station to the hotel is Saint Sulpice which is closed for refurbishment until sometime in May 2010 so bear this in mind when travelling to the hotel, especially with lots of luggage, as currently the nearest Metro station is Saint Germain du Pres which is a 10-15 minute walk from the hotel. We had breakfast in the hotel which was just adequate for 15 Euros. You would probably find better value in a nearby cafe. Overall we liked the hotel very much and look forward to returning again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Look No Further!”
Reviews.Author: carla0310
Reviews.Content: Wonderful small and charming hotel in an excellent location. Our room (24) was perfect, immaculately clean and peaceful. Staff were pleasant and helpful, recommending restaurants and lighting the (real!) fire for us in the cosy library on our first evening. If I am ever in Paris again I would stay here again. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: sherif_chicago
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the hotel. We travel to Paris about twice a year and have stayed at many fine hotesl in the 6th (Aubusson, l'Abbaye, Relais St Sulipce and Odeon Siant Germain). But Luxembourg Parc will now be our new home in Paris. Cant wait to go back. It is everythign we wanted - cozy, charming and elegant. The staff were so kind and our room was great - the bathrooms were beautiful and had real mounted shower heads which is a plus for my tall husband. The beds were very comfortable and the room was a very decent size. The location is great. The bar was very good and since it was January we really enjoyed the fire in the library every night. Staff were very helpful with all our requests, a step above our experiences at other hotels - none of which were ever bad. I believe that for the quality of the hotel it is an exceptional value. And although we didnt use the fitness center we did check it out and it was very nice. The best part of the hotel for us was Laurent the bar manager - he felt like family by the time we left. Cant recommend enough.

Reviews.Title: “Good but some issues.”
Reviews.Author: SirGeorge61
Reviews.Content: Not sure how to review this hotel. We booked on the basis that it had rave reviews from most other visitors. The hotel is in a great position and though we arrived after dark and left very early morning we still appreciated the position on the gardens. We changed our room for a position with park views and Xavier the concierge was very helpful with this. The fun began when we discovered that there was no hot water and after a long days traveling it was what we were most looking forward to. This problem could not be resolved in the short term so we went to dinner assured that we would have hot water on our return. This was not the case and I had a luke warm bath before bed. Problems did not stop there when my wife discovered hairs in the bed. We think this was a fault of the laundry service as they seemed otherwise clean. By now it was apparent that Xavier who was as charming and helpful as is possible, was the only member of staff in the hotel. He found us new sheets and a double duvet rather than the two very small singles and we made our own bed. I cannot criticise the service but it highlights a problem with the smaller hotels with skeleton staff when things go wrong. This would be OK but they are not cheap. We paid more at this hotel than we had paid last month for a night at Claridges with full breakfast and a bottle of champagne on arrival. Admittedly a special offer but they always seem available if you look. They gave us a 10% discount on our bill which was appreciated but though the hotel is very attractive, well decorated and well positioned, I don't think we will be staying at the Luxembourg Parc again.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Hotel on every level”
Reviews.Author: coopersouthsalem
Reviews.Content: Just returned from one week in Paris at this hotel with our children ages 11 through 20. My wife and I have been in Paris 6 to 8 times previously and have always stayed in hotels that have been very nice. The Hotel Luxembourg Parc, however, is really the best we have experienced. The appointments are charming and lovely, the location is outstanding, the rooms are of a nice size and remarkably comfortable and the service is extraordinarily professional and the most helpful one could imagine. All in all we feel that the value of this hotel is the best of any we have experienced in Paris and would not consider staying anywhere else for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice - no regrets at all”
Reviews.Author: Consultant2468
Reviews.Content: This is one of the very best boutique hotels in Paris. The staff is excellent, always jumping to help you, very knowledgeable about the area and sights and restaurants. The rooms are a little larger than typical Paris. We contacted them in advance and they made restaurant reservations (good choices - they know the places to go) and we were made to feel very welcome when we walked in the door. The only possible downside is the breakfast - the breakfast staff person when we were there was hard to find, we were only able to get one serving of coffee and juice, and the choices were limited. But this did not take away from the overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “While okay, the Ares is better . . .”
Reviews.Author: MandoMan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a few days in October. We stayed here based on the reviews in TripAdvisor. We also stayed at the Hotel Ares since the Parc was not available for our entire stay in Paris. My wife and I both agreed that the Ares was a much better small hotel. Our room at the Luxembourg Parc was the terrace room. The terrace was great. When in the room we used it, since the room was very small. The bedding and furniture were a bit dated. Our biggest problem was that a very nice sweater that I purchased for the trip was stolen from the room. I am normally hesitant to accuse someone of stealing, and prefer to chalk it up to my losing an item; on this particular situation, I knew exactly where I had placed my sweater before I had left my room. When we returned it was gone. As for the staff, they are incredibly nice and helpful as advertised on Tripadvisor. In fact, of the 7 or 8 hotels we stayed in France on this trip, the Parc front desk staff were by far the best. At night, you must walk a ways to find a restaurant. The Hotel Ares has rooms that are updated with very nice bedding. The room was about 150 Euros less but with no balcony. The shower is probably the best I have ever had. It it amazing. We stayed in the Ares on two separate occasions on this trip and both rooms were great. The Ares is in a great neighborhood with two metro stations very close by and excellent neighborhoods that stay open and busy late. There is a great bakery and "supermarket' nearby. Also, FatTire Bike Tours is about 200 yards nearby. The Fat Tire bike tours are wonderful and can be done by almost anyone. I rate both hotels four out of five stars ( even with the sweater stolen, since I know that could happen anyhwere) but if you want to save money, have a nicer bed and bathroom, and plan on just using your room to rest, I would choose the Ares over the Luxembourg Parc.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Mark17
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights at the hotel Luxembourg Parc. Everything was perfect from the moment we arrived and were greeted by Xavier. The hotel is on the edge of the Luxembourg Parc in the St Germain district of Paris which is very quaint and away form the main hussle and bussle of Paris. However, it is only about a 10-15 minute walk to Notre-Dame. There are loads of wonderful restaurants nearby, try Maison du Jardin (only a 2 minute walk from the hotel). The Hotel is very clean and the rooms are very comfortable. The best bit were the staff, they were all very helpful and friendly. Xavier could not do enough for us, he recommeneded places to visit and restaurants to eat at (all were brilliant). We will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: amoretraveler
Reviews.Content: Imagine coming back after a long day of site-seeing and being welcomed by a burning wood fire in a cozy living room and free wine tasting! I can't say enough about my stay at this wonderful small luxury hotel. The staff was extremely helpful with everything... and they all spoke English. The location was great, next to the Luxembourg park -very quiet at night. The rooms were very clean and well appointed. The hotel was decorated beautifully with french antiques and exposed wood beaming. I would recommend taking a boat cruise on the seine -we did the one without dinner and it was great! Also, I recommend the Rodin Museum-it was spectacular -as well as the Louvre! My favorite dinner was just down the street from the hotel at La Maison Du Jardin- go there! For a fun night of live jazz music, go to Caveau de la Huchette -top notch jazz in a cellar surrounding. Enjoy Paris , it is like no other city -and I know your heart will flutter when you see the Eiffel Tower sparking in the night sky!

Reviews.Title: “A little more luxury.....romance and quiet too.”
Reviews.Author: GargoyleAustralia
Reviews.Content: I am as discerning as the next traveller, ...but fail to understand how anybody could fault this boutique hotel. It's decor is charming, ....and all fittings and inclusions in the rooms of the very highest quality and virtually new. It's true Parisian rooms do tend to be small, but the room we occupied was certainly roomy enough, ..even by Parisian standards. We had a double bedroom actually large enough for two adults, a most adequate anteroom with writing desk and a small coffee table and a very large bathroom! At no time did we ever feel cramped. The two sets of french doors that opened onto a quiet courtyard increased the feeling of space and air. The bathrooms are a marble fantasy, with every inclusion such as very luxurious bathrobes, hairdryer, slippers and excellent cosmetics, shampoos and soaps. The small public rooms downstairs are again furnished in a smart elegance which is sure to please those wanting a little French luxury without too astronomical a price. Free internet was a plus, ...in a very elegant little library. While certainly not one of the "cheapies", the location is quiet, ....the nearby Parc Luxembourg a most wonderful place to enjoy a walk and there are plenty of interesting shops nearby. The nearest metro is a bit of a hike though, .....but not impossibly distant if like us, you enjoy walking in Paris. Our breakfast was included and certainly lived up to expectations. The staff we found were very friendly and accommodating and most anxious to ensure we had what we needed. It's a non-smoking hotel which we very much appreciated, ...and the only complaint we could dream up was that a certain female lower employee was fond of using the interior courtyard for a furtive cigarette and her fumes and stench drifted upwards and could enter the rooms if you liked your windows open. We found this odd considering that the rooms all contain discrete but dire printed warnings of fines if the rooms have to be cleaned as a result of guests smoking when it's prohibited. Anyway, perhaps by now she's got the chop! It's certainly quiet, and safe enough to do this here. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting restrained luxury in their surrounds for a few days. It's probably NOT for children, but honeymooners and travellers interested in a bit more comfort in a hotel room than the basics should be more than delighted.

Reviews.Title: “Uniquely charming and cozy Hotel! A treat to return to after a long day in the fantastic city of Paris!”
Reviews.Author: MarinaLV2Travel
Reviews.Content: Very warm and clean with a pleasant atmosphere! The room: Bigger size than expected, and extremely comfortable. Wonderful bathroom! Very good location!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, great location and comfortable accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Cruzangirl
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 3 nights at the HLP. We were greeted by Xavier when we first arrived and he was so helpful. He seemed to work all of the time and no matter what time of day we saw him, he always greeted us with a friendly smile and bon jour. He was helpful with getting us directions to a particular shop and also hired a taxi for our airport transfer home from CDG. The hotel is charming. The location is wonderful, especially for those who like to walk while in Paris. We were nervous about hearing street noise as our room #17 faced the avenue. The traffic subsides in the evening so it was never an issue and it was so nice to look out our window and see a bit of the park. The room was very spacious (important since we had tons of luggage having traveled for 3 weeks). The bed was extremely comfortable. The bed and bath linens were very high quality. The bathroom was also large with a beautiful marble tub. The bath products were also of very high quality and I especially enjoyed the bath salts. We will definitely stay at the HLP again. It is expensive, especially since the US dollar is so poor against the euro, but in Paris the most romantic city in the world, it is worth the splurge!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Boutique Hotel with Amazing Staff!”
Reviews.Author: dre51
Reviews.Content: We cancelled a reservation at another hotel based on a poor Trip Advisor review and made reservations for four nights at the HLP based on positive reviews from other guests. We requested a room facing with courtyard and were very pleased with the large, beautifully furnished room (#31). The marble bath was also large and well appointed with large, fluffy towels and bathrobes. The lobby/bar area is cozy and having a drink in the evening with Laurent tending bar is delightful. While we were there he had complimentary wine tasting on several evenings. We thought all of the staff were exceptional and especially thank Xavier for excellent restaurant recommendations. Jacques was also very helpful, personally coming to our room the first night to help us figure out the television controls. We walked everywhere and found the location to be ideal for sightseeing with the St. Sulpice church a block away, the Luxembourg Gardens outside the hotel and easy walks to the Latin Quarter and St. Germain des Pres. The library included free internet access, which was very nice and my husband was impressed with the fitness facilities. Although more money than we normally spend, this was a splurge that was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to our next stay.”
Reviews.Author: Kristoph09
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent 8 nights at Hotel Luxembourg Parc and could not have been more pleased. HLP certainly lived up to its high rating on this site! Our room was the perfect size (actually bigger than expected), very clean, well-decorated, quiet, and very cozy. The staff was always very friendly and chatty and eager to be helpful in any way possible. In fact they even were happy to make dinner recommendations and reservations for us many weeks before our arrival â€“ a huge help! Itâ€™s also in a good location and nice quiet area of Paris â€“ we walked everywhere (and unfailingly were always happy to return). Weâ€™ve both been to Paris before but this was our first time there together, which could not have gone better in large part due to our accommodations at HLP. Weâ€™ll be recommending HLP to anyone we know ever planning to go to Paris â€“ and plan to be staying here again ourselves given the opportunity which we hope to be soon!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: mjc8412
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights and thought the hotel lived up to the Trip Advisor descriptions. Room size was as we expected for a boutique hotel in a major city, bathroom actually larger than we expected. Free WiFi worked well in our room so we could Skype the kids! We did not eat breakfast in the hotel - there are numerous cafes and patisseries within a few blocks, and we really enjoyed walking through this part of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Champagne,Yes?”
Reviews.Author: hoyleman
Reviews.Content: My wife and i had the absolute pleasure of being able to spend five nights at this beautiful, well run Hotel! !Knowing it was was our twenty fifth wedding anniversary The entire staff welcomed us with open arms throughout our entire stay.Be sure to take the time to introduce oneself to Laurent, the bartender; as his demeanor and knowledge of all Paris will indeed set the tone for your stay! Not be to slighted, Xavier, Jacques(Jack?) Fabien and the entire team go out of their way to make your stay a very special experience. Over the years we have traveled to many different places. and yet we have to admit ,The Hotel Luxemborg Parc easily tops our List as our overall Favorite!!! Au revoir , until next time! Phil And Julia

Reviews.Title: “Can't quite put my finger on why it wasn't great....”
Reviews.Author: Skigoon
Reviews.Content: The reception staff were friendly to a point, it was as if they were impatient though - which isn't acceptable. I speak french so it wasn't that they had to speak English. the hotel is lovely and is in our favourite part of Paris so no problem there. The bar is nice and the reading room is cosy. The room was small but clean with a nice bathroom. It was quite expensive though. I also went on tour to see what the other rooms were like. The next rooms up were fine but not worth paying over â‚¬100 extra, still small and a bit cluttered actually. But really these aren't major issues, we've stayed in lots of hotels in Paris and this is one of the better ones for sure. I just didn't see what all the fuss was about to be honest. It's smart, it's clean, as I said I can't quite tell you why it isn't as good as I thought it would be. Perhaps, it's the awful woman at breakfast who takes the gloss off it. Narky, rude and ambivalent. Not great in a service industry.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jkutun
Reviews.Content: We just came back from the Luxembourg Park on October 2nd. This was one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. We were going to stay in a bigger hotel on the Right Bank (with a high Tripadvisor ranking) but decided on this one after reading Tripadvisor and we weren't the least bit sorry. We had an executive Room (#31) facing the courtyard. It was spotlessly clean, quiet and very French. The breakfast, at 15 Euros, was nice and kept us going for the day. The location was wonderful we walked to the Musee D'Orsay and Notre Dame as well as all over the 6 Arr. But, as others have said, the staff makes the experience! Xavier was wonderful from making reservations for us for dinner to keeping us entertained. Jacques brought us an extra pillow at midnight and has a million stories about Paris. Laurent, at the the bar, Ava and Fabienne were also helpful. They all speak fluent English and are willing to help you with your French. We hope to return to Paris and will not consider any other hotel except this one.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel at an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: eHABERDASHER
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - almost everything is covered thoroughly by other reviews. The staff is quite friendly and all speak English well. They are helpful with any questions or concerns, including our need to borrow an electrical outlet converter. The room itself is small, but that was no surprise. The decor is classically French - luxurious and classy, yet unpretentious. There is high speed internet access (a single computer) in the library. The library itself was also very beautiful as well. The best part, in my opinion, it is just around the corner from Pierre Herme for macarons - they're absolutely incredible! And of course the Luxembourg gardens are beautiful and a great place to take a leisurely walk or jog. We would most definitely consider staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel”
Reviews.Author: journeydog
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed four nights at Hotel Luxembourg Parc and wished we could have stayed longer. We had a lovely, superior room on the corner of the hotel. Yes, there is street noise but all was quiet with the windows closed. We slept soundly each night. Our room was beautifully decorated with a large, marble bathroom. The hotel is spotlessly clean and maid service was efficient and thorough. Our limited interaction with the front desk staff was pleasant and professional. The library has a computer for guest use with free internet access and a printer which was a bonus. The hotel has a lovely breakfast room but we chose to eat out each morning. We particularly loved the location of the hotel - directly across from the Luxembourg Gardens and close to shops, cafes, and restaurants. After a long day of sightseeing, this small hotel was a delight to return home to.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: gadabout25
Reviews.Content: Our party (two couples) recently spent 7 nights at Hotel Luxembourg Parc, and it was a lovely experience. Yes, the rooms are small, as they typically are in Paris; but they were charmingly decorated and very comfortable. Beds and bedding were wonderfully comfy. One of the rooms was very small, but had a terrace; while the terrace faced the street and was thus noisy, the room itself was quiet once the windows and terrace door were closed. The other room was an executive double, slightly larger, which looked out to the hotel's inner courtyard, and was very quiet. Staff was generally excellent, and accommodating to all our needs. Location was good. Small but charming lobby, bar, and library (with computer access). In short, a little jewel of a hotel. I wouldn't hestitate to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room bigger than expected”
Reviews.Author: VATraveler30
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Luxembourg Parc a few weeks ago and really enjoyed our trip. It was my second time to Paris and the thing that stuck out in my memory from my first trip was how small the rooms are in France. We got a standard room at Hotel Luxembourg Parc so I was expecting a very small space, however I was surprised by the size of the room. The rooms wasn't huge by any means, however it was big enough to fit the two of us and our luggage comfortably. The location was great, 5-10 minute walk to several metro locations, including the one to catch the train to Versailles. It was also just a five minute walk to St. Germain street and the Latin Quarter with tons of places to eat and shop. Lastly the hotel is across the street from Luxembourg Parc, a great place to spend an afternoon munching on a pain au chocolat and reading a book.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but overall a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_2009UAE
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at Hotel Luxembourg Parc given all the rave reviews on trip advisor - bit of a mistake! We stayed for 4 nights. Great location if you want to mingle with the locals. Metro also a short 5 min walk. Our room was an executive room at 350 euros a night (not cheap) and rather small which was a big disappointment. We also requested a room with views of the Luxembourg garden but only got a view of the street. Reception staff friendly enough (but nothing exceptional) and spoke good English. Breakfast was ok but unless it's included in your room rate you're better off eating at one of the nearby cafes. The lady hosting the breakfast area could also make an effort to smile. Restoration works were being carried out while we were there which meant jumping over muddy water puddles! Biggest angst was the fact that two authorisations were made on our credit card, which meant the hassle of calling the bank when we returned home. Recommend that you get them to confirm that they will complete the pre-authorisation on checking-out before authorising them to debit your credit card otherwise they'll debit it twice. Overall good location but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel. Great Location. Excellent Staff.”
Reviews.Author: tomcrash
Reviews.Content: The difference between a good vacation and a great vacation in Paris is not the weather, or the sights, or the food, or the hotel location - those you have a pretty good idea of what to expect prior to your trip. You will plan to see the Eiffel Tower, Versailles, the Louvre or other museums, Notre Dame, Sacre Coeur or any of the other wonderful attractions that Paris has to offer. You can see them by bus, by train, by boat or by foot. Depending on your budget and your taste buds - you will find something that fits. But the unknown is the hotel, and while sites like this one are helpful - it is still the unknown. Everything about this hotel exceeded our expections thanks to the wonderful staff. Everyone we dealt with: Sara, Andreas, Jacques and especially Xavier seemed to adopt our party of fourteen as if we were family. It was the best hotel experience we have ever had and we have travelled extensively. Thanks to everyone for making our family vacation unforgettable. The Collisons.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: mdmom4
Reviews.Content: I loved our stay at the Hotel Luxembourg Parc this July. My teens were skeptical at first after leaving London however quickly warmed up to the hotel and particularly the staff with a special merci to Xavier . The hotel is across from the Luxembourg Gardens and near St. Suplice. It is not too touristy and yet not too far from the Musee D'Orsay (wonderful) and the Louvre (overwhelming). Our room was lovely and the kid's room was smaller yet more than adequate. The hotel had wireless which we didn't have in London. Everyone was friendly, helpful and gave us wonderful advice and support. I also loved being in St. Germain des Pres - less hectic than other districts in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location ... great service!”
Reviews.Author: Practically-Speaking
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Luxembourg Parc for 10 nights in the later part of July 2009. The staff were extremely helpful in all cases and especially in locating restaurants and giving directions to the sights and transportation networks. Many points of interest St. Sulpice, Lourve, Tulliere's Garden, Notre Dame, Monteparnasse Rail Station, Metro are in easy walking distance. The Eiffel Tower and Arc de Triomphe a short and inexpensive metro ride. Numerous brasseries, cafe's and restaurants are close by the hotel; our habit was to walk out in the evening and stop to dine at an interesting restaurant; not once were we disappointed. One evening we chanced on the manager of the hotel and he gave us a recommendation and walking directions to a restaurant he described as the quintesential Parisian experience; it was unique and enjoyable in every way. The hotel itself was immaculately clean, linen changed regularly and service performed without any hesitation. Even an electrical issue with the AC which occured sometime over Saturday night, reported Sunday morning was corrected before Sunday evening.
