All the staff are to be commended on their attention to duty and detail, Xavier, Jacques, Fabienne(if I remember her name correctly) and others I do not unfortunately remember their names. I have read the other reviews on Trip Advisor for this hotel. The positive ones I fully understand. The few negative reviews are unwarranted and as far as our experience inaccurate.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull location”
Reviews.Author: LA.CO.ANTRIM
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel.Stayed here for 5 nights and we were so glad we had choosen the hotel and area.We were a bit disappointed by the size of the room,and although we had booked just a classic standard I think they may be different styles and sizes and we happened to get a small one.That said we had a lovely view of Luxemburg Park (where we had a couple of picnics) the room was spotless,the bed very comfortable,towels changed twice a day if needed,The aircon was excellent and quiet and little touches like it being left on for us when we came back from a hot day were appreciated.The hotel itself has just 23 rooms.The bar is lovely full of ambience with little vases of fresh flowers and candles lit at night on all the tables.There is also a small library bar with a fire place which I'm sure would be lovely in the winter.The bar man Lauren is great fun and recommended us some great restaurants.He makes fantastic cocktails too!!We loved the area .Apart from the park there are loads of bistros and restaurants nearby and the centre of St Germain and the Latin quarter are all nearby.We walked everywhere apart from doing the hop on /off tour bus for two days.This was our second time in Paris ,last time we stayed near the Champs Elysee but we much preferred this area.I would highly recommend this hotel,we had a fantastic time and the staff and the hotel made our trip memorable.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem on the Left Bank”
Reviews.Author: ItOnlyMe
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 2 stays at the Hotel Luxembourg Parc (July 24-26 and August 1-3) before and after a barge cruise in Burgundy, and our visits were perfect bookends for our tranquil float down the River Yonne and the Lower Nivernais Canal. Although we were not happy with the room originally reserved for us (small with no view as advertised), the staff was most accommodating and we eventually settled into an upgraded executive suite (Room # 51) which was spacious, comfortable and luxurious, with one of the nicest bathrooms we have ever experienced. The room was more expensive than the one originally booked, but the manager made a fair adjustment, and we were able to stay in the same room both before and after our barging tour. The Luxembourg Parc is a charming small boutique property with a location that is absolutely perfect for anyone who wants to stay on the Left Bank - on Rue de Vaugirard, directly across from the Luxembourg Gardens. The hotel is within easy walking distance to sites and tourist attractions (Louvre, Musee d'Orsay, Notre Dame, Seine river cruises), shopping (Bon Marche) and restaurants (Helene Darroze, Brasserie Lipp). It is close to the Latin Quarter and the Sorbonne, with bustling markets and cafes. The neighborhood is elegant and the feel of the area is quintessentially Parisienne. The staff was accommodating and helpful, especially Fabian, the manager with whom we dealt, and Xavier, the desk clerk/concierge, who could not do enough for us and was invaluable in providing restaurant recommnedations, making dinner reservations and supplying maps and faultless walking directions. The hotel has a charming Breakfast Room where continental breakfast is served daily, as well as a small but comfortable lobby bar and a well-appointed library with a computer terminal. It also has free in-room wi-fi internet service. We found the Luxembourg Parc on-line through Trip Advisor, and its No # 2 overall rating in Paris is well-deserved. If you prefer quiet boutique hotels as we do, the Luxmbourg Parc is a real find.

Reviews.Title: “Clean boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ajoin
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean boutique hotel. Breakfast average. Rooms clean.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, gracious friendly helpful staff, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: rebeccawNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Luxembourg Parc for five nights during our very first trip to Paris. The location was perfect as a base for touring and a wonderful place to come back to at night. Easy walking distance to a wide variety of restaurants. All of the staff was helpful, but Jacques, the night concierge was particularly warm and gracious.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel in a superb location with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: vss-mpls
Reviews.Content: We just returned from eight days at the Hotel Luxembourg Parc. The hotel is located directly across the street from the Luxembourg Gardens, a block or so from St. Sulpice, making it a perfect location to enjoy not only the lovely Luxembourg Gardens, but the Latin Quarter and the area surrounding it. There are all sorts of excellent restaurants and shops within a few blocks, and the stroll to them is itself a treat. The hotel is a gem. You can quickly tell that the owner and the staff take pride in how it is maintained. There is a lovely, small, quiet bar on the main floor, as well as a library and courtyard, where you can have a glass of wine or a coffee and visit with the staff or your fellow travelers. The fabrics, art work, furniture and toiletries in our room were of high quality. The room was spotless and the service thorough and effortless. Best of all, the staff was warm, helpful, very knowledgeable, and spoke perfect English (and was very patient with my efforts at speaking French). Many thanks especially to Xavier and Laurent for making our stay particularly enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “fabulously friendly and helpful staff, sweet location, pretty room”
Reviews.Author: taowow
Reviews.Content: wonderful small and personal hotel, clean and classy, quieter location next to Luxenbourg parc, Xavier the young day manager is wonderfully friendly, cheerful and informative. Great intro to France and Paris. Everything is within a mile or 2 . nice boutique reception and cocktail area. comfortable and very clean. A great little library/sitting area..........recommend this to everyone. abientot !!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: JJRMaryland
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights July 4 - July 9 2009, We chose the hotel based on location and excellent reviews and we were not disappointed. The room was very comfortable and peaceful. The breakfasts were excellent. Jacques and Andreas took care of us with excellent directions and restaurant reservations. The location of the hotel was perfect for us with its proximaty to Luxembourg gardens and all the highlights of the 6th. We hope to come back for another trip to Paris and would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Not deserving of #1 rating”
Reviews.Author: Anrmd
Reviews.Content: Checking out briefly and have no qualms about leaving. Hotel was well located and room was attractive. Bed and bedding not that comfortable. Two smaller beds placed together for a king size not that unusual but odd small covers for each person- a nuissance. Bathroom is nice with marble floor and good bath/shower. I was unimpressed with the service pretty much from checkin. Smeone brought our bags up, dropped them, said "welcome to Paris", then turned and left. In many years of travelling have never experienced anything like this (yes, I have been to Paris before) and was pleased not to offer a tip. Another person working the front desk during the day was cordial but dismiisive and slightly patronizing (she is not French BTW). I always felt like a bother although perhaps I am. I did find Xavier at front desk to be pleasant and helpful. His dinner rec to us was quite good and he was helpful with planning metro stops- subway here quite good and very efficient. Lobby is small and unimpressive. Did not have the breakfast but it looked very average compared to other hotels he have been to in Europe and the U.S. Not sure of the cost for the breakfast but there are many places nearby to eat. Our room (#11) overlooked a small courtyard with a fountain- not bad and generally quiet with exception of some occ noise from nearby elevator shaft. Internet in room never worked properly and issue was not fixed despite several requests. I was able to log on to a weaker signal via hotel's library. Access point dedicated to room never connected. OK, so the hotel is decent but in my opinion has some flaws. I am going to re-examine my relliance on trip Advisor because it does not typically factor in "star" or "diamond" rating system. This is a nice boutique type hotel but I did not find it as comfortable or service oriented as a chain hotel (Sofitel Arc de Triomphe) I stayed in two years ago. As I am aware that opinions are subjective (age, gender, education, income) for reference I am a 51 yo physician from La Jolla, Ca. I would not recommend this hotel to my friends but to each his or her own. Too bad for me as my travel agent has suggested I stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Friendly staff went out of their way.”
Reviews.Author: benchtalker
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Location is great, very central. The staff, from desk clerk to the cleaners were very friendly and made our whole experience memorable. The rooms are of a good size for Paris. Would recommend this hotel to any who ask.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ziskinct
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Paris and the hotel was in an excellent location in a quiet area.. We enjoyed immensely the breads, cheeses etc. for breakfast. The staff was very friendly and helpful especially Jacques and Lauren at night. We had an early taxi arrival for our departure and Jacques made sure he had breakfast for us before the taxi arrived. I would heartily recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Here is one gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: gordonwaxy
Reviews.Content: The Lux-Parc is our favorite Paris Hotel, and we have stayed at many others on the Left Bank. The rooms are the size that Americans expect and are well appointed. Its special feature is the staff, from Sara during the day to Jacques at night to Mia in the breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “A little Oasis by the Gardens....”
Reviews.Author: dins95
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Luxembourg Parc for 3 nights on our 1st visit to Paris at the end of May. When we booked our room they only had a standard room for 2 of the 3 nights so we were ably to negotiate an executive room at the standard room rate for our whole stay. These rooms were a good size for Europe whith a beautiful and large bathroom. Both the bedroom and bath felt very clean and new. The people at the front desk were delightful and very helpful, though there seemed to be someone new each day heading the desk. The rooms were extremely quiet from both the outside and inside of the hotel. My only complaint was that while we were there our room's a/c was broken and the older woman who was the only constant at the front desk did not seem to be too concerned with this complaint and it was not fixed while we were there. Luckily for us it was not too hot while we were in Paris and the 2 fans that housekeeping brought up made it bearable for our stay. But for a 4 star hotel paying close to $400 it would not have been acceptable on the day we left as it was 80 in our room. Overall though it was a fantasic experience and we would gladly go back in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: sallbart
Reviews.Content: Six of us spent a night here at the end of May to celebrate a 40th. Although a little on the pricey side, it was worth every penny. Although only a small (ish) hotel we were greeted as soon as we got out of the taxi by a member of staff who knew exactly who we were. The hotel had a good feel about it as soon as you entered reception and the bedrooms didn't disappoint. They were spotlessly clean and very comfortable. The staff were helpful and Jacques (on night service) was particularly entertaining and patient with my parents at 1am in the morning!! (yes too much wine and brandy on the Bateaux Parisiens!) The breakfast was perfectly adequate although it would have been nice to have had the opportunity to help yourself to orange juice. The hotel is in a great spot opposite the Luxembourg Parc gardens and in a quiet part of the city. We had a very memorable stay and very much look forward to returning for a longer stay(perhaps when the pound is stronger!).

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: kkitty2009
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at Hotel Luxembourg Parc (HLP) May 13-19, 2009 and it was one of the highlights of our very first visit to Paris. Our trip was a birthday gift from my step-father/mom's husband. What a gift! I reviewed many, many hotels prior to booking our lodging before deciding on HLP. We weren't disappointed! Everyone at the HLP was so helpful and polite and really made our stay special. Laurent, the bartender, was a delight. He served up champagne and great conversation when we would come back from long days of sightseeing. Veronique, Fabian, Jacques and a new trainee (young man whose name escapes me) were amazing and gladly helped us with any request we had.....be it from a restaurant recommendation to which bus to take to see the eiffel tower to stamps to helping us schedule a tour to Versailles. Our tour to Versailles was another highlight of the trip. You can probably do it on your own, but I think you get more by having a tour and learning of all the nuances of this place. The gardens and water fountains are magnificent. Water fountains run on the weekends only. Back to HLP....our room looked very french and beds and bathroom cleaned and ready for us every day we returned from a long day of touring thanks to Gretchen! One thing I miss most are the beds and pillows. They were so comfortable!!!! One tip that we were not aware of in Paris and I didn't come across in any of the travel books I purchased, have plenty of euro coins (1 and 2 euro) as metro doesn't take bills. Or purchase the ticket of ten. The coins come in handy regardless and you can break a 20 euro bill at a bank for a roll of 1 euro coins. It was a lifesaver mid trip for us. The breakfast is OK at 15 euro...it's a revenue producer at all hotels. We did this a few days but decided to walk up to the McDonald's and get an egg sandwich, coffee, etc for less. At least there are options to fit different preferences! Laurent, Veronique, Fabian, Jacues, Gretchen and new trainee - thanks for making our stay so enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel at excellent value”
Reviews.Author: claudio756
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel in very nice location in Paris. Service was excellent all around including housekeeping. Only complaint would be that the rooms are on the small side, but very well organized with marble bathroom and an excellent air conditioning system. Have stayed before at The Crillion and Le Bristol whcih are great hotels at 3 times the price and was not dissapointed in this hotel but it obviousley cannot compare to those hotels. Had an excellent meal at Maison du Jardin down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Very Charming & Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: lsmith3819
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4 nights at the Luxembourg Parc and were very impressed. The hotel is charming and very comfortable. We liked the smaller, more intimate size of this hotel and the decor is perfectly "Paris". The friendly & helpful staff made us feel welcome and went out of their way to accomodate us. We stayed in room 26 which features a wonderful terrace patio. The location was ideal for us, quiet but close enough to walk to the night life. I enjoyed looking at the trees in the Luxembourg Gardens from our terrace. Overall, an excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “a perfect jewel”
Reviews.Author: journalistNewYorl
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel was so friendly and comfortable i will certainly stay here the next time I am in Paris. The Luxembourg Gardens across the street are a beautiful morning walk that captures the essence of Paris. The rooms were beautifully decorated in very charming french traditional style and the bathroom was luxurious. The desk managers were always very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was scrumptious and with flaky french pastries, but there was healthier cereal if you chose to deprive yourself. The library was a nice place to sit in the evening before going out to dinner. The neighborhood was filled with great little restaurants and we caught a lovely classical concert in the church of St Suplice which is a block away. This is a great hotel if you want to have the neighborhood experience in Paris and get away from the tourist hoards.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Attentive Staff, Genuine Gem!”
Reviews.Author: BaseballFan113
Reviews.Content: We just returned from holiday in Paris where we stayed at this lovely Hotel. It was everything and more than we had hoped for. The first thing that struck us was the scent of the hotel itself. The aroma immediately delights the senses and calms the soul. We were greeted with a staff that was friendly and attentive. Our room, while smaller than American hotel rooms, was absolutely lovely. Sitting at the bar in the evenings enjoying a glass of wine and champagne while chatting with other guests and the bar manager Laurent made the conclusion of each day that more delightful. The hotel was charming and the staff was welcoming and gracious.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful honeymoon experience”
Reviews.Author: pomoto
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Luxembourg Parc was a tremendous place for my wife and I to stay for ten days over New Year's on our honeymoon. Anything that we needed, the incredibly sweet and attentive staff took care of it instantly - whether it was making reservations for us at local restaurants, booking us a New Year's Eve dinner, or offering suggestions about places to visit. Each morning, we were greeted with complimentary breakfast in bed, and each night, we relished the opportunity to have a nightcap at the hotel bar and lounge, discussing our trip and French culture with our gracious and passionate hosts. The room size was perfectly fine for us - very roomy and on a high floor overlooking the Luxembourg Gardens - and the marble bathroom was spectacular. We will never forget how comfortable the staff made us feel, and we look forward to a return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel...excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: FergChicago
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights at the end of April and I was 100% pleased with the hotel. The service was excellent and the staff was friendly. It is a great location and walking distance to so many things! The room was darling and always clean! Laurent Bizy (Chef de Bar) was friendly and gave excellent recommendations to restaurants...have a Kir Royale at the bar and have a chat with him. Excellent value! If you are visiting Paris, stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Friendly staff. Best value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: MonsieurVegas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Luxembourg Parc in April 2009 based on the reviews shown here. Generally, I would say the hotel offers some of the best value in Paris. The location was excellent -- directly across the street from the Luxembourg Parc and very near the Blvd. St. Germain -- plenty of restaurants and cafes. The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful and spoke excellent English (esp. Jacques). My only disappointment perhaps was that the rooms (and the bar area) were somewhat smaller than I had expected given the pictures. However, they were very clean, and the bathroom (where you spend most of your time anyway) was very nice. The hotel had a nice courtyard and downstairs bar area where people seemed to enjoy a drink or so everynight. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel as there were so many other options (try Gerard Mulot down the street for pastries!!!), but the breakfast room seemed very nice. There is also a very nice looking workout room downstairs. In the past we have stayed at the Hotel d'Aubusson which we enjoyed and which has a great location as well, (which I would give 4 stars to versus 3 1/2 for the Hotel Luxembourg parc). But the prices were around 370 euros / night versus 250 euros. So it depends what your budget allows. Nonetheless, I would definitely go back and would certainly recommend both to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Everything many of the other reviews say it is.”
Reviews.Author: DavidHBerkshire_UK
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. I booked several rooms for a group of old friends gathering here from all points and had no complaints and many positive comments. The rooms were good quality, with good beds and a reasonablty spacious bathroom. Breakfasts were really very good; the juice , fruit and pastries were all excellent , and the service aspectswere efficient and delivered pleasantly. Good location too with no night noise from either inside or outside the hotel. A pleasure to be there, and with look we'll be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Parisian feel in this gem, perfected located Hotel and soooo French!”
Reviews.Author: laurentv1
Reviews.Content: You're an Amercian, you want to feel French, place is the one! Jacques the "Night" guy knows it all and tells it all... Vive Le Parc Hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel except for a 10 euro toothbrush”
Reviews.Author: WorldtravelerB
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel with spacious well appointed rooms, exceptional bathrooms, good location for exploring Paris by walking, better than average breakfast and courteous staff with outstanding service. The only disappointment was being charged 10 euros for a toothbrush by a night clerk only to discover later from another couple in the hotel that there were complimentary toothbrushes in their room.

Reviews.Title: “A True Gem”
Reviews.Author: JanetCC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, borth frequent travellers, just returned from a two night stay and have nothing but positive feedback to share. Even compared to New York City, Paris can be a noisy, busy, crowded place, but a mere few blocks from the bustle and traffic is this charming, welcoming hotel. Having ready access to the Luxembourg Gardens, the RER (a really economical and convenient way to get from Charles De Gaulle-the Luxembourg stop will put you just across the park and an easy walk to the hotel), and quaint neighborhood restaurants. Blanking on the name of the lovely neighborhood place we ate one evening on Rue de Sevaradoni, but it is mid-block, delicious and fun. Enjoyed a night cap with the delightful company of Jacques, bartender/night front desk person. It's these moments of conversing with locals that really make a trip special. If you are looking for an elegant room, quiet and convenient neighborhood, and to relax and acclimate to a new time zone and City, this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic 40th birthday treat”
Reviews.Author: astobat
Reviews.Content: Taken here by my husband as a surprise trip for my 40th birthday. Absolutely loved the hotel and Paris. Location fantastic, so easy to get to by metro from the airport, and useful to have Luxembourg Parc opposite for a relax if necessary - not that you'll have much time to relax with so much to see and do. Much preferred the location of this hotel to one on the Champs Elysees which was so touristy, here we felt like we were in 'real' Paris. Being a smaller hotel it can offer you a more personal service, the room was delightful, breakfast excellent and staff very helpful in suggesting and booking restaurants. Visited Versailles and was left speechless by the gardens and musical fountains - simply outstanding. Note, if you're off to an event at the Stade de France, it is on the same metro line. Had such a fantastic time, we can't wait to return, and Hotel Luxembourg Parc will be first on our list.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location, lovely hotel, shame about the receptionists”
Reviews.Author: brassey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had four days staying here at the end of six beautiful weeks in Europe. It was a gentle ten minute walk from the Luxembourg station (even dragging suitcases with 6 weeks of shopping!) The front of house staff we met on arrival were obviously at the end of a long shift. Contrary to other reviewers we did not find them either friendly or welcoming, although the gentleman who ran the desk in the early hours was really terrific! All that aside, the location of this hotel is outstanding and more than made up for any surly staff. Whilst the room was adequate it did have a fabulous marble bathroom which was huge. It also had a large window opening on to great views of the Luxembourg Gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous Service, Comfort and Location”
Reviews.Author: ravenna
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed three nights here and were completely satisfied. The staff were very helpful and accommodating before and after our arrival. Our executive room was comfortable, well-appointed, quiet and spotless. I looked forward to breakfast each morning, served, no less, with Gerard Mulot pastries. In my opinion, the location is perfect -- a pleasant walk to the major museums/monuments near the Seine and across from the Luxembourg Gardens (a perfect spot to pass a sunny Sunday afternoon). There are excellent restaurants in the area. Don't miss dining at La Maison du Jardin or Le Timbre. I have stayed at other boutique hotels in the 6th, but none had the same warmth and charm of HLP.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasureful stay.”
Reviews.Author: loricassin
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights in March and had a wholly pleasant experience. The rooms were meticulously maintained, as was the overall hotel. The staff assistance was excellent, the breakfast was delicious. The location of the hotel was excellent for shopping and site seeing. Overall an excellent establishment that I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: spaceduk
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel, the room was lovely with a stunning view over the Jardin de Luxembourg. The staff were friendly, courteous and although this hotel is expensive, it was worth every penny. I have spent alot of time in Paris over the years and I will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip and a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: picklesmcd
Reviews.Content: The Trip Advisor reviews nailed this one. This is a great hotel with a great location. I took my wife to Paris last week for her 40th and I can honestly say that we had the best vacation that we have ever had together. The hotel was superb. Contrary to other reviews our room which was number 25 was very spacious along with a very big comfortable bathroom. Breakfast in the a.m. was great along w/ the service at the bar by bartender Laurent. My only suggestion to the hotel would be to restock the refrigerator in the room with water. We drank the 3 bottles that were in there the first night and they were never restocked. I highly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless, efficient, and truly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Europamonkey
Reviews.Content: We arrived here in the middle of January during a freezing cold snap (-6 degrees Celsius) and heavy snow. The hotel is perhaps a 5-10 minute walk from the nearest metro/RER station, and is opposite the Luxembourg palace and gardens. St Germain is easy walking distance, with the Musee d'Orsay and Notre-Dame perhaps 20 moinutes walking. We were warmly welcomed and check-in was efficient. The room, although quite small (normal by Parisian standards), was beautifully furnished and spotlessly clean. The breakfast was good, with a range of cereals, ham cheese, and cereals on a buffet. Cooked breakfast was available from a menu, and cooked to order. The library had a fireplace, which wasn't lit on our first night, but was on the second - great, considering the cold outside. There is a computer with free internet access in the library. Bar service was efficient. There is no restaurant, but being Paris, plenty of options nearby. All in all, a very pleasant stay, and would definitely return in a potential future trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet street but close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Hornbaek
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at your hotel and felt at home immediately. Appreciated the Danish duvets as a speciality. The location was perfect for us as we celebrated New Year's Eve at La Coupole. Friendly and helpful service with a bar that was nice to come home to. We stayed four days and found the room to be large enough and the bathroom very nice. The breakfast was good with delicious bread and pastries and a lot of coffee. We would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Always a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: MadPark
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel Luxembourg Parc many time, and it never fails to delight. They remember your preferences, from the room you prefer to the drink you prefer. Excellent service and the perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: passenger_delay
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after extensive research on Trip Advisor. Although it was more expensive than I had planned, this was due to the weak Sterling against the Euro and not the fault of the hotel. I came here for my wife's 40th birthday and the hotel provided a bouquet of flowers in the room as requested on our arrival. The room was comfortable and clean with a good sized bathroom. Since we were on a short break, we had only brought hand luggage and therefore were very limited in what toiletries we could bring. Fortunately the hotel provided shampoo, shower gel, body lotion, razor, shaving foam. The breakfast was delicious with fresh bread & pastries from a local boulangerie. The staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel, booked return stays”
Reviews.Author: Pins25
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our 20th wedding anniversary here. Trip Advisor was the main reason we chose this hotel. I had been to Paris before and thought St. Germain would be the area for us. We could not have been happier with our choice. Staff was extremely helpful and spoke English for those of us with rusty French. The hotel was spotless, the room (14) was a nice size and had a beautiful bathroom. I am coming back January 9 for 3 nights for business and have booked here again. Also taking the family over Presidents holiday in February and staying here as well. Getting back to the staff, we spoke with Fabienne and Andreas and they were eager to help. In fact, Andreas told me of a place for the Giants football game a short 10 minute walk away. Lastly, we really enjoyed speaking with Jacques. He was at the small but quaint bar at evenings end and provided much information.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay! We'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: Woodshaper
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at HLP based on the recommendations and reviews on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. This is a beautiful hotel that is perfectly located and very comfortably appointed. All Paris has to offer is a short and enjoyable stroll from the hotel and yet the area is so quiet and quaint. Unfortunately we did not have the pleasure of meeting Fabienne and Jacques until our last night there. By the time we retired to our room after some champagne and conversation, we felt like long time friends of both. But that is the constant theme of this great hotel. We definitely plan on staying there on our next visit too Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful customer service”
Reviews.Author: WorldEventPlanner
Reviews.Content: i am in the business of finding hotels for my clients so, evidently, i've seen both, good and less good. but this hotel disappoints most dramatically in customer service. if the owner ever reads this, i'd encourage them to review their staff's handling of the business. because some members of their reception staff are at the very core of not keeping clients in or worse, attracting [more] clients to this venue. forgetting to apologize when having a client find a frozen room in the middle of winter and after a long flight, debating on whether it was the client's imagination on the low temperature or not, rolling eyes over when inquiring if any problems with the internet connectivity, discussing the client's "imaginary" complaint on room temperature with another staff member in french--in front of the client, assuming the client did not understand the language--being given the receipt without even being asked if the stay was enjoyable or not... all part of how a hotel should NOT be run. shame. one pays no less than 270 euros a night to witness front desk staff turn the value of a hotel's business to nil.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, small, elegant”
Reviews.Author: dublintraveller100
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our weekend stay in the Luxembourg Parc and think it deserves its four star rating.. The hotel is well located in the Latin Quarter, opposite the Senate and the MusÃ©e de Luxembourg, close to St Germain but several minutes walk from the nearest MÃ©tro. The immediate area is quiet. This is a small hotel in many ways, a conversion of an old building. There are just 23 rooms, of varying sizes but generally quite small, and compact public areas. Our room was elegantly furnished in traditional style - including the original roof beams - and the only irritant was poor lighting (but not in the well equipped marble bathroom). Thereâ€™s a library lounge, a bar, a fitness centre, an indoor courtyard, and a small breakfast room. There is no restaurant (but plenty of choice nearby). The staff were all pleasant and helpful and the overall experience relaxing. The breakfast is a good compromise between American and French tastes. There is a public computer and free WiFi. This hotel is a good choice for those who like their luxury understated and moderately priced for Paris. Itâ€™s certainly one of the best we have used in our many visits to that city. But it is small, a place for sleeping in rather than living in and probably better for a short stay. Tip - avoid the Taverne St Germain, the worst restaurant we have encountered for a long time, anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy charming beauty”
Reviews.Author: piiiiix
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely hotel on our stop-overs to and from remote vacation destination. It is a very quite and tidy hotel, perfectly located for a relaxed city break. Our room on the way to destination was just fabulous - large, with a very nice bathroom; the one on the way back was much smaller. The hotel staff was very helpful and compitent, theirs recommendation for the restaurant was very good. We will definitely stay here again. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, wonderful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: johnandmaggie
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary and checked trip advisor as well as the hotel website and the Lonely Planet guide. The hotel, for us, was situated perfectly, close to interesting shops and a great selection of cafes and restaurants arounf the Luxembourg area and St Germain des Pres. The hotel is small and very friendly. A lovely library (with a real open fire!) and bar. The room was very well appointed and very nicely furnished, with excellent bathroom facilities. There were only two issues: firstly, our king sized bed had two single duvets, which was unusual. Secondly (and both of these things might common practice in Paris?), there were no tea or coffee making facilities in the room. Those issues apart, we thoroughly enjoyed the stay and would recommend it to anyone, bearing in mind that it is not one of the cheaper places to stay!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: JamesandVictoria
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this beautiful hotel in September, and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. We arrived a little early for the usual check in but were quickly and efficiently shown to our room. The room was quite a reasonable size, very clean and tastefully decorated with period furniture sloping ceilings and beautiful french fittings in the bathroom, The bathroom was marble and even though the shower was over the bath it was easy to use and the water pressure was good. The soap, shampoo and other products in the bathroom were french and of a very good quality. The staff were nice and very helpful. On the day we arrived we were tired and hungry and the receptionist directed us to a restaurant just up the street which was excellent. The location of the hotel was fantastic, just across the road from the beautiful gardens and only a short walk to Blvd. St. Michel and St. Germaine. Musee D'Orsay, the river Seine with the artists and souvenir sellers, Notre Dame and many other places of interest, shops and restaurants. The metro and RER train stations are only a short walk away and easy to use once you get the hang of it. Take the RER train to Versaiiles, it only takes about 40 mins and is a really interesting trip. The palace itself is unbelievable, you really have to see it and the grounds are huge. We really loved the hotel and wished we had more time to spend there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: benjaminliu
Reviews.Content: Large room and bathroom, breakfast included, gym (!) not cheap but worth the extra money if you want quality accomodations without staff fussing about.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: MM_Northampton
Reviews.Content: Our 7th visit to Paris & finally we have found the ideal hotel. It is in a nice quiet part of the city. Our room (31) was a great size - particularly for Paris. Everywhere was spotlessly clean. The staff were extremely helpful & attentive and the breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: r0ckhill
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Luxembourg Parc Oct. 31-Nov. 7, 2008, and were most impressed with the accommodations and with the staff. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived, so Fabienne (at reception) served us delicious breads and coffee in the library. Her thoughtfulness was the norm for all members of the staff during our stay; in fact, we have never experienced such at any other hotel. They even allowed my husband to use the computer behind the desk to check e-mail several times while the computer (free) in the library was down. Our room (executive--#31) was lovely; the linens were luxurious; the bathroom was spotless with plenty of room for our toiletries. There was also plenty of closet and cupboard space for our clothes. The lobby is small but beautifully decorated. The breakfast room is also small, but we never had trouble getting a table. The breakfast came with our room (we booked directly with the hotel's own website), so we ate there each morning and enjoyed both the ambiance and the servers who were quite busy but also accommodating. The "library" is a small, beautiful room off the lobby. We enjoyed a glass of wine in front of the fireplace most nights. That was a delightful way to end the day. The location is ideal--away from the noise of the touristy areas, but close enough to walk to most of them. We loved our stay, and we have already highly recommended this hotel to friends who are planning a Paris trip in April.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and Can't Beat the Location”
Reviews.Author: ronToronto
Reviews.Content: We make numerous trips to Paris, but this was our first stay at this property. We booked the most basic room, but found the size adequate, and the room itself very well appointed and clean. Staff were all helpful and spoke English well, although we speak French. The breakfasts were excellent and served by a very helpful and attentive staff-person. We usually stay near the Pantheon, and, while we had thought that you can't beat that area, we were just as happy being right across the street from the Luxembourg gardens. We really have only good things to say about this hotel when considering the room and breakfast, the location, the cost, and the service. Wouldn't hesistate at all to recommend the hotel, and we'll certainly stay there in the future. Ron and Ellen, Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luv2TravelNJ15
Reviews.Content: What a perfect hotel. Excellent location, lovely room (big change for me from previous Paris hotels), good service, plentiful breakfast. Just lovely. The only downside were the dinner recommendations by the front desk. We went to two restaurants, one near the hotel and one closer to the Tour Eiffel. Neither lived up to Parisian standards which was disappointing because it was our two big nights out!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel - 4 1/2 stars”
Reviews.Author: Michael01UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights very recently after much research via TripAdvisor, Frommers and other guidebooks. On this particular trip, we were a family of 7, including three young children plus two senior citizens and we booked our rooms well in advance. We asked for, and received, two adjoining rooms on the relatively quiet third floor plus a third room for my parents. The interior of the rooms was spotless, with recently refurbished bathrooms, period furniture and artwork. Pillows were fairly soft and flat and beds were satisfactory by hotel standards. There was a very nice fitness room with a treadmill, a cross trainer, and a couple of other machines. This was very handy after eating so much good food. Location was excellent, just in front of the Luxembourg Gardens with staff providing good advice on nearby restaurants. On this note, it is worthwhile mentioning that hotel staff were fantastic - perhaps the best we have ever had after years of world travelling, from the unbelievably welcoming reception we received and the attendant bar staff who made lovely, albeit quite expensive drinks (12 euros for a cocktail). The best room by far was the sitting room which has a working wood fireplace, a chessboard, library and dimmed lights. The experience for our children was also excellent and we would highly rate this hotel for families based on our experiences. My parents, both 70 and quite discerning, were also very impressed with all aspects of the bar and front desk service. Our overall feeling of this hotel was that it was absolutely first rate, with one exception - the breakfast, which was included in the price of the stay. The breakfast was very skimpy by European standards and the poor server was run off her feet, operating alone and not afraid to tell anyone who asked! Bacon was advertised but not offered as they ran out and they actually also ran out of eggs on one of our mornings. This made an almost perfect stay slightly less than perfect. If you are looking for a beautiful four star boutique hotel with above average service, and wish to negotiate a reduced rate to get breakfast on Blvd St. Germain, then this is the hotel for you. 4 1/2 stars, with only the breakfast taking away the 1/2 star.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Stay at Hotel Luxembourg Parc”
Reviews.Author: TrixieG
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I stayed here for four nights mid- October and were delighted with our choice to stay here (based on tripadvisor reviews). We were warmly welcomed by Zina who continued to be a great help on a number of occasions. She, as well as other staff members, were more than happy to assist with travel plans, reservations and directions during our stay. They would cheerfully greet us coming and going and were genuinely interested in our excurssions. Also, the cleaning staff were most pleasant and made the effort to converse. The hotel is meticulously clean and tastefully decorated with warmth and comfort. We had a corner room and it was very light and charming. The marble bathroom was large and bright with lovely products. My daughter and I had hot chocolate one night in the library and it was very cosy. In the breakfast room, I appreciated the availability of lattes, fresh orange juice etc with our breakfast. We particularly enjoyed the pain au chocolats , fresh buns and croissants and cheeses - the fruit salad was also very fresh and tasty. The location is indeed stellar and extremely conducive for those of us who prefer to explore on foot. You will discover the Sorbonne, the Pantheon, Notre Dame and St. Sulpice practically on your doorstep. However the Metro and RER were also close by allowing quick access to the Eiffel Tower and further afield. (A note of warning, deciding to get to Versaille ourselves, we were informed by the ticket seller only after we purchased RER train tickets from her for Versaille that the train line was out of service that day. Thus began a 2 hour confusing trek to get there with the Metro and other trains. This is not uncommon for train lines to be out of service so make sure before purchasing at the station or splurge for the hotel's package). There were many choices of restaurants nearby. Intimate Boutique shopping is close in St. Germain as are the more 'common' stores along St. Michel Blvd. We had a lovely stay and would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Our honeymoon stay”
Reviews.Author: TChase
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 4 wonderful honeymoon nights in Paris at this lovely hotel. The employees at the front desk were very nice and super helpful with all of our needs. Our room was small but very clean, and this hotel is in a great location. Grab a coffee and take a walk through the park across the street. PLEASE visit Laurent, he tends bar and is only more than happy to suggest a great cafe, restaurant or jazz club. He was such a great man to talk to. We thoroughly enjoyed his company over a glass of wine each evening and I hope you will too! The breakfast was included in our rate but if we had been paying for it, I would have opted to go elsewhere. It's fine, just very simple for the money. Side note: We were offered help in securing a private car and tour to Versailles at 85 euros per person for 4 hours....Do yourself a favor, take the train (it's really easy and costs about $6), takes about 50 minutes to get there, then is a 5 minute walk from the station to Versailles. Spend the day, walk through the museum, and enjoy the grounds, they are spectacular. Wear comfortable shoes, there is a lot of walking and a lot of great photo opportunities...you can even have lunch and a bottle of wine on the premises. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Snob78
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel Luxembourg Parc could not have been better. The hotel is situated in the 6th arrondisement, right across from the Luxembourg Gardens, where the streets are quiet, clean, and lined with shops. The hotel staff went out of their way to accommodate us, including: finding us an unoccupied room so we could check in prior to the 3:00pm check-in time; calling restaurants to make us reservations; giving us directions to local attractions. Our room was small (typical for Paris) but well-appointed and lovely. The bathroom shower was small but elegant and the shower had great water pressure. I forgot to pack my toothbrush and was elated to see that one was provided in the room. We would definitely stay here again. This hotel is great for younger to mid-aged couples who are looking for a classy hotel with charm and friendly hoteliers. If you are looking for a large, bustling "Leading Hotels of the World"-type of hotel with valet service and a snooty lobby scene, however, this may not be the hotel for you. One last note: Be sure to have an after-dinner drink in the library, which is wood-panneled and has a beautiful fireplace.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: ket6969
Reviews.Content: I arranged this trip to Paris as a suprise for my partners 50th birthday. Because of the occasion I wanted this stay to be really special and thanks to the feedback from previous guests I selected this charming hotel and was not let down. The location is perfect as it is quiet but walking distance to many of the top attractions Paris as to offer. From the moment we checked in we knew this was going to be a trip to remember, we sat at the bar and sipped on perfectly chilled champagne whilst the hotel offered unbiased advice on nearby restaurants, bars etc. The actual hotel is fantastic, rooms our a good size for Paris, well designed, fabulous decorations and well maintained. In addition the housekeeping was excellent. Unfortunately due to unforseen circumstances we had to cut short our trip at short notice, well after the room had been serviced that day. The hotel were fantastic and helpful and waived there normal 48 hours notice cancellaton fee for our last night, thankyou. We will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: tip2p
Reviews.Content: Situated in a fantastic area for shopping (clothes galore) this hotel is small but perfectly formed. Yes the rooms are small - but this is Paris and our room was stunning, immaculately clean and tastefully decorated. The reception staff were polite, welcoming and accommodating. Lounge/ bar area is small but intimate and tis extends into the library area where we had a night cap after our night out. Our room overlooked the side road and was quite. My husband had rung ahead and as a surprise had arranged with the hotel a car from the station, a bottle of champagne and the largest bunch of roses I have ever seen. The hotel had recommended and booked a restaurant for us and were on had to make suggestions of an itinerary for our short stay. We stayed for two nights over a weekend in the middle of October and were fortunate enough to have glorious weather.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Luxembourg Parc - tops for the Paris experience”
Reviews.Author: ToonTowner
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Luxembourg Parc is a great place to stay if you want to feel like you are truly staying in Paris. Its rooms are decorated in traditional French design and not like a cookie cutter hotel room you would find in a hotel chain room. Because of this, youâ€™re going to pay a little more than you would for other hotels in Paris. If you are just looking for a place to sleep while in Paris this is probably not the hotel for you. If youâ€™re looking for something to add to your Paris experience, this is definitely the hotel for you. The hotel is located directly across the street from the Luxembourg Parc. The park itself is a wonderful place to walk through and relax. The staff in the hotel all spoke English and were very happy to help us with any of our needs. While you can choose to have breakfast included with your stay (15 Euros per person), we chose to not to have this option and ate at a small restaurant that was close to the hotel (the combined cost for this was about 5 Euros). While our room was small as compared to a North American hotel room, it would be average for a European room. The room was very clean. The room had a great marble bathroom with a deep soaker tub. The hotel had one computer that had free Internet for hotel guests. The access to the nearest metro station was about a 5 minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Not absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: TheQueenslander
Reviews.Content: The Luxembourg Parc used to be Number 1 on TripAdvisor - the positive reviews are warranted, as it has individualistic rooms with period, lush furnishings and marble bathrooms. There is also a beautiful central courtyard, friendly lobby bar and a charming library with internet access. Breakfast was simple continental with optional hot options, but was served by friendly staff and were ample in portion. Our room was a standard double on the first floor. Firstly it was very small (about 4x4 m + ensuite), had lovely French windows with a view of the Luxembourg museum/park across the road, but with such low windows, passers-by got a good view in. Paintwork and furniture has had a fair bit of wear-and-tear, but soft furnishings were still in good nick. Thought the bulldog gift was cute, but no tea making facilities. It is also about 500 m from any Metro, which all surround the hotel but none particularly near. Good access to the Park, Senat, St Supice, Pantheon and St Germain area is the main positive on the location. The myriad of traveller photos show lovely rooms - ours was smaller than I was expecting, for the $450 per night. No problems with the stay or the staff; just didn't rate it as perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sasdax
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HLP for 3 nights for our Honeymoon choosing this Hotel because of the location and reviews from previous guests. We were not disappointed, after a short walk from the Metro we were greeted by the friendly receptionist who after check in took our case to the room. The room was large and beautifully furnished with a marble bathroom, a nice touch was the complimentary gift of an ornamental French Bulldog and on the 2nd night there was another gift of a perfume room spray which is exclusive to the Hotel. The toiletries were very nice but maybe a little to masculine for some, but I personally liked the fragrance.The room had double aspect windows, one overlooking a limited view of the gardens and one onto the side street. We slept with the windows open and there was hardly any noise until around 6am but that was still acceptable. We booked the extras of a bottle of Champagne and flowers for our arrival and although not in the room for check in were delivered within 30 minutes. We made use of the welcoming, cosy bar area which was tended by a charming gentleman. Breakfast was better than we had anticipated with plenty of choice of pastries, ham, cheese, fruit, yogurts etc. Tea/coffee was served at the table along with a large glass of fruit juice. There was also the choice of bacon and eggs cooked to your requirements at a very reasonable supplement on 2.50 Euros. Most of the time we spoke in phrase book French with the staff repying in excellent English, which was nice, we did feel that our attempts to speak French was well received. The location of the Hotel was good being just a walk away from some of the major attractions, cafe's and restaurants. The are 2 metro's within 5-10 mins walk but we found that the RER line slightly closer walking through the gardens. All in all, we would highly recommend this Hotel and hope to return one day soon.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, Lovely, Efficient”
Reviews.Author: Capetian
Reviews.Content: The is not an all dancing, all singing, baton wielding hotel. It is small, comfortable, efficient, and possesses extremely pleasant and helpful staff. The rooms are a good size, for Paris, well and appropriately furnished. The common areas are small, but extremely comfortable and useable. There is little in the way of view from any window, but that little view is pleasant. The hotel is out of the way enough to be quiet, yet within walking distance of the river. We walked happily to the Bastile and the Musee D'Orsay. The park opposite should not be missed. We took two rooms lately, and have stayed in three of their rooms over the past year, all were delightful, although one of the bathrooms could do with some additional maintainance. Breakfast is basic, but good, with the best orange juice. This hotel is unlikely to appeal to those who like Hiltons, room service (which they do not do) or uniformity. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: SoftwareTraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Lumembourg Parc from August 4th through the 9th. I chose the hotel due to the extremely high ratings on Tripadvisor. The hotel definitely lived up to it's number one rating. This was our second trip to Paris and third trip to France. We arrived in the morning after our overnight flight. The staff was extremely friendly and quickly checked us in. Overall the building was very nice. This is a small but very elegant hotel with traditional decor. The lobby has a well stocked bar with a Espresso machine. The elevator is a glass enclosed lift that overlooks a small welcoming courtyard with a small fountain. We booked a standard room. Typically we book superior or deluxe rooms, but we figured most of our time would be outdoors. I believe the Hotel Luxembourg Parc does have larger rooms available compared to what we chose. The standard room is an expectedly small Parisian room, but very well furnished and comfortable room. The bathroom was well appointed with marble and modern fixtures. This particular room had two twin beds together side by side. They were a bit firm for our taste, but still comfortable. There were plenty of pillows, room to stow luggage, and even a small welcome gift. The hotel is amazingly clean. The hotel staff gets an A+ in this review. All of the staff made our stay very enjoyable. We were assisted with restaurant recommendations and reservations, directions to various destinations, and transportation information. Breakfast was available each morning in the hotel dining room. A selection of croissants, breads, yogerts, cheese, and cereals were available. Staff provided coffee, espresso, juice, and other beverages each morning. In terms of getting around Paris, the nearest metro stop is St. Sulpice, which is a short five minute walk away. The RER B Luxembourg stop is nearby as well as a number of other Metro stops. All of St. Germain and the Latin Quarter is within walking distance. We recommend obtaining a street map and locate the various metro and RER stops in advance. Thanks to everyone at the Hotel Luxembourg Parc. We will certainly stay with you again next time we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on”
Reviews.Author: SwodRam
Reviews.Content: A 3 night stay at the HLP was just as expected - great A bit of a concern choosing the right hotel for parents celebrating their 40th wedding anniversary along with nephews & nieces but overall turned out to be spot on. Not cheap, especially given current Euro/Sterling exchange rate but not overpriced either. The executive rooms we received were all to a high standard and very comfortable. The only downside was a third bed did cramp one of the rooms a little. One of the rooms booked had a superb balcony - perfect for a gathering before & after an evening in Paris. Considering prices in the bar for a beer are over 6 euro's (average for Paris) - why not nip 2 minutes down the road to the shop & get a few of the same in for at just over 1 euro each. Reception staff were extremely pleasant and fortunately for a non french speaker conversed in the English language your average bloke from Nottingham would never be able to grasp. Not a wide choice of breakfast items but those on offer where of a high quality and adequately kicked the day off. Spot on location - most attractions by foot - direct RER from CDG airport to Luxembourg station only 5 to 10 mins walk. The park opposite the hotel is very attractive for a relaxing morning stroll. As for the hotel library as in some previous reviews - who spends time in a library when in Paris? Will be returning to the HLP on my next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful FInd”
Reviews.Author: NYCityRes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Luxembourg Parc for a family reunion in early July. I was impressed by how well the hotel "worked" for all of us, from my 7 yr old nephew to my 70+ yr old parents. Part of the credit goes to the staff who were gracious, friendly and wonderful with the variety of requests we asked of them. The rooms were lovely (well decorated with nice details and for a European hotel room - spacious ). I found the rooms to be very quiet. The library downstairs was inviting. Numerous guests (including ourselves) used the library to gather at the beginning or end of the day. As many have commented, the location is top notch - right across from the Luxembourg Gardens and within walking distance of many of the top attractions of Paris. We will definitely stay here during future trips to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Charming with a great location”
Reviews.Author: callamatisse
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 20 to 24 June in room 36 facing the park. I'll start out with the negatives because there were only a few main ones: the elevator was broken and there really isn't a view of the park. The elevator broke after our first night, so we would come home from a day sweltering in Paris to another few flights of stairs we had to climb. That sucked, but I understand that it was just bad luck. We left before it was fixed. When I booked the room, I expected to have a view over the park. I probably should have researched more, because you get a view of the government building across the street, huge trees and part of a clay tennis court. No big deal, but just adjust your expectations accordingly. You will not be overlooking magnificent gardens. The hotel is narrow, so I can't imagine the view is any different from any other room streetside. The shower was nice, with both a handheld and a rainshower head. I noticed that for some reason the water was a lot hotter in the handheld, so I didn't use it, but I'm a wuss about hot water, so most people would be fine. The toiletries were scented with a fairly masculine scent: Chrome by Azzaro. My husband didn't like the breakfast, but it was about the same as most European breakfasts. If you like yogurt or cereal you'll be fine. I was happy with it. Usually three or four different croissants and rolls, two different loaves of bread for cutting your toast (please use the napkin provided to hold the loaf so your icky fingers don't get all over it! I saw a typical "ugly American" couple holding the bread with their bare hands and I was very grateful I'd already cut my slice off). They have fresh fruit and a variety of teas plus coffee. You can order American breakfast food a la carte, for an additional fee. The pillows kinda sucked and it took us a couple nights to get them just right, but they are your standard down pillows, just not as stuffed as others we've encountered. The bed was your typical European firm bed. Adequate. The room had a nice closet with some shelving, and plenty of drawer space. A desk for writing too. The room was a small but well planned space. We liked this hotel and would stay there again. The staff was very nice and accommodating, and they have a killer gym for a hotel of this size (though I'll admit I was too tired from walking all day to use it, they had one of those cool Power Plates.) The decor is charming and makes you feel very much like you're in an old, elegant home in Paris. You have to walk a little to get to the metro (we used St Sulpice most of the time) but it's not bad at all and there are plenty of restaurants within walking distance. Check out "Aux 2 Olivers:" the best meal in two weeks of traveling Europe. The proximity to the Luxembourg Gardens was a big plus for me. They close fairly early in the evening, so be mindful of the time. We were very grateful for the quiet location when we discovered they were having a city-wide music festival on the 21st. We went out walking into crowds of people near the Pantheon where bands were set up in the street blasting all kinds of music. Very fun! But when you're tired and want to go to bed, you wouldn't want your hotel above that, so we were happy that ours was in a quiet location. A couple we met on a Segway tour (go! it's totally fun!) had their hotel right above one of the bands set up and they didn't stop playing until 5 am! There is no room service, but they have some arrangement for take out from what I can tell. There is no iron in the room, but when we asked to have a couple of shirts ironed, they did it for free and with a fairly good turn around time, so that was nice. If we want to stay near the Latin Quarter again, we'll pick this hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Tim04
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Junior Suite at this hotel, as a birthday treat for my wife. We had considered one of the big posh places, but chose the Luxembourg Parc for its apparent charm and location. It lived up to our hopes in every way! The location is ideal; feels a bit like Chelsea in London. Our room was also very nice, with a great bathroom and comfortable sitting area. The hotel booked us a table at the nearby Petit Cour, which is a lovely, romantic place where you can sit outside and eat great food and wine. I recommend that you ask for a booking as it gets very busy. The staff are very friendly and helpful - pretty much a perfect place to stay for a cosy weekend in this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel in a lovey area of Paris”
Reviews.Author: locorocoworld
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a special hotel to spend our first night of our honeymoon and I'm glad to say this hotel was perfect! A small but perfectly formed hotel, really friendly staff and beautiful rooms. This is a small luxury hotel, so it doesn't offer as much in the way of services as say the Ritz or the Vendome, but it has everything you really need for a comfortable stay. We booked an executive room, which was quite spacious in Paris terms and beautifully presented. The area surrounding the hotel is wonderful in Spring/Summer - lots of cafes for people watching and plenty of boutiques to window shop. A short walk takes you into the heart of Paris. The RER stops very near the hotel on a direct line from the airport, perfect if you want to save a few â‚¬!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinup72
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris and I wanted to stay in an old world paris hotel with tons of charm! Well after reading all the reviews from trip advisor I booked this hotel and I fell in love it! HLP was wonderful from the minute we checked in. The lady at the front desk was so gracious and even carried our luggage up to our rooms. We had a standard room overlooking the gardens. It was very beautiful and it had 3 windows with two facing the gardens and one facing the courtyard. What I loved was in the evening when we would retire to our room we would crack our window to the courtyard and you could hear the fountain trickling and you could smell the fire from the fireplace in the library. Very relaxing! The staff was super friendly and helpful . I loved the library and the atmosphere and the way the hotel would smell when you would come back from a long day of sightseeing. They had this amazing candle and fragrance in the lobby when you would walk in. I bought a candle and every time my husband and I light it ,it reminds us of Paris! After visiting Paris we realized we were in the best location you could be in, in the City. HLP is within walking distance from so many great local things as well as the Louvre, Notre Dame etc. You are also near a great bus stop that takes you directly to the other great attractions! We will be staying here again and we have already recommended this hotel to friends that are going in November!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: doughertypks
Reviews.Content: All of the prior reviews (except one), are spot on. The hotel is simply wonderful, with a friendly staff, large comfortable rooms, and a perfect location I just want to offer a different perspective on the only bad review listed here. The reviewer complains about the noise from the street level, from room 16. We stayed in the adjacent room, room 17, completely overlooking the Rue de Vaugirard. First, the Rude de Vaugirard, is not a major street. It is a side street. It has two lanes of traffic, and is VERY light at night. It is not a major street whatsoever. And the noise is minimal! We slept fine every single night (well, one night the A/C broke and it got crazy hot, but they did reduce our room rate for that inconvenience). The noise is not loud at all. Do not let the Rue de Vaugirard prevent you from booking here. It's a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “20th anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Adshooter
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 wonderful nights in Paris for our 20th anniversary. We couldn't ask for more in a hotel. The location was superb as we were able to walk to most of the attractions, there was lots of shopping, restaurants, cafes and patisseries in the neighbourhood as well. The Hotel has very beautiful rooms with marble baths and they are very very clean at all times. We also enjoyed the library and lobby area. The best part about the hotel though is the staff. They are very freindly and helpful and all of their recommendations were excellent. We have already reccommended this hotel to several friends who are heading over to Paris in the next couple of months.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem”
Reviews.Author: little-lily
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed a 4 night stay here in early April for our wedding Anniversary. The Hotel is in a lovely spot in the fantastic St-Germain-des-Pres area, really convenient to walking to many major attractions like the Louvre and Notre Dame. Although it is opposite the Jardin du Luxembourg the Hotel does not really have a view of it. Having said this, the hotel is beautiful and we were lucky enough to have room overlooking rue Servandoni which is a quiet side street. Our room was beautiful with Louis XV furnishings and a large king bed which was very comfortable. The bathroom was also a good size, marble throughout with a bath and shower over which was very good. The housekeeping was excellent, everything was very clean and the rooms were cleaned and replenished twice a day with fresh towels and facecloths. No tea and coffee making facilities, but the bar downstairs served good coffee, and you do get a mini bar. The reception area, bar and lounge were similarly beautiful, although not large areas they were very up market with beautiful furnishings and very peaceful. The reception staff were helpful, efficient, friendly and most of them spoke great English. They arranged our trip to the Moulin Rouge (highly recommended â€“ fantastic experience) for us. I had also sent several e-mails to them prior to arrival and they were very helpful and replied promptly each time. Breakfast was wonderful. Fresh fruit, cereals, juices, bread, ham, cheese, croissants, butter, jam, pastries and lots of wonderful coffee or tea. The croissants were fantastic and came from the wonderful patisserie Gerard Mulot just round the corner. All set in a lovely breakfast room and very friendly breakfast team. For a treat visit Gerard Mulot patisserie and try one (or more!) of their wonderful cakes, you wonâ€™t be disappointed - they are a work of art. If you leave the Hotel on rue de Vaugirard and turn left you will walk past a lovely French restaurant called Aux 2 Oliviers, which we highly recommend for a wonderful meal (not too pricey) and within short (2 min) stroll from the hotel. There are lots of great places to eat in the area but reservations are probably wise if you really want to go to a particular place. We found some lovely little bistroâ€™s in the evenings (some of them open before 7pm), where we could curl up in the corner with a bottle of red wine and talk the night away, just like the Parisians. The St Sulpice metro is right by the hotel (at the end of rue Servandoni). The trains are quick and efficient and recommended, especially the metro. You can whiz around the city in no time. We flew in from Southampton airport to CDG and took the RER to Luxembourg Parc. We were fine as only had hand luggage, but it would be a trek if you had many cases. Itâ€™s a long way down to the RER station at the airport, trains can be crowded and itâ€™s a short walk across the park to the hotel. Lovely in the sun, we enjoyed it! I donâ€™t think we could have asked for more. It is the perfect place to enjoy Paris from, with good size rooms, comfortable, elegant and good value for money. If you plan well ahead you can get a good deal by booking with the hotel in advance on their â€˜Earlybirdâ€™ rates. We paid â‚¬230 per night for our Superior room in April, but could have got it cheaper if weâ€™d booked even further ahead. If quality accommodation is important to you but you donâ€™t want to pay George V prices then this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful front desk”
Reviews.Author: Totham
Reviews.Content: This is good hotel in a quite and convenient spot near to many of the main sights and metro also nearby. The staff speak English and are most helpful booking restaurants etc. Its pricey ,we had deluxe rooms but worth it, would not hesitate to go there again

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PrinceyNaz
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel from the reviews off Tripadviser, it didn't disappoint. Its located a short walk from the Luxembourg station which we caught the train to straight from CDG and back from for a cool 20 euros return for 2. Its position in a perfect location for walking to all the sites and has everything you could need. In short, lovely place, great position, good price.

Reviews.Title: “Came for the (nonexistent) view, loved everything else”
Reviews.Author: toolworker
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here, although not for the reasons I expected. Lured by the prospect of a view of Luxembourg Garden, I booked a standard room (all with views overlooking the gardens, according to their web site). Once there, I saw that the view consists of the back of the Senate building and some very tall trees. Possibly the rooms on the top floors might see something of more interest, but the only standard room then available, on the first floor above ground level, offered not much besides traffic noise, from two directions. Just as well, then, that the hotel had upgraded us to a superior room, on the same level but facing the picturesque side street, with minor traffic noise that was tolerable except for the morning trash collection. But never mind all that. Our stay was pleasant from start to finish, beginning with the staff's cordiality during the discussion and inspection of room alternatives. (Recommendation: Ask for a high floor room when you make your reservation.) Our superior room was large for Paris, and beautifully traditionally furnished. The bathroom had classic marble styling but a modern tub/shower with a constant temperature control that really worked, and separate faucets for the rainforest shower and the telephone showerhead. We were quite happy with the selection of delicious fresh French breads and rolls, one of the delights of morning in Paris, so we never tried to order an egg dish for an extra couple of euro. Others have noted that the selection doesn't compare to an international hotel buffet, but it was fine for us. The weekend server provided French cafe au lait, but the weekday lady, who spoke little English, brought us weaker American style coffee even when asked for cafe au lait. The location, across from the gardens and near many restaurants, was fine for dining, great for strolling in the gardens, and a pleasant five minutes walk to the student quarter and fifteen to the touristy area near the Seine. So we got to enjoy restaurants frequented by locals, in a very nice neighborhood, with no t-shirt shops or tourist trap restaurants (but an easy walk to them if desired). I am convinced that almost every hotel in Paris is three or four blocks from a Metro station, not closer, and this one was no exception. For a pleasant, comfortable visit to Paris, this hotel is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Pipster37
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Luxembourg Parc April 9-15. It was wonderful. We got there very early 10:00 am and I was very sick from the plane. They offered me something to drink and made us comfortable in their library room. Our room was ready in 10 mins. We really appreciated it. Some nights when we came in from the cold they offered to light a fire. They were excellent with directions and making reservations. Very attentive staff. Can not beat the area, close to everything. We stayed at their other hotel. Hotel La Perle two years ago and that was fine also. We were there for our anniversary and everyone made us feel special. Would highly suggest it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Boutique Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Alexandria Traveler
Reviews.Content: The review title says it all. Hotel Luxembourg Parc was exactly what we were hoping for, and precisely the type of hotel we try to book when on vacation - intimate (I believe they have 24 rooms), very well appointed, and centrally located. As a side note, this is the fourth place we've booked based on TripAdvisor reviews, and all four have been exactly what we were hoping for - I'm definitely a fan of the site.

Reviews.Title: “Check in early !!!”
Reviews.Author: moricco
Reviews.Content: As we decided with my wife, just a few days before coming over to Paris, to spend 1 night in this hotel, I directly called them to book a room. I was also looking at the hotel's website while speaking on the phone with a member of staff. Unfortunately (and as expected), there was only one double bedroom left (the cheapest one). Although it looked very nice on the website, the room was apparently facing the Luxembourg Park, and as a consequence the main street (rue de Vaugirard). Feeling that I was slightly hesitant on the phone, the attendant kindly assured me that this last room was on the 4th floor, thus it was not noisy. I then decided to go for it. On D-day (a Saturday), we arrived with my wife around 5.30pm at the hotel. But...big surprise: the room we were offered was on the first floor, and this was apparently the only one left! The room (FYI number 16) was quite tiny, VERY noisy (due to the rather heavy traffic on the main street), and we could feel that people walking on the sidewalks could see everything in the room, as it was on the 1st floor with 'low' windows. The condition of the room was mainly 'kind-of ok', but when looking closely at the furniture, small details were showing that all of it was a bit worn out. Overall, this was far from reflecting the price I was being asked for, and above all this was not the room I had initially booked! I told the attendant (who was not the same one I spoke with on the phone a few days before) that I had specifically booked by phone a bedroom on the 4th floor. The attendant did not see any notes of this requirement on his booking schedule (!?), and admitted that the same room on the 4th floor had been taken by other people who had arrived earlier than us on the same day!!! Very surprising room management from a 4-star hotel, don't you think? Seeing that we were rather disappointed by what we ended up with, the understanding attendant decided as a gesture to reduce the rate by 20%. However, with my wife we refused this offer, as we thought that even a cheaper rate will not help us forget a sleepless night in a noisy room (we speak from experience). Hence about 10mn after checking in, we left the room and told the attendant that finally we did not want to stay. We explained that there was clearly a mistake made on their side: the staff should not have given our room to somebody else, only because these people arrived first. He reluctantly agreed not to charge me for the night as I obviously had given my credit card by phone. We finally went to another hotel where we stayed in before (Mercure, Accor group).
