For exactly the same price, we had an Executive Room (very quiet, twice the size of the room at the Luxembourg Parc) with a fantastic breakfast included. Anyway, as a recap: - Make sure (if you can afford it) to book a room NOT facing the street, - If you have specific requirements while booking, make sure that the staff take them into account, - Just in case, don't check in too late in the afternoon...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, we recommend you at all”
Reviews.Author: Coolmark
Reviews.Content: Hello! we went to Luxembourg Parc hotel last week and, as usually we travel we like to share our good and bad experiences in the hotels we are, we want to make a good review of this hotel. Our review of this hotel is good, staff is very helpful. Firstly, we did the reservation through ww.gumtrip.com and we had a problem, then we had to modify and between the hotel helpfullly staff and gumtrip.com helpfully staff as well, they modified my reservation without problem. The rooms are comfortable as well. We were in a double one and it was spacious. The food on the restaurant is high quality and the staff working in there is very professional as well. In general I can recommend this place because is a good hotel to acommodate when you go to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Touring”
Reviews.Author: 2FlyingYorkies
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in Room 11, an "Executive" class room. The room looked just like the photos on the website. It was in the back of the hotel overlooking the center inner courtyard and was nice and quiet - there was no noise from the street in front of the hotel. The room was clean and had a large armoire for storage of suitcases and clothing, so the small size (clarification, big for Paris, small for America) wasn't a problem. We visited the breakfast buffet one morning and it was decent, but was not replenished when food ran out, so make sure you go early to get the best selection. The staff were quite friendly and all spoke English well. They were able to give good dinner recommendations for the area. The neighborhood around the hotel is full of boutique shops that were fun to walk by on our way to the Metro each day. The Jardin du Luxembourg was also fun to explore. All in all, this was a nice hotel to stay at in a great location for our visit in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly superb, 2 minor gripes”
Reviews.Author: Pressure_Drop
Reviews.Content: Luxembourg Parc is well worthy of it's no. 1 rating on tripadvisor, the hotel is a beautiful, friendly, intimate gem in a superb location with shops, bars, restaurants and the fantastic Paris metro all within walking distance. The rooms are brilliant, tastefully decorated with a bright, clean bathrooms - only minor gripes and certainly this is something the hotel can't help, is that our room was on the narrow cobbled street down the side of the hotel, directly opposite a small Kiwi restaurant, no trouble with the restaurant itself, it's just that with the new smoking ban which seems to be sweeping across Europe, people now congregate outside of bars, hotels, restaurants etc to have a sly fag - and of course have a chat whilst having a few puffs. Perhaps because the street itself was so narrow and quiet the chat and laughter tended to echo and kept us awake for a couple of the nights until gone one in the morning - like I said, not a fault of the hotel but an unforeseen side effect of the smoke ban I guess. The only other gripe, and again, not serious, as to be honest didn't expect much more from a European hotel, is the average breakfast - it's not cheap so would expect a bit more than the bog standard euro breakfast of rolls, pastries, cold meats and cheese - ok there was fruit salad and yogurts but that's about it, you have to pay extra again for eggs of any sort - and to be honest the service wasn't brilliant as one morning there was no meats and cheese left which was no big deal as I didn't want any, but on the second day I had to ask for fruit salad as that wasn't available either - can't say the service was with a smile either - but then again it's Paris and if you don't get one or two Gallic shrugs and looks of disdain you're not experiencing the real Paris! What really ticks all the boxes though for this hotel has got to be the location, can't think of any where else in Paris which has so many great bars and restaurants on its doorstep - we travelled outside of the area for a couple of meals on the evenings (one to the Eiffel tower) and to be honest, wish we hadn't, as everything you could possibly want for a great night out is within walking distance - Latin Quarter, St Germain and Luxembourg Parc all mingle into one trendy area. It's also a doddle to get to the hotel from Charles de Gaulle airport - line B of the REF network takes about 45 minutes and deliveries you within a 10 minute walk of the hotel for just over 8 euros - and talk about regular, I think there were about 3 in a half hour period, and that was a Sunday - First Great Western (a poor excuse for a rail network in the UK) eat your heart out! Likewise there are 4 metro stations all within walking distance which will take you all over Paris for a fraction of the cost of City travel in the UK, again incredibly fast, safe and clean - makes the London underground look like it was built in the dark ages.

Reviews.Title: “What warmth”
Reviews.Author: largerthanlife-06
Reviews.Content: We were staying in Paris for four days, and I had been recommended this hotel by fried who stayed last year. We arrived in the hotel with a family of four. It is always difficult to ensure a nice welcome for children, ours are 3 and 1 years old, but the staff exceeded any expectations. We were so well looked after and my daughter wanted to stay in her "home in Paris". The hotel is in arguably the best location in Paris, the decor is very nice in an understated way, but the best of all is the warmth and friendliness of the staff! On our next visit to Pars, our daughter will not stay anywhere else, and the rest of us agree! Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: lifeofriley
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our first time trip to Paris. Used Tripadvisor which time and time again has been a great resource. Lux Parc is a gem on the left bank. It is a small, well situated hotel directly across from the Luxembourg garden. A lovely hotel in a very lovely area. Walking distance to great cafes, bakeries (how happy was I to stumble onto Gerard Mulot patisserie just a few blocks away!) and boutiques. Friendly staff. Our room was clean, warm and cozy, the marble bathroom was beautiful. The bed was very comfortable. Our room was on Rue de Vaurigard, which is a fairly busy road, but did not hear road noise at all. A great stay, we will return someday!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastique”
Reviews.Author: michelle_weissbart
Reviews.Content: What a lovely boutique hotel! The HÃ´tel Luxembourg Parc is quiet, quaint, charming, and perfectly located (adjacent to the Luxembourg Gardens in the sixth). The rooms are fresh, attractive, and come equipped with modernized marble bathrooms. Thereâ€™s no better way to end a day of roaming around Paris than with a nightcap in the glow of the library's fireplace. Also available is a lovely outdoor courtyard that I guess serves as an alternative to the library in the warmer months. At the heart of the HÃ´tel Luxembourg Parc is its quality staff: Royce, Mia, and the gang are incredible and so resourceful. Truly, thereâ€™s no better place to stay in Paris. M. Weissbart, NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DCMD
Reviews.Content: Fantastic experience for my first trip to Paris. I speak very little French and the staff was more then accomodating. The staff offered great suggestions and reservations for restaurants, made accomodations for taxis and always willing to go the extra mile with answering questions. The location is excellent for exploring the neighborhoods of the Left Bank. The Luxembourg Gardens is directly across the street and is a beautiful spot to relax on a nice day. I would highly recomend this hotel, believe all the positive reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated, great staff”
Reviews.Author: CRtor
Reviews.Content: Small rooms, tho tastefully appointed. Great library/lounge. Excellent staff - most helpful I can recall in Paris. Great neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel in a nice area”
Reviews.Author: bjorkebo73
Reviews.Content: Great hotel to stay in, cosy, good location, good staff knowledgeable in english. No faults. Cosy rooms, comfortable bed. Clean. Good choice in Paris. I would recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: RW2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights after reading the tripadvisor reviews. I normally book direct with hotels but made the mistake of googling the hotel name and booking through what I thought was the hotel's own website but it was actually the website of HotelsParis. It was no problem but something to be aware of. The hotel is in a beautiful location and the reception staff are all first class and very helful. The night before flying home, I tried to use the communal computer to print out my boarding passes but it wasnt working so the good guy on reception offered to let me use the main reception computer without hesitation. Much appreciated and it would have been easy for him to say something like "sorry, but you can try again later" and these are the samll touches that help make a stay enjoyable and stress free. It was fairly expensive but everything is expensive in Paris and while there are cheaper hotels, you get what you pay for. The location is beautiful and just a short walk to my favourite areas of Paris- St Germain, Latin quarter and Notre Dame. We had the breakfast one morning at 15 euros each and on first glance it seems expensive but it's actually very good value when we had coffee, orange juice and 1 croissant each at a cafe along the the road, the bill came to 18 euros. All in all a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, comfortable and friendly! A very enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jon Potter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights in Dec. 2007 in an executive room (#17) with a queen (2 beds pushed together) bed. Our room was on the first floor and faced Rue Vaugirard (we could see a little of the buildings of the Luxembourg gardens and some greenery from our room). The room's decor was lovely and the room was comfortable but small. It must have been a bit of a squeeze for the owners to fit all the lovely furniture into such a confined space. Our room had a desk and chair, 2 arm chairs and a side table, a bureau (with the tv, mini bar etc) and a good sized closet. Luckily the room had enough hooks and cupboard space to enable us to put most of our gear away. The 2 beds pushed together worked fine as they had a common bed base. The little entry hall area helped create some space too. The bathroom was well appointed and had its own window that looked out to the hotel's internal courtyard. Again, there was enough storage in the bathroom. The shower (in bath) was excellent and the fluffy white towels were appreciated. Even though our room faced the street we found it pretty quiet. The hotel's internal courtyard looked very pleasant and must be a nice place to sit in summer. We did though make use of the hotel's bar and library on the ground floor. The library had a computer with internet access provided free of charge. There was also wi-fi internet access available on the ground floor for no charge but I had some difficulty getting a reliable connection and ended up subsribing to Orange wi-fi (which I could also use in the hotel's communal areas). The hotel's staff were all friendly and helpful. The hotel's location is fairly central. It took us about 7 min to walk to the Odeon metro stop. Whilst there weren't that many cafes and restaurants right on the hotel's doorstep they were many located a little more towards Blvd St Germain. We tended to eat breakfast in nearby cafes but we did enjoy the hotel breakfast on our last morning. The patisseries (sourced from close to the hotel) were excellent, as was the overall choice and quality available. The breakfast room was charming with views out on to the street (and some greenery). We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you meet the weekend night reception guy”
Reviews.Author: crownenvy90
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many 5 star hotels all over Europe and have to say that the hotel itself is beautiful and wonderful but what really made this stay the best of our many years of traveling is the gentleman that works the front desk at night on weekends. He spoke perfect English and was not only extremely helpful but very kind to us as well when we came in exhausted from a day in the rain. And hes a great bartender too! He completely made us feel welcomed and we will always recommend this hotel based on this gentleman's truly *above and beyond* performances. I believe he works the weekends only as we didn't see him when we left on that following Wednesday morning. We are already planning our next trip and are looking forward to another visit with this *Wonderful Parisian Ambassador*. We are older and can pick and choose where we stay and with whom we speak and this guy is a gem. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: NjRuth
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris for a long weekend and know three words in Fr. . .all hotel staff were tri-lingual and were incredibly helpful, warm, fun. This is a classy, sm hotel, w easy access to the Seine, across the street from the Luxembourg Gardens and Museum, lots of great little restaurants nearby. II t was perfect in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in an Excellent Location.”
Reviews.Author: worz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights earlier this month in an executive room, No31, we got a nice deal with the hotels 4 for the price of 3 offer. Our room was very nice, quite large, beautifully decorated with two windows out onto the courtyard, we chose a room here as some people had mentioned noise from the road. We did experience a little noise from other rooms, with people moving things on wooden floors etc. There is a good sized bathroom incorporating a nice deep bath ideal for a soak after a long days walking. Shower was over the bath and nice and powerful, if a little low. I am about 6'2 and I would think anyone taller would bang there head on the shower head. The hotel was lovely, beautifully decorated with very helpful and always friendly staff. In an absolutely perfect location as far as we were concerned. We would return!

Reviews.Title: “A cosy and elegant home in Paris”
Reviews.Author: SpanishHistorian
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Luxembourg Parc (HTP) for four nights at the beginning of December 2007 -- it was absolutely lovely, cosy, and an incredible retreat from the city. Having stayed at other 4 and 5 star hotels in Madrid (the Ritz, for example) and Rome (an overpriced, horrible hotel) -- we definitely thought HTP provided a good value for a high quality accommodation. What is great about this hotel? The rooms are beautiful...absolutely beautiful, well-maintained, and offer lovely details. For example, our Executive Room (which is picture at their site, www.hotelluxparc.com ) still retained much of the original wood-beamed ceiling. It was astonishing to look at it looking up from the bed as the ancient timbers showed a distressed past (termite damage), but they were perfectly restored and integrated into modern, clean stucco ceiling. Simultaneously, you could appreciate the age and hand-crafted nature of building, as well as enjoy the modern conveniences of a perfectly functioning climate control and a clean marble bathroom. The bed's decorative duvet cover was clean and crisp -- and it was not a polyester cloth with a print, but actually a woven cover with embroidery. The walls were handsomely decorated with tasteful art work as if the room were inside a home that had slowly accumulated art treasures from travel. The parquet wood floors were well cared for and dust free. What could be improved? The morning breakfast buffet, as others have noted, was relatively spartan given the price 15 euros per person. But, it is ideal for two occasions. The first morning after your long flight over the Atlantic Ocean from the USA and the last morning before you depart. It provides a dependable, substantive meal in a quiet dining room. And the staff? Almost all of the desk staff are native British English speakers. They are very sweet and as attentive as you wish them to be. They never thrust themselves at you, but rather readily greet you with a Bonjour and quickly pickup on if you need something or simply provide you with a generous smile and send you on your way to enjoy the city. As the weather was a bit cold and rainy during our stay -- they also made sure to offer us the use of their hotel umbrellas. Also, when I originally planned our trip I had accidently booked the wrong dates. This was totally my fault, but after a quick email exchange with the staff before our arrival into Paris -- they efficiently made the booking changes and notified me via email. And, Sara, the front desk lady that assisted me with the booking change, knew who I was when we checked in the first day. I was both touched and pleased to know that she remembered. One more item, there was a mix-up on the mini-bar tab. We did not consume anything from the mini-bar, but the cleaning staff had noted we had drank two beverages. Again, Sara did not even hesitate and took us at our word and did not charge us for these beverages. Sara, and her colleagues, are the ideal hotel staff that all travelers hope for -- attentive, kind, trusting, and friendly. I promise you won't be disappointed. We couldn't speak more highly of the Hotel Luxembourg Parc. We cannot wait for an excuse to stay there again. Lastly, do know that the staff at Hotel Luxembourg Parc is very attentive to reviews at Tripadvisor. After checking out, we mentioned that we had located them through Tripadivsor and again, Sara, noted they were disappointed to learn that a prior traveller had been unhappy with their stay. If you look for that review -- you will see it -- the one relating to an open or unlocked door for three days. Sara very quickly brought up this bad review, which surprised me. I hadn't read it as had been written during our stay at the hotel. She noted that the hotel had not been aware of the issue that the traveller recorded in their review. Further, she was disappointed that the hotel did not know about the problem until after the fact. Her honesty was astonishing because it demonstrated that the staff was (1) genuinely interested in following up on guest reviews and (2) desired to correct the situation. Again, I think this is further evidence of a well run hotel that is intent on keeping its guests happy.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Antal
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel thanks to TripAdvisor - the reviews were so favourable that we could not resist booking here. We got an excellent rate by booking early through the hotel's website and treated ourselves to an executive room. This was beautifully furnished and overlooked the inner courtyard so was very quiet at night, although our friends, in the standard room opposite, overlooking the side street, also found their room very quiet and although it was smaller than ours, it was equally well-appointed. Service was fantastic throughout our stay, and one evening, when we came back with friends to have tea in the library, the staff rushed to light the fire for us which made it even more inviting. Our room rate included breakfast which set us up nicely for the day's sightseeing. Only the weather disappointed us, as it rained most of the time - the hotel thoughtfully provided umbrellas which could be taken from the lobby as needed. The evening turn-down service was a nice touch - no chocolates on the pillow but towels and toiletries were replaced and replenished, and the bedside lights were left on to welcome us on our return. Definitely one to revisit.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: kbhr
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in late November at the HLP. We emailed the hotel direct and reserved a Superior room at 310 euro p/n, about 2 weeks in advance (think in hindsight we might have got a better rate using their websites â€˜internetâ€™ or â€˜last minuteâ€™ rates). Room 35 is a corner room (lift to the 3rd floor) with two windows â€“ the front overlooks Rue de Vaurigard and the side Rue Servandoni (with the Kiwi restaurant on the corner) and nice views. Reasonably sized and tastefully decorated with writing desk, soft lighting and closet in the entrance hall with aircon control. The traffic noise is quite noticeable if you leave the windows open but it was November so we had them closed most of the time and the room was very peaceful. There is a tv, mini bar and safe in a cabinet in the corner. Bed was comfortable with two single duvets (interesting idea, no-one hogs the duvet!). The bathroom was large, bright and clean with a modern heater and a nice deep bath with shower overhead. Reception was always staffed and very helpful, especially Miguel and the French/American chap who also doubled up as barman on the Sunday evening and made my partner a couple of perfect Margaritaâ€™s. He also put on the fire in the library for us and always checked to make sure we were comfortable â€“ great service. There is a pc with internet access in the library and free access from the rooms if you have a laptop with you (lan and wifi), although we couldnâ€™t get a wifi connection from our room on our iTouch. Breakfast was 15 euro each and selection included fresh squeezed juice, tea/coffee, croissants/pan chocolat, cold meats & cheese, yogurt & cereals and cooked (bacon & egg) available for extra supplement (2.50 I think). Went for hotels recommendation of nearby restaurant on first night that was very good. The hotel is in a great location for shopping/restaurants & well positioned for exploring most sights on foot. We walked over to the Marais in about Â½ hour at an easy pace. The metro is nearby if you need to go further afield and taxiâ€™s can be called by the hotel in 5-10 mins. Imagine having the park on your doorstep in springtime would be just perfect. The only mini-gripe for me was that the website listed there was a radio in the rooms but it is actually just some preset stations via the tv (about 6). If Iâ€™d known, I would have brought my little portable radio with me because I was looking forward to hearing the local stations, but the presets on the tv were very bland. It was my third trip to Paris and by far the best hotel choice (thanks Tripadvisor!). Would definitely stay again (but maybe try an Executive Room next time, and try to get a better rate).

Reviews.Title: “EnchantÃ©”
Reviews.Author: DallasRod
Reviews.Content: Saw the very good reviews. Well we spent our time there. Very good base to visit Paris (metro is pretty near). Paris is beautiful just a bit.. too cold. Luxembourg parc has a very helpful staff and the hotel itself is very nice. We were pretty lucky with our room. A couple we met there wasn't like that. We had those napoleon decors and that make it really special. Our time there was just great. Paris is really an amazing city. Need to speak some French. FortunateÃ²y we had some word. Anyway that is an extraordinary city. Much romance.. we'll surely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and charming”
Reviews.Author: alfnat
Reviews.Content: Good friendly service, excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved The Luxembourg Parc”
Reviews.Author: bjtheyankeesfan
Reviews.Content: My husband said it took me longer to chose a hotel in Paris from various websites and guidebooks than it did to buy our condo in Boston! But my 'shopping' paid off - the Hotel Luxembourg Parc was wonderful. From everything I'd read about Parisienne hotels rooms are small - ours was not - it was charming. The bathroom was very clean and lovely in white marble with a fabulous deep tub and large overhead hot-hot shower, big white towels; the combination of the building's original heavy overhead beams made it architecturally dramatic. The front desk personnel were helpful and all spoke English. On a rainy Sunday afternoon after spending the morning at the Louvre and walking Paris all day we ate a romantic late lunch of lapsong suchong tea and crepes on Ile Ste Louis, we bought a bottle of wine and cheese on our way back to the hotel - the front desk made a blazing fire in the fireplace in the library, brought us some crusty rolls from the kitchen and we enjoyed a momentary fantasy of living in Paris - it was the perfect day - the perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarah_MattWales
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, clean hotel with very friendly staff. The staff were excellent and were there to welcome us when we checked in at 4 in the morning ! The hotel was absolutely spotless, the room we had was huge, with a lovely view onto the luxembourg museum. The breakfast was substantial and set us up for the day. The staff spoke english but also allowed us to try our French. There was a very nice bar where you could have a pre or post dinner drink. The location is exceptional, within easy walking distance of the metro and buses. There ar also some fantastic restaurants just around the corner - good, traditional French ones ! We will definitley be recommending this and returning to the hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: StLMissouri2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Luxembourg Parc in the second half of our European vacation. This hotel was simply the best. The front desk was courteous and helpful. A man at the front desk even mapped out different restaurants for us to try in the area and each night we tried a new one. They were all wonderful! Our favorite meals were in Paris!! The front desk spoke perfect English and helped us as we tried to learn the customs and the language. The hotel was in a perfect spot. Right by the metro - walking distance to downtown St. Germain. We walked as much as we could - but the location was wonderful with all the metros. Across the street is the beautiful Luxembourg Gardens. We spent an afternoon walking around and had a mini picnic. Just wonderful. The room itself was small - but beautifully decorated and the bed - good, Lord, the bed ... it was so comfortable! We slept like babies!! The bathroom was a perfect size with great toilettries. The shower was just heavenly! Our room was decorated in Napolean style - very pretty. The hotel was quiet and in a great location. We didn't do the breakfast - it wasn't really worth the price. There are plenty of other places to try right up the street or further in St. Germain. The fitness area was also great! We did alittle work out here and there. Free water bottles! And free internet. We bought football tickets for a game in London before we left Paris. We would definitely stay here again. It was just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Everything About This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelLadyBoston
Reviews.Content: We could not have been happier staying for five days in Paris with the Luxembourg Parc. The hotel is a jewel directly across from the Luxembourg Gardens, near the Luxembourg Parc museum and the Senate. The hotel is small but completely charming, well-decorated, comfortable and elegant The staff are always at your disposal, very efficient, friendly, and knowledgeable. They go out of their way and treat you as though you were a guest in their own home. With only 23 rooms, a small bar in the reception area, a library with free computer use, a small breakfast room on the park, and an exercise room in the basement, the feeling is more like being in a home or inn. There is a small but charming courtyard off of the reception area but it was too cold to sit out there. At night a light lit the fanciful sculpture onto the wall. In general, the hotel has the feeling that everything has been well-thought out but not overdone. We had an executive room on the third floor which was as nice as its photo. It had two large windows opening onto a small courtyard, an armoir area, a desk and sitting chair. The room was decent size and in very good shape. There are lovely details everywhere including the marble bathroom which was a little small but still very nice. The room was very quiet and we felt we had a lot of privacy. Each floor seems to have a similar layout. Our room number was 31 and was similar in size to 21, etc. There is one room in the hotel with a balcony overlooking the park but I understand that the room is smaller. Other rooms overlooking the park or side street might be noisier. On arrival, we had a small gift of a little, cute dog with the hotel emblem. The staff knew their neighborhood well and directed us to very good restaurants including Le Petit Coeur. The neighborhood is lovely. For an urban setting, the park is tranquil and beautiful with its winding paths, Parisians relaxing with each other, interesting and varied statues, and lovely flowers. Families walk by during the day, and the area near the hotel is very chic with beautiful apartments, small interesting shops and varued restaurants. It is a short walk to Saint Sulplice and the Cafes (Deux Magot etc), It is not far to the Seine, the Orsay, the Louvres, Notre Dame and movie theaters. There are many lovely boutiques in the area including some of the big names like Yves St Laurent. We had the 15 euro breakfast once at the hotel which was adequate but not lavish with very nice service. We found that going to the the cafes in the neighborhood more enjoyable although not necessarily cheaper. We would love to return to the Luxembourg Parc and have only the very best to say about this elegant, boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Nige7
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a long weekend at this Hotel where we stayed with friends to celebrate their 20th wedding anniversary. We chose the Hotel as a result of the fabulous reviews on Tripadvisor and booked directly with them. We were not disappointed. This place really is a little gem, with warm and friendly staff, good size rooms and a more than adequate breakfast. The Library is cosy to return to after a day out and about, to sit back relax and enjoy a coffee or something stronger ! Fab location and the staff will point you in the direction of a great choice of restaurants nearby. You must go to the Pantheon nearby to see the pendulum and for Da Vinci code lovers, the St Sulpice church down the road. Without doubt we will return and once again Tripadvisor has not let us down.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LML31
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for part of our honeymoon in September 07 and found this hotel to be a great choice for a first trip to Paris. The staff was extremely friendly and spoke perfect english (although we did try to speak French!). We stayed in a balcony room which was beautifully decorated and roomy for Paris standards, with a terrace overlooking the gardens that was almost as big as our room! There was even a heat lamp provided, so we could sit outside despite the chill. There were several Metro stations a short walk away which provided easy access to all parts of the city. All-in-all, a great place to stay when in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Believe the Glowing Reviews”
Reviews.Author: shep77
Reviews.Content: EXCELLENT location, charming boutique type hotel. Avoids the tourist throngs. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Easy access to many important Metro lines and the RER B from CDG (you can walk from the RER to the hotel...providing you don't have too many bags in tow). The staff is friendly and extremely helpful and well versed in English. The breakfast is pricey but well done. Good sized elegant room with comfortable bed and large bathroom. Our room faced the cobblestoned rue Servandoni with geraniums outside the window. The lovely Luxembourg Park is just across the street. What are you waiting for?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon Destination”
Reviews.Author: degbert71
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel and staff. They are simply the best. We stayed in France for 12 days on our honeymoon, with the majority of that time at HLP. Like others before me stated, they were absolutely helpful and treated us like family. I was a little pessimistic about going to France on our honeymoon and I fell in love with it. Thank you HLP!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: gellura
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel with friendly, attentive staff. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a brilliant little hotel”
Reviews.Author: motherdaughter
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at "lux parc" in Paris. I knew the location was perfect: on the left bank, right next to Luxembourg Parc and down a charming little cobblestone street. The rooms are beautifully appointed; quite large by Paris standards and the views are captivating. We became a bit better acquainted with the hotel staff on this visit. Two of them deserve special mention: Fabienne and Sophia. Fabienne has been with the hotel for several years. She is the quintessential Parisienne. She knows all the corners of the city and had no hesitation recommending places to eat and visit. She happily spoke with us in (perfect) English and indulged me while i practiced my french. Sophia is brand new to the hotel. A young woman from Sweden who is in Paris to perfect her french, Sophia was a most willing and attentive server at the hotel. She was very sweet and obliging with every request. Again, her english was perfect (we thought she was a Canadian) and she happily moved from french to english. I can hardly wait to go back to Paris and to LUx Parc

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious retreat on the left bank”
Reviews.Author: Harborchick
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel in the St. Germain area was one of the highlights of our trip. We could not have asked for more from our 6 night stay. Pleasant staff with a personal touch? Check. Rooms full of historical character? Check. Modern bathrooms with a shower/bath that doesn't spray all over the room like so many European baths? Check. Comfortable beds with luxurious linens? Check. Welcoming bar and lovely library? Check. Hotel in excellent proximity to metro and cafes but far enough away to give you some distance from the tourist grind? Check. Run, don't walk, to make your reservations at this little gem. We will definitely return to this Left Bank oasis across from the beautiful Luxembourg Gardens on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Super place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Neewells10
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our honeymoon at the Hotel Luxembourg Parc and we have to say it was a gem. The room was deluxe and spotless, breakfast although simple and a little pricey was fresh and tasty. The staff were freindly and helpful. We booked a deluxue room which was superb, I think maybe the cheaper rooms are smaller but equally as sumptuous. There is an endless supply of fresh towels etc. It is very central and we walked all over paris from here, I would book a room over the courtyard as they are very quiet and I am not sure how busy the road is at night. All rooms have air con and I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone who wanted a nice Paris break. Do check the price of drinks at the bar before ordering though as they have some very expensive cognacs wich we ordered and consumed before we were told the price! They were however very good so that is merely an advisory note for those on a budget! It is not a cheap hotel but it is very very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Pied a Terre in the City of Light”
Reviews.Author: familytravelz
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel; small, luxurious, quiet, perfectly situated and charming. It is a short and interesting stroll to Boulevard St. Germain along boutique-lined streets. The Odeon Metro line is 5 minutes away and connects to all points of the city via Chatelet or Montparnasse. There is a wonderful neighborhood bakery near St. Sulpice, on the corner of Rue Mabillon and Guisarde, which serves freshly baked breads and pastries if you want to pass on the expensive breakfast at the hotel. For other daily supplies there is a supermarket on Rue de Seine, just beyond Boulevard St. Germain. The front desk staff speak English and are helpful recommending restaurants, local attractions and arranging transportation. By all means, take time to walk around the Gardens across the street and see the famous fountain in which children sail rented sailboats a la Madeleine. St. Sulpice, currently undergoing exterior renovation, is at the end of the cobbled alley that borders the hotel. Rooms are beautifully decorated and functionally outfitted. Double/triple glazed windows keep street noise to a minimum. The marble baths have generous counter space and excellent lighting. The interior designers have done a magnificent job of creating environments that are elegant but comfortable; unique prints and paintings (some artfully illuminated), high quality fabrics, wood floors with Persian carpets and comfortable furniture make a stay here pleasantly homey. There was no iron or ironing board provided, although there was same day laundry service (in by 10am, back by 8pm). With only 26 rooms, the Luxembourg Parc Hotel is a secret pied a terre for travelers to the City of Light.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: JMBWashington
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for seven days in October 2006. Altogether it was a great trip and we will likely stay at the Luxembourg-Parc again in the future. Many positives for this hotel. Firstly, the location is great, right across from the Jardins Luxembourg and within easy walking distance of three metro lines and at least one RER station.(which goes directly to the Charles de Gaulle airport). Many of the sites on the left bank are within a 5-10 minute walk including Rue St-Michel, and even Notre-Dame. The hotel is also quite attractive. Our room, which I believe was an upgrade on the basic room, was not huge, but was very attractive and comformtable. The bathroom was very nice and roomy by European standards. The one slight downside was the service. When booking, we had asked for, and been told we would get, a room not facing rue Vaugirard (which is quite busy/noisy). We ended up getting a room right on that street and were told that we could not switch rooms due to the hotel being fully booked. Apart from that, the front desk service was just OK, with some of the attendants very helpul and others a little less so (for issues such as restaurant recommendations and taxis). Altogether, this hotel is to be recommended, especially for pleasure travellers wanting to explore the left bank.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: flippywebsurfer
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days at this boutique hotel. I had my reservations at first, I am glad that I put them aside because the personnel here are quite friendly and very helpful. The rooms are very clean and comfortable and the bathrooms are generously equipped with toiletries. We only ate once here for breakfast due to an early Versailles day trip but there are many places nearby.

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: Taic4u
Reviews.Content: A beautiful, small treasure of a hotel in a wonderful neighborhood. Easily accessible to all of Paris by foot or by the Metro.
